loans.use: Buy stock like mutton flaps, turkey tails, cigarettes, etc

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: A single mother of two children, Nataliya opened her own clothing sales kiosk in the central market of Kalush one year ago. Previously, Nataliya worked as an employee of another business owner in the market. Nataliya opened her own business with the help of microfinance loans in order to better support her family. Nataliya is lively and hardworking and has successfully repaid all the loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Nataliya is currently seeking a loan for $1200. This loan will help Nataliya to refresh and expand inventory for her clothing kiosk. With the increased profits, Nataliya plans to expand her business and begin renting space for a larger store.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Victoria D. C.. I run a business out of my home selling new clothes and footwear, which I also deliver. I have been doing this for a number of years, and it helps me earn income while also allowing me to tend to my family. Thanks to this business I have been able to help pay the bills and educate my children. Currently, I need to increase my stock since the demand is outweighing the supply, and I need fresh capital to make that investment.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Vicotoria D. C., mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio en mi casa de habitación de venta de ropa nueva y calzado el que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por emcargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingreso y al mismo tiempo me permite atender a mi familia. Gracias ha este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, y gastos de estudio de mis hijos. actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que el volumen de venta es mayor por lo que necesito de capital fresco para tal inversión.

loans.use: Purchase jeans, shirts, tennis shoes, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: 'LAPO has allowed my business to flourish', says Mrs. I. Margaret who lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells bags, shoes and carpetz. She is the secretary of her union and has 7 years' experience in her business. A married mother of 4 children, she is requesting $250 to buy more bags, shoes and carpets to augment her sales and improve her turnover.

loans.use: To buy more bags, shoes and carpets

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en: Solmaz A.  is a 51 yearold woman who grows vegetables in her garden in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Bilasuvar region. Solmaz is an  internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She lives with her husband, four sons and three daughters. Solmaz plants onions and her husband sells them  in the local bazaar. Solmaz has eleven years of experience in this field. As Solmaz and her husband are unemployed, selling onions is the only  source of income to cover their family needs. The onion in very high demand in Azerbaijan. It is used in every single meal. Solmaz has free land and she is going to expand her business and start planting potatoes. To start getting closer to her goal she has applied for a 600 USD  loan with a repayment term 15 month.

loans.use: To expand her planting business

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a married man with two children. He is a 54-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now living in Fuzuli town and settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region.

Hamid operates a general store and has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store

loans.name: Nelva Jesus

texts.es:
Nelva Jesús is 57 years old. She studied up to fourth graD. of primary school and has 7 children, but only 2 still depend on her for support. She lives in the district of Mache, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad.

Nelva has a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner and, in addition to this business, she has a store where she sells groceries, soft drinks and some cooking utensils.

Nelva is a member of the "Mujeres D. Mache" communal bank, and from this communal bank she received her first loan, which she used to buy meat, rice, firewood and other ingredients to make her various food dishes. With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy beer, soft drinks, rice, pasta, oil and other products for her store as well as to use in preparing meals

Her dream is to live and buy a house in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelva Jesús tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió hasta el cuarto grado D. primaria, tiene 7 hijos, pero solo 2 dependen aún D. ella, vive en el distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad.

Nelva tiene un restaurante en el cual venD. desayuno, almuerzo y cena, además D. este negocio tiene una tienda en la que venD. abarrotes, gaseosas y algunos utensilios D. cocina. .

La señora Nelva es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Mache” en este banco comunal recibió un primer préstamo, el cual utilizó para comprar carnes, arroz, leña y otros ingredientes para hacer sus variados platos D. comida. Con el préstamo, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará cerveza, gaseosa, arroz, fideos, aceite y otros productos para su tienda y también para utilizarlos en la preparación D. alimentos.

Su sueño es vivir y tener una casa en la ciudad D. Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.) and soft drinks.

loans.name: Salustiano

texts.en:
Salustino G. has a wife and two young children. He works as a mechanic and is in the business of selling car parts to support his small family. He began the business a while back with a friend, but now runs it solo.

He is asking for a loan today to buy some merchandise for his shop. These include belts, lubricants, truck batteries, seat covers, and engine parts. With these goods, he will be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy batteries, lubricants, belts, and other car maintenance supplies.

loans.name: Saasaai 1 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 9 women of Saasaii on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The women will be using their loans for the following purposes:

Apaula A. (44, divorced, 2 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, filing (knife sharpener), knives and fertilizer to cultivate and sell vegetables including taro, tuamu and bananas.

. Evaga N. (37, married, 2 children): purchase flour, oil, sugar, baking powder, shopping bags and other materials to bake and sell biscuits.

Fonofale E. (42, married, 2 children): purchase a sewing machine, thread and other equipment to make and sell fabrics.

Lafo Saufat (52, married, 4 children) purchase taro roots, tuamu, 2 bush knives, filings, chemicals and a weed-killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro, tuamu and other products.

Leutu T. (59, married, 4 children), Pese V. (52, married, 6 children), Saasaai F. (53, married, 5 children), Toalua M. (43, married, 6 children) and Maofa V. (33, married, 5 children): each purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, filings and a wheelbarrow to grow and sell taro, bananas, tuamu, etc..

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a weed-killing sprayer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
S. Kemi sells artificial hair, clothing materials and watches. She is married and has 1 child. She is running out of stock.

She is asking $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida Parveen is the widow of A. S.. He was the breadwinner of his family. He left his family all alone without any financial support. Zahida B. hasn’t enough money to change her circumstances. She has two sons and three daughters. The eldest sons completed 10th standard and are willing to get more education. The next to them is not willing to get an education. She needs a loan for her tea business. She is out of stock now and is relying on this loan.

Zahida has been joined in her group by a few other women named: Safia B., who wants a loan to expand her juice business. Rashida B. wants a loan to invest in a clinic. Sabra B. wants a loan to expand her computer business. Abida B. wants a loan for her mobile business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their lives by improving their businesses.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mann S. O., age 33, has business selling vegetables in a local market. She typically makes $3 each day. Her husband, NO. Sophal, works at the construction site and earns approximately $3 a day. This couple has two children who are students. They want a loan to raise animals for an extra income to support the family. (Mrs. Mann is pictured with her husband at home.)

loans.use: To raise animals.

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
Bernabé is a father who with much effort was able to educate his children, who now work in the city of Lima, thanks to his labor as a farmer, a profession that has given him much pleasure during his lifetime. Nevertheless now they have the responsibility of educating their two younger children, and for them he wishes to keep on working and improving his agricultural products. In order to do that he needs fertilizer and chemicals for his land. At the moment he doesn’t have the ability to buy these products, so he is asking for a loan to be able to invest in purchasing fertilizer and seeds. He hopes that you are the person who can help him.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Bernabé es un padre que con mucho esfuerzo logró educar a sus hijos, quienes se encuentran trabajando en la ciudad de Lima, esto gracias a su labor como agricultor que le dio en la vida, mucha satisfacción.Sin embargo ahora tienen la responsabilidad de educar a sus 2 menores hijos, por ellos desea seguir trabajando y mejorando sus productos agrícolas, para ello requiere de abono y medicamentos para sus terrenos de cultivo.En estos momentos no cuenta con la capacidad para adquirir estos productos, por ello solicita un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas.Él espera que usted sea la persona que lo pueda ayudar.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina A. has been selling cosmetics such as perfume, creams, and others since 2001. Philomina has received a primary education. She is divorced and has 6 children. She is responsible for paying fees to educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Makhaly

texts.fr: M.Makhaly est un chauffeur de taxi ayant capitalise cinq annees d exercice de la profession. Il circule principalement dans l agglomeration dakaroise et parvient a engranger un chiffre d affaires interessant. il compte reparer son taxi tomber en panne et poursuivre son activite
texts.en:
Mr. Makhaly is a taxi driver with 5 years of experience in his job. He operates mainly in the Dakar agglomeration and manages to generate an interesting revenue. He intends to repair his taxi that's broken down, in order to go on with his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Ester T. from Mwanza, who is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 14. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Ester has been running a pharmacy business since 2000. Working at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and assisted by her husband, she currently earns about $200 per month.

Ester is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more medicine including anti-malaria drugs, panadol, shestcof, and mucolyn. In the future, she plans to open new a business. Ester thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
Katia es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Katia es casada, tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Katia vende ropa en un tienda ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, cuyo local es alquilado, Katia vende ropa solo para niños, mientras que su esposo tiene otra tienda en donde vende ropa para adultos, para lo cual cuenta con empleadas que le ayudan en la atención, Katia y su esposo adquieren su mercadería de la ciudad de Lima.
Katia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que era invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe.
Los sueños de Katia son mejorar su casa y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the Banco Comunal Claveles. Katis is a 28-year-old married mother of a sole daughter. Katia sells clothing in a rented stand situated on a central street in the city of Ayacucho. She sells children's clothing only. Her husband has another stand where he sells clothing for adults and in which he employs help to attend to customers. Katia and her husband acquire their merchandise in the city of Lima. Katia asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of infant's clothing. Her dreams are to improve her home and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of infant's clothing

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Estela S. soy una señora viuda y tengo 61 años de edad, vivo en la colonia 28 de marzo desde hace mas de 30 años, soy una persona luchadora, pero en estos momentos necesito un credito para poner mi negocio a funcionar, es mi primer credito que solicito.
En estos dias es muy dificil conseguir trabajos en empresas entonces lo que uno tiene que hacer es poner su propio negocio, yo me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas de Lunes a Sabado, ya que los Domingos me dedico a vender Sopa de Mondongo, este plato de comida es muy bien vendido en nuestra comunidad ya que es un plato muy exquisito y la gente lo compra mucho. 
tengo todos los deseos de superarme y por tal razon solicito este credito. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Estela S.. I am a widow, 61 years old, and I have lived in the 28 of March neighborhood for more than 30 years. I am a hard-working person, but today I need a loan to open my business, and this is the first loan I am seeking. Today it is very difficult to get work so what one has to do is open one’s own business. I make and sell tortillas Monday through Saturday, and on Sundays I sell Mondongo Soup. This food sells well in our community as it is a delicious dish and people buy it often. I have great desire to succeed and that is why I am asking for this loan. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lime, firewood, salt, water, vegetables, tripe, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de salir adelante. El se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes de pasajeros con un motocarro desde hace 3 años atrás, sin embargo muy a aparte trabaja en una institución muy reconocida en su región, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene contacto directo con sus clientes y darles un buen trato y confianza es lo principal, nos menciona. Le es rentable, ya que él mismo es quien conduce su motocarro y es quien administra las ganancias. Es su 4to préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser una persona responsable. Con el dinero que solicita reparará su motocarro que sufre algunos desperfectos, también quiere arreglar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three school age children, who are his motivation to get ahead in life. He has been providing public transportation services via motorcycle taxi for 3 years. He also works in a well-known establishment in his region. He states that what he likes about his job is being in direct contact with his customers and providing them with great service; trust is of the essence. His business is lucrative because he himself drives the motorcycle taxi and manages the finances. This is his 4th loan with MFP, having demonstrated that he is a responsible person. With the money that he is requesting, he will repair his motorcycle taxi, which has some defects. He also wants to repair his house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Mme Korotoumou est âgée de 31 ans, et vit dans une famille monogamique avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Wala-Wala de la préfecture de koutiala ( région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Korotoumou n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études primaires, pour cela elle s’initia aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour l’chat- vente des fruits et légumes depuis maintenant 10 ans. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en qualité et  en quantité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya 3 ans. Après  5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe ) tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 1er prêt  individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 paniers de banane,  5 paniers de papaye et autres. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de koutiala, et effectue sa vente au comptant et à credit au grand marché de koutiala  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et hommes.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts,  participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of two children, Ms. Korotoumou is 31 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Wala-Wala district of Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region). For social reasons, she did not have the chance to continue in primary school. And so she started working to earn an income at a young age. After having done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she chose in the end to do commerce in fruit and vegetables ten years ago.

To satisfy customer demands for quality and quantity, she decided to turn towards the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After five solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is on her first individual loan. With this loan, she plans to buy 10 baskets of bananas, 5 baskets of papayas, and more. Supplies are gotten from the different weekly fairs of the villages surrounding Koutiala. She makes her sales, cash or credit accepted, at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, to customers composed of women and men.

She intends to realize an average profit of 70,000 francs CFA per month that she envisions using to repay the loan interest, to help cover day-to-day family expenses, and to invest the rest in other income-generating work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya est composé des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans le village de N’Tobougou dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux. Le village de  N’Tobougou fait partie de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Elles se sont connues à travers les activités agricoles hivernales et exercent essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires. 
Pour développer leur commerce et générer plus de profits, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 500kg de sel de cuisine, 80 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi, 200kg de feuilles de baobab séchées et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Une partie de ses  produits est achetée sur le marché de Dioïla et l’autre partie dans le village de N’Tobougou et environs. Tous les produits sont revendus sur le marché de N’Tobougou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Ces femmes espèrent avoir 20 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune qui sera utilisé pour renforcer  leur activité.
texts.en:
The Badenya group is made up of married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children. They live in the village of N’Tobougou, in extended traditional families, with sisters, brothers, children, and husbands. The village of N’Tobougou is located in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through winter farming activities, and mainly deal in selling food condiments.

In order to bolster their businesses and make more profits, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). Previous loans were repaid without problems. These women intend to buy 500 kg of salt, 80 packs of 100 "Maggi" bouillon cubes, 200 kg of dried baobab leaves, and a large amount of various condiments. These products are purchased in part at the Dioïla market, and in part in N’Tobougou and in the surrounding villages. All goods are resold at the N’Tobougou market, for cash or on credit, to a female clientele. These women hope to turn a profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40) each, to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail condiments (salt, bouillon cubes, dried baobab leaves ...)

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda has been managing a hog-raising business in her village for almost four years. She generates at least PHP 5,000 every 3 - 4 months after selling the hogs.  Due to lack of financial capital to maintain her hog feed, Lucinda wants to borrow PHP5,000 only for sustenance so that she can continue to send her daughter to college and let her finish her chosen course.
 
Lucinda is already 52 years old. Her husband Irineo is a laborer in their village. They are blessed with three children: Abrey Joyce, 29 years old and married; Loida, 24 years old; and Cherry, 20 years old, who is in her second year of high school. Cherry is striving to finish her studies for the sake of her parents who sacrifice a lot to send her to school.  Lucinda is hoping to somehow live a progressive life through maintaining their hog-raising and farming businesses, which are their primary source of income for the needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola A. travels to Lagos to purchase bags, shoes, and jewelry to sell in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more bags, shoes and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es: Esthela de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien es albañil, y con sus tres hijos que ya son adultos, solteros y trabajan. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales (mangos, naranjas, melocotones, entre otras variedades típicas de la selva), este negocio lo tiene al frente de su casa en un espacio de su terreno. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque gracias a su buena atención se ganó el cariño de muchos clientes con quienes comparte amenas conversaciones, además le es muy rentable porque por donde ella vive es la única persona que vende estos deliciosos productos. Más adelante quisiera mandar a construir un kiosco adecuado para su negocio. Con MFP ya tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas tranquilas y desarrollan sus labores coordinadamente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas, y de esa manera implementar su negocio con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Esthela is 45 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and with her three children, who are adults, single, and work. For the past 8 years she has worked in the sale of local fruits (mangos, oranges, starfruits, among other local varieties from the jungle). She runs this business in front of her home in a space on the ground. She likes her work a lot because thanks to her good attention she has won the affection of many clients, with whom she holds pleasant conversations. Also, it is very profitable because where she lives, she is the only person who sells these delicious products. In the future, she would like to order the construction of a dedicated kiosk for her business. With MFP she has already had 8 loans, and she likes working with the community bank because all of its members are calm people and they do their work in a coordinated manner. The money that she is asking for would be invested in the purchase of more fruit, and by this manner she would set up her business with a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Sully Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Sulli Vanesa es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñay del Distrito de Puno, Provincia y Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Barrio Victoria de la ciudad de Puno, y cuenta con estudios de superiores – contabilidad (no concluido).

La señora viene trabajando con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de articulas de primera necesidad.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, le permitirá incrementar y surtir su negocio, comprará jugos, galletas, fideos, embutidos, gaseosa y golosinas. Su mayor deseo es culminar su carrera y poder trabajar independientemente.
Lo que más le gusta de suBanco Comunal es el cumplimiento de las socias y la armonía que existe dentro su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sully Vanesa is a member of the Wiñay Communal Bank in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 22 years old, single, and has one son. She lives in the Victoria neighborhood in the city of Puno and is working on university studies in accounting. She has worked with Kiva partner The Manuela Ramos Movement for three years and began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business selling essential products. With this loan of 1,500 new soles, she will be able to expand and stock her business. She will buy juices, cookies, noodles, sausages, sodas, and sweets. Her greatest wish is to finish her studies and be able to work independently. The things she enjoys most about her communal bank are the successes of the members and the harmony that exists within the group.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy juices, cookies, noodles, sausages, sodas, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Delfina Paztrana

texts.es:
La Sra. Delfina L. tiene un salon de belleza que opera bajo el nombre de salon de belleza MIXE, este negocio le genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos familiares. ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y ha sido muy buena administradora del mismo ya que se le nota el progreso que tiene su pequeño negocio.
ella tiene  mucha clientela ya que la atencion que les brinda es especial, y les gusta mucho los cortes de pelo y las aplicaciones de otros productos que ella realiza, ademas el precio no es muy alto y por eso tiene mucha clientela, ella atiende su negocio personalmente.
ella tiene 4 hijos, es muy feliz con su familia.
ella solicita el credito ya que necesita comprar estos productos a precio de mayorista ya que son un poco caros y comprando varios se pueden tener mejores ganancias, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Señora Delfina L. has a beauty salon called "Belleza MIXE." This is how she earns an income to cover her family's expenses. She has done this for six years and has been a very good manager of her business since it has progressed. She has a lot of customers, and she offers meticulous service. She likes cutting hair and the applying products. Her prices aren't very high, and that is why she has a lot of customers. She personallly attends to her business. She has four children and is very happy with her family. She is requesting a credit since she needs to buy products at wholesale prices because they are a little expensive. Purchasing various products will help her earn more profits, and that's why she's requesting the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shampoo, scissors, hair clippers, dye, conditioner, oil, and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional chicks in bulk.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, a 60-year-old married father of two, has been working as a taxi driver  servicing the surrounding areas since 2005. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car so that he can continue his business.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift O. is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She is a hairdresser and also sells hair extensions and cream to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía tiene 39 años, vive con sus hijos: Jean Pierre de 19, Martín de 14 y Ángel de 13 años en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de equipos de conversión a gas GNV, los cuales son utilizados para convertir los motores de los carros de gasolina a gas natural, haciéndolos mucho más ecológicos y ahorrativos. Por esta razón, su clientela va en aumento, ya que todos quieren transformar sus vehículos a esta nueva modalidad. Sofía compra estos equipos de una reconocida empresa, la cual le ofrece calidad a un buen precio, es por eso que se siente muy feliz porque sabe que su negocio irá progresando más y más, con la ayuda de sus hijos y poniéndole todo el empeño que la ha traído hasta donde está. Para el futuro quiere establecerse mejor e incursionar en un nuevo negocio, el cual pueda realizar desde su hogar, Sofía está pensando en terminar la construcción de su casa e instalar unas cabinas para brindar servicio de Internet y un centro de llamadas, este sueño lo espera cumplir pronto. Es su tercer préstamo individual con MFP y se siente mejor con este tipo de trabajo, ya que no dispone de mucho tiempo para reunirse con un grupo. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más equipos para la venta y otra parte la invertirá en terminar la construcción de su vivienda para ir acondicionándola para sus cabinas de Internet.
texts.en:
Sofía is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her three sons: Jean Pierre aged 19, Martín aged 14, and Ángel aged 13.

Sofía sells equipment to convert car engines from running on petrol to engines running on natural gas, which makes them much more ecological and economical. For this reason she gets more and more customers, since they all want to transform their cars to this new propulsion system. Sofía buys this equipment from a renowned company, which offers her high quality at a good price. She is very happy because this opportunity allows her business to keep on growing. Her sons help her and their combined efforts have led them to their current situation.

Sofía's plans for the future are to improve her situation and start a new business that she can run from her home. She plans to finish the construction of her house and install a few cubicles in which she will provide Internet services and operate a call center. She hopes to realize this dream soon. This is her third individual loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She prefers this type of loan, as she hasn't much time to meet with a group. Sofía will use her loan partly to buy more equipment for sale and partly to finish the construction of her home and prepare it for her Internet stations.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory and prepare her house for a new business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is forty-five years old. She is married and has six children. Her four sons and two daughters are all school-aged. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda, in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Efua works very hard to support husband and provide for her family. Efua purchases moderately priced smoked fish from nearby towns and then trades the fish in her community.

Efua has been in business for over five years now and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has five school-age children.They are from the village of Baylag, Mambajao Camiguin. Victoria has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4000 PHP.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Victoria's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Juana Mercedes M. tiene 60 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que su record crediticio es muy bueno.  Es una mujer casada y con su esposo tiene 2 niños que están a su cargo. La actividad económica de Doña Juana es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Los problemas que ha enfrentado Juana son de salud ya que debido a su edad es muy difícil tener la agilidad para servir a sus clientes, pero esto no le impide el seguir adelante. Pero por siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma con sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pan, verduras entre otras cosas útiles para el hogar. Su deseo es mejorar su salud para continuar con el negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Mariama D. sells prepared food. She buys foodstuffs, cooks meals and sells by the plate to residents of Virginia, a community north of the capital, Monrovia, in Liberia. Mariama is 26 years old and married with a 7-year-old child in kindergarten. Mariama is a 3rd grade drop-out due to the Liberian civil crisis. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot.

Mariama has been running her business for two years and hopes to start a restaurant in the future. Mariama's problem is shelter because, when it rains, there is nowhere for customers to sit and eat. She talks nicely to her customers and always cooks delicious food for them, to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase foodstuffs like oil, rice, cubes, salt, pepper, etc. in order to serve her customers. Mariama depends on her business to pay her child's school fees and to take care of her daily needs. She dreams of improving her standard of living and continuing her education to the highest level.

"God Is In Control" is a group of five borrowers led by Mariama D..

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like oil, rice, cubes, salt, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane C. owns a motorcycle and uses it for her transportation business. She is 28 years old and lives in Panglao, Bohol. She has three children. Her eldest is 11 years old. She started this small business in 2007. At the same time, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help finance her business. Now she would like to request a loan of PHP 12,000 to continue with her business and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: To finance the business

loans.name: Reygie

texts.en:
Reygie A. is from the village of Tagpangi, a part of Cagayan de Oro City on the southern island of Mindanao. She is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. Reygie owns a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and products for daily use to the local community as her new business. Reygie has been in business for over five years, before she engaged into buying and selling of fruits in their village and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Reygie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Reygie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, her fourth loan from HSPFI, to invest in her new  business the sari sari store. She recently finished repaying a loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to buy additional inventory . With the additional revenue generated from this loan, she plans to continue expanding her sari sari store business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo N., 44, resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and 18 year old child. To make a living, she and her husband buy and sell cows, earning an income of about $8.90 per day.  Her husband helps his wife in the business every day.  They seek to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income.  N. is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase more cows to resell.  She hopes to make more profit when she retails them to customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: Buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Yo Reinare Group

texts.es: El grupo “Yo Reinare” esta representado por la señora NeiD. y conformado por 16 miembros dentro D. las cuales todas ellas son madres D. familias dedicadas a sus familias y a su trabajo, la gran mayoría D. las socas se dedican la venta D. comida, promotoras, pan y el resto se dedica a a actividades como la sastrería, albañilería, música, transporte publico y al servicio D. peluquería.  La competencia en su rubro es alta pero los socios trabajan duro para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias, El crédito será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería insumos y herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar mas aun la calidad D. vida D. sus familia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias conocen la modalidad D.  créditos solidarios debido a experiencias en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital con la a la que están muy agradecido por el apoyo y la confianza D. brindada.
texts.en:
El grupo “Yo Reinare” esta representado por la señora NeiD. y conformado por 16 miembros dentro D. las cuales todas ellas son madres D. familias dedicadas a sus familias y a su trabajo, la gran mayoría D. las socas se dedican la venta D. comida, promotoras, pan y el resto se dedica a a actividades como la sastrería, albañilería, música, transporte publico y al servicio D. peluquería. La competencia en su rubro es alta pero los socios trabajan duro para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias, El crédito será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería insumos y herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar mas aun la calidad D. vida D. sus familia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias conocen la modalidad D. créditos solidarios debido a experiencias en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital con la a la que están muy agradecido por el apoyo y la confianza D. brindada. The group, “Yo Reinare,” is represented by Mrs. NeiD. and is maD. up of 16 members all of which are mothers of families, dedicated to their families and to their jobs, the majority of these members sell food, do promotions, and make and sell bread, and the rest spend their time in other activities such as, tailoring, brick building, music, public transportation, and beauty salon services. They are very competent in their fields, but they work hard in order to grow their small businesses since the livelihood of their families depends on them. The loan will be used to purchase raw materials, merchandise, and necessary tools for their work in order to proviD. a better quality of life for their families. Regarding their experience in these matters, these members know the nature of mutual liability loans due to prior experiences they have had with similar institutions at Agrocapital, an organization with which they are extremely grateful for the support and confidence they have offered.

Translated from Spanish by Shane Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Jesús Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 52 años, vive con sus hijas en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la atención en su tienda y se encarga del abastecimiento de la mercadería, no le gusta que falte nada, de esta manera trabaja todos los días sin descanso con el  fin de seguir adelante y progresar, recibe en ocasiones la ayuda de una de sus hijas y disfruta de lo que hace porque  es un espacio donde puede socializar con sus clientes, y esa es  su gran satisfacción, para el futuro  desea tener una  gran tienda con mas cantidad y calidad de mercadería.Es la  sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y es una de las socias  que siempre cumple responsablemente con cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero  solicitado lo utilizará en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old. She lives with her daughters in a house that is her own. For 11 years, she has dedicated her attention to her shop and she is in charge of the supply of merchandise. She does not like to lack anything. In this manner, she works everyday without rest with a goal to get ahead and progress. On occasion, she receives the help of one of her daughters and she enjoys what she does because it is a space where she can socialize with her customers and that brings her great satisfaction. In the future, she wishes to have a big store with greater quantity and quality of merchandise. This is the sixth opportunity for her to have a loan with MFP and she is one of the members who always meets every one of her payments responsibly. The money requested will be used for the purchase of a great quantity of merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre de 04 hijos, ya independientes.

Modesta, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y gelatinas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 150.00 y empezó comprando 04 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Modesta, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Modesta, 64, is a member of the "Mi Sueño" communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is married and has 4 independent children. Modesta is a hard-working, tenacious woman, who decided to set up her own soft-drink and gelatin snacks business from an area in her house specially set aside for this purpose. She runs her own business without a boss or a set schedule. She tells us that she began with 150 soles that was enough for 4 cases of soft-drinks to see how she'd do. As she saw that she did well and that she needed more stock, she invested a little more. Currently, she continues in this line of work and she's known to her customers, who are her neighbors, family members and acquaintances. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy more stock beverages like: soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes, and brands as well as still and sparkling mineral water. Modesta has many goals still to reach and she is very motivated to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help; she is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Simuzar

texts.en:
Simuzar is married and has 2 children. Her family lives in the Fuzuli region. She was born in 1960.

She has been in this business for 7 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy necessary things for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy necessary goods for her cafe.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA EMILIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE VACAS AL POR MAYOR Y MENOR. LA SEÑORA LLEVA MAS DE 10 AÑOS EN EL OFICIO, ELLA VIVE EN UN PRECARIA CASA DE BARRO Y PIEDRA, YA QUE LOS ANIMALES QUE TIENE LOS TIENE EN CORRALES ECHOS DE BARRO. LA SEÑORA VIVE CON SU ESPOSO QUE ES ALBAÑIL Y SUS HIJOS, SE LE OTORGO EL CREDITO CON FONDOS KIVA PESE A LOS PROBLEMAS QUE TIENE CON LAS INCLEMENCIAS DEL TIEMPO DE QUE SU CASA POR LAS LLUVIAS SE PUEDA DERRUMBAR. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA AMPLIAR MAS SUS CORRALES DE SUS ANIMALES.EN LA FOTO SE PUEDE VER A SU ESPOSO DE LA SEÑORA YA QUE ELLA ESTABA RECOGIENDO ALFA PARA SUS VACAS.	

LA SRA. EMILIA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Emilia sells cows wholesale and retail. She has been doing this for over ten years. She lives in a meager house made of mud and rocks. She keeps the animals that she has in corrals made of mud. She lives with her husband, a bricklayer, and their children. She got a loan from Kiva because of the problems that she has with inclement weather. Her house could collapse because of the rains. The loan is to enlarge her animal corrals. You can see her husband in the photo because she was gathering alfalfa for her cows. Emilia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase work capital

loans.name: Faapale

texts.en:
Faapale T. is 55 and married with 10 children (ages 19 - 35).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Faapale has many years of experience in this business.  Faapale needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faapale joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faapale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faapale T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Nasroding

texts.en:
Nasroding D. is from the village of  Talakag Bukidnon. She is 22 years old. Nasroding is single. To make a living, Nasroding owns & operates a specialized retail store selling personal products such body powder, baby oil, clips, watches and more in the local community. Nasroding has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nasroding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Nasroding has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nasroding is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nasroding from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Barbys Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento LAS BARBYS, son un grupo D. señoras y un varón, que trabajan en otras entidades financieras, son un grupo con experiencia en crédito grupal D. buenas referencias, en su mayoría promotora D. cosméticos, comerciantes y el varón es guardia D. seguridad. 

La Sra. Margarita es la Presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta y promoción D. cosméticos para varones como para damas, es madre soltera con 3 hijos 2 D. ellos en edad escolar, recibe la ayuda D. su madre en el cuidado D. sus hijos mientras ella trabaja, vive en su casa propia con una modesta construcción,  la ayuda que brinda a sus hijos esta respaldada por el padre D. ellos ya que entre ambos empujaran hasta verlos profesionales, una persona muy seria con el trabajo y en la conducción del grupo, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos por promocion.

La Sra. Candelaria es la Secretaria del B.E. ella es una persona mayor con un carisma y buen sentido D. humor, ella trabaja como promotora D. cosméticos, tiene su casa donD. vive con sus hijos que tienen sus familias propias y con el ultimo hijo que depenD. D. ella desea sacarlo profesional ya que los otros 2 hijos le fallaron y se casaron muy jóvenes dejando sus estudios, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion y despues venderlos al precio original.

La Sra. Faustina es la Tesorera del grupo, madre soltera tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, vive en una casa alquilada su actividad principal es la promoción D. cosméticos, producto D. su trabajo esta próxima a comprarse su lote D. terreno y empezar a construir su propio domicilio a cobijara a sus hijos como a ella misma, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion y despues venderlos al precio original y tener muy buenas ganancias.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The community bank, Las Barbys, are a group of women and one man. They have worked with other financial associations, and they are a group with experience in group credit with good references. The majority sell cosmetics or are merchants, and the man is a security guard.

Sra. Margarita is the president of the group. She sells and markets cosmetics for men as well as for women. She is a single mother with 3 children, 2 of them of school age. She receives help from her mother in caring for her children while she works. She lives in her own house of modest construction. The help that she offers her children is seconded by their father, since between them, they encourage them become professionals. A person very serious in her work and in her leadership of the group, Margarita will use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

Sra. Candelaria is the secretary of the community bank. She is an older person with charisma and a good sense of humor. She markets cosmetics. She has her house where she lives with her children, who have their own families. She wants to see her last son, who depends on her, become a professional, since the other two children did not achieve this and left school to marry very young. With the money from the loan she will buy cosmetics that are on sale and then sell them at the original price.

Sra. Faustina is the treasurer of the group. A single mother with 3 children of school age, she lives in a rented house. Her main activity is marketing cosmetics. As a result of her work, she is close to buying a plot of land and beginning construction of her own house to shelter her children and herself. With the money from the loan she will buy cosmetics that are on sale and then sell them at the original price and have very good earnings.

All the bank members are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en: Ninfa joined CEVI two years ago hoping to gain financial assistance for her business. She has a rice farm and also raises pigs. She also just started a small sari-sari store, which she also hopes to grow. She is 48 years old, married with two children. She said that she ventured into different types of business so she could have extra income to keep up with the increasing needs in her household. She is now applying for a loan of Php 15,000. She will use it to buy farm supplies for her farm, feed for her pigs, and also supplies for her store. This loan will truly help Ninfa in her ventures.

loans.use: farm supplies, feed for pigs, and additional store inventory

loans.name: Jhon Henrri

texts.es: Jhon se didica al transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi propia, adquirida con sus ahorros y con prestamos financieros a traves de terceros vive en casa propia de madera con su conyuge y sus 2 hijos en edad escolar su conyuge trabaja para el programa a trabajar urbano en la tinguiña sin embargo no cuenta con documentación de ello por lo que no se le esta considerando ingresos, requiere el credito para empliar su vivienda con una nueva  habitación y poder poner una pequeña bodega ya que por la zona hay muy pocas y estan bastante alejadas. cuenta con acumulacion de bienes y con capacidad de pago para asumir el presente credito.
texts.en:
Jhon provides passenger transportation services with his own mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle.) He acquired this vehicle by borrowing a third of the amount, and paying the rest with his savings. He lives in his own home, made of wood, with his spouse and their 2 school-aged children. His wife works for a public works project in Tinguiña. However, she does not have documentation from this job, and so her income is not considered. He needs the loan to expand his home with a new room so that he can set up a small store, since in this area there are very few stores and they are far apart. He has personal property to use for collateral, and has been judged to have sufficient income to take on the current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand his house

loans.name: Adeltrodez's Group

texts.en:
Adeltrodez M. is from the village of Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 60 years old. Adeltrodez is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Adeltrodez is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adeltrodez owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community such as food for snacks, can goods, soap, sugar, laundry soap, cotton, etc. Adeltrodez has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Adeltrodez joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adeltrodez has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Adeltrodez is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Adeltrodez from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a father of four who lives with his wife and children in Machakos.  He operates a Mutongoni cafeteria to provide for his family.  His wife assists him to run the business along with two other employees.   Bernard has the skills to run a cafeteria because he was previously employed in a hotel. He also operates a taxi business to supplement his family’s income.  

Bernard, who has been running his cafeteria for twenty five years, joined a group called Ushindi Thiliu in Faulu, Kenya.  He saves his money with the group on a weekly basis.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat as ingredients for cooking.  He hopes to buy another car for his taxi business to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat as ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
A loving mother and a caring wife to her husband and children, Mercy M. is requesting a loan of twice as much as the amount of her previous request. Aside from her intention of growing her duck-raising and dressmaking businesses, she and her husband are also planning to venture into buying and selling fish for an additional source of income. Food being the most important need of people, the couple thinks that fish would be salable -- especially because most people in their village are farmers who are poor and can’t afford to buy meat. 

Mercy and her husband are planning to help one another to directly sell fish to people in the village and in the neighboring village. Together they will walk through every community and house for faster selling to have bigger income. Toward the end of the day, she hopes to bring home food for their children and money for their allowance for going to school the next day. 

After taking out all of her family expenses, including her weekly payment to ASHI for the loan, from the income they made, Mercy hopes to have some amount leftover to build a savings fund for the future needs of her children in attaining their college degree.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of fish for selling, additional ducklings to grow, and cloth and other materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Shalom 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Harthanesse is the coordinator of her group Shalom 6 & 7 (Shalom). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a stable business.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home.

Harthanesse is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for four years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different shoes, including sports, kid and women's shoes. She will use the profits to improve her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to make her business better, with more products. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Abdulio

texts.es:
Abdulio tiene 45 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazan, esta acompañado y vive con la esposa y la hija de 4 años de edad, ellos actualmente alquilan la casa donde residen, el tiene un taller de estructuras metalicas.
Tiene 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el frabrica balcones metalicos, puertas y otros, la zona de trabajo es el Departamento de Morazan el horario que regularmente atiende el taller es de 6:00am - 3:00pm.El se avisto en la neceisdad de solicitando un prestamo para compra de materiales como son soldares, hierro para fabricar puertas.
Las aspiraciones son que el taller sea amplio y le permita genrar mejores ingresos para mejora las condiciones d evida d ela familia.
texts.en:
Abdulino is 45 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, located within the Morazan department, along with his wife and four year old daughter in a rented home. He has a metal shop where he’s been in the business of making metal balconies, doors, and other things. He works within the Morazan zone, normally from 6:00 AM to 3:00 PM. [Abdulio] has seen the need to request a loan so that he can buy welding supplies and iron in order to make doors. He hopes to be able to expand his shop so that he can bring in better income and improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline O. is from the Barangay of Trigos, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years of age, married, and blessed with 3 children, of whom all of them are now already adults who have their own families.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in snack vending. She also receives regular support from her husband and also from her children in terms of their basic needs. She has engaged in snack vending for 5 years already and earns approximately Php3,000.00 a month from this business activity.

In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out rural communities, Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php12,000.00. She is requesting a loan of Php12,000.00 as her seventh loan, to be used for additional capital for her snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, and funding possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her snack vending business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena P. is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province on the island of Mindanao. She is 50 years old, married and has ten children with the younger ones still going to school. For over ten years Elena has been a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. She now raises pigs for fattening as well.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase farm supplies and feed for the pigs. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nakalasa Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
32-year-old Steven O. is happily married and has one child. He belongs to the Nakalasa Development Group—Lugazi. For the last twelve years Steven has been involved in commercial agriculture. Before this he was a subsistence farmer who only grew crops for his family’s consumption. Steven also gets modest profits from his small shop.

Steven describes his clientele as general in scope, meaning he sells to different classes of people. His business generates 100,000 UGX for him monthly. With this loan he wants to purchase manure for his gardens. This, he says, will help improve his crops, thus allowing him to sell his improved yields at a higher competitive market rate.

loans.use: To purchase manure for his gardens

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra localizada en la provinca de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María trabaja en labores agricolas junto a su esposo desde hace mas de quince años. Juntos manejan una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde suelen sembrar algunos granos y menestras. Adicionalmente cuentan con un pequeño grupo de vacas de las cuales extraen la leche que producen. Con estos ingresos ellos se han encargado de sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales se encuentran independizados en su mayoría.

María desea adquirir un motor que le permita extraer agua del subsuelo para regar su cultivo durante las temporadas de sequia, antes alquilaba este artefacto a un vecino y constituía un gasto elevado. Por ello se ha decidio a realizar esta inversión de modo que pueda trabajar de mejor modo. Para lograr su bjetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen en lazona le consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and a mother.  She lives with her husband in the Santa Clara hamlet of the Pitipo District, an agricultural area which is located in the province of Ferrenafe, about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.  

Maria has worked in agriculture alongside with her husband for over fifteen years.  Together they manage a small parcel of cultivations where usually a few grains and vegetables grow.  They also have a small group of cows from which they get their milk from.  With these earnings, they have been able to support their children, the majority of whom are now independent.  

Maria wishes to acquire a motor that would allow her to pump water from the subsoil in order to be able to water her cultivations during the dry season.  Before, she used to rent one from her neighbor which proved to increase her costs.  As such, she has decided to make this investment so that she can work more effectively.  In order to achieve her goal, she felt it was necessary to seek out a loan of 2000 soles for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa.  Maria is hard-working and dedicated to her family.  Those in the area that know her, consider her an honest and trustworthy woman.

loans.use: Purchase a motor that would allow her to pump water from the subsoil.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transport.

He operates a business of making school badges. Daniel supply' badges to different schools. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments and transportation. Delayed payments by schools after badges have been delivered on credit and high transport cost incurred during movement from one school to another. He hopes to expand his business and start a motorcycle business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to open a butcher shop to sell goat meat and purchase materials for making school badges. He decided to join Yehu because of its good platform and gives loans to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop  to sell goat meat  and purchase materials for making school badges.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya that produces maize, beans and potatoes which he sells at the local market. He has been practicing mixed farming for 15 years and employs 5 farmhands. His major challenges have been unfavorable weather conditions especially drought which affects his crops and low product prices when there is a glut in the market.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. The proceeds from this project will help him pay the school fees for his children and expand his poultry farming. In the future, he would like to do large scale poultry farming because the demand for eggs is high and the prices are favorable. 

Julius is 41 years old. He is married with 3 school-aged children who all attend school. He comments that the loans from Juhudi are really helping small-scale farmers expand and grow from subsistence farming to more intensive commercialized farming.

loans.use: To start a poultry project.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita A. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 58 years old. Estelita is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Estelita owns and operates a business making and selling chocolate balls to the local community. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2005, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Estelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Waeni

texts.en:
Waeni K. is 27 years old and married to John. They have four children and her spouse contributes to the family income. She has a motor bike transport business which she has been running for about three years now with an income of  Kshs.25,000 per month. 

She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans well and on time. She will use the loan to buy an extra motor bike to meet clients needs. She hopes to educate her children to the highest level and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Milton Gregorio

texts.es:
Milton de 61 años, aprendió desde pequeño hacer ladrillos ya que el negocio lo comenzaron sus abuelos y continúo con sus padres.  Poco a poco fue aprendiendo esta actividad hasta que la convirtió en su principal actividad económica. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha trabajado desde las 05h30am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. Trabaja solo utilizando un panelon, jaloncillo para su elaboración (El ladrillo es un componente cerámico artificial de construcción, compuesto básicamente por arcilla cocida). 

La continuidad para su negocio es uno de sus grandes deseos porque desde sus abuelos hasta sus padres lo vinieron haciendo por eso quiere continuar con este actividad comprando con el préstamo herramientas para la elaboración de los ladrillos como (jaloncillo, panelos). Quiere en el futuro expandir su negocio y que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Milton is 61 years old.  He learned how to make bricks when he was a young boy because this business was started by his grandparents and then continued by his parents.  He learned the trade and it eventually became his main business activity. 

Milton lives in an urban area called 'Orquídeas' (Orchids).  He works from 5.30am to 5.00pm every day.  He works alone, using specialized tools ('panelon' and 'jaloncillo') to make his bricks (a brick is a artificial ceramic building component which is basically made from baked clay).

One of Milton's biggest wishes is to continue in his business because it is what his grandparents and his parents did.  He would like to continue with this business, using his loan to buy tools to make his bricks ('jaloncillos' and 'panelons').  In the future, he would like to expand his business and he would like his two children to successfully finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy jaloncillo and panelon (tools for making bricks)

loans.name: Genevee

texts.en:
Genevee, a married mother of two children aged 9 and 12 years, lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two ventures: a fishing business and a cosmetic dealership. Her husband Rizalito, 43, works as a laborer to earn his living.

Genevee joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Genevee has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 10,300, uplifting the family's standard of living. She is now requesting a new loan to provide capital for her fishing business and to purchase more cosmetics to sell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. Genevee is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.
