About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, onions, tomato, pepper, salt, seasonings etc

loans.name: Las Reinas Group

texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to the support and unity of several women who are neighbors from Villa Elisa. One of the members, Ms. Laura Patricia Rodriguez, came to the foundation to learn more about our programs. Currently, this group is in "strengthening" process, where every member carries out their own business. They also have a member with a sick child, and they are all helping her. 

Mrs. Melanie L., for example, sells clothing by going from house to house. She does this in order to obtain a higher income and better standard of living for her family.

Group members are all working together. Although they still need help in management, they are eager to continue with their different business activities. They appreciate very much the help given to them by the foundation and the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" committee.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and underwear

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 46 years old and the father of two, ages 7 and 14.  He runs N. Transporters business to earn his daily bread.  He was able to start the business after getting enough capital from his previous business where he was selling scrap metals.  He thanks Faulu Kenya for supporting his previous business.  He hopes to have several trucks for transport in the future.  He has requested 60,000 KES to buy a computer and accessories for his business.

loans.use: To buy a computer and accessories for his business

loans.name: Maryuri Briceida

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Maryuri, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 7 años y el menor de dos meses, los dos mayores estudian  en colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en una copiadora.
 
Tiene un lugar de distracción en la Mocora la cual  ofrece mucha diversión para toda la familia, cuenta con piscinas para grandes y chicos lo cual en esta temporada pasa lleno, los días que ella abre su local normalmente son los días viernes, sabados y domingos. Además de esto también vende comida para todos los gustos, bebidas y refrescos, para entrar cobra una módica suma por persona. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ya por cuatro años y que gracias a Dios les ha ido muy bien ya que trata de dar el mejor servicio para que sus clientes regresen.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para preparar los alimentos además de sodas, agua, cervezas, entre otras cosas. Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le agrada porque con los créditos se ha ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son tener un local mucho mejor.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank La Mocora meet every 15 days in La Mocora, which is in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. This region is known for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and ranching.

Here we meet Señora Maryuri. She is 30 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has three children of ages 13, 7, and 2 months. The two older children go to secondary and primary school. Her husband works as a distributor.

She has an amusement center in La Mocora which offers fun for all the family. It has pools for adults and children which in this season are full. She normally opens her center on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. In addition, she sells food for all tastes, beverages, and soft drinks. Entrance costs a reasonable amount per person. She tells us that she has had this business for four years and that, thanks to God, it has gone very well for them, since she tries to give the best service so that her customers return.

This loan will be used to buy products to prepare food, in addition to sodas, water, and beer, among other items. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles, and she is very pleased with it, because she has been able to help herself a lot with the loans. Her dreams are to have a much better place of business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items,  soda, water, beer, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
HaiD. is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

HaiD.’s group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two little children.

HaiD. is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling silver jewelry in her community by purchasing rings, chain, bracelets, and many other accessories.

HaiD. will use the profits to invest in new items and increase her inventory. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador R. H. de veintinueve años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia en el departamento de San Salvador. El posee un negocio cerca del parque Libertad donde vende y repara relojes, la zona es muy concurrida y es por eso que Salvador tiene mucha clientela, el vende relojes de buena calidad y la reparación que ofrece es muy duradera, es por eso que las personas lo prefieren; debido a esto Salvador ha tenido mucha más demanda y se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más relojes y además partes de reparación como brazaletes, pilas, vidrios entre otros. Salvador es un buen padre de familia y un hombre trabajador y de esta forma quiere llevar a su hogar una seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Salvador R. H. is 29 years old and lives with his life partner and son in his own home, in San Salvador department.  Salvador owns a business near Libertad Park where he sells and repairs watches.  The area is very busy and, for that reason, Salvador has many customers.  He sells good-quality watches and his repairs are very long lasting.  For this reason, people prefer his business and he has a lot of demand.  Salvador decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow him to buy more watches and also parts for repairing watches including straps, batteries and glass.  Salvador is a good father and a hard-working man.  Through his work, he would like to bring his household financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy straps, batteries and glass

loans.name: Narcisa Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Narcisa, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno es mayor de edad y la menor de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer. Ella aprendió belleza en un Instituto de Manta.

Ella realiza trabajos de belleza y arreglos personales en su casa, realiza tinturados, cortes de cabello, pintado de uñas, entre otras cosas, también realiza trabajos a domicilio cuando sus clientes lo requieren. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años que está trabajando de esta forma pero espera en un futuro instalar un salón de belleza completo y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y productos de belleza de Avon y Yanbal.  Esta en el Banco Comunal hace tres años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan sus compañeras.
  
Su sueño es  tener salón de belleza más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" holds its meetings in Bajo de Montecristi in Manabí province.  This is a small place surrounded by a lot of vegetation.  Its inhabitants are involved in a variety of economic activities including retail trade and working in factories.

In this place we meet Narcisa, who is 38 years old, married and has 2 children.  One of her children is an adult, and the other is a minor who is 15 years old and is in school.  Her husband works as a driver.  She went to beauty school in an institute in Manta.

Narcisa has a beauty salon in her house.  There she provides haircuts, hair coloring, nail painting and other services.  In addition, she works in at the residence of her customers when they request it.  She tells us that she has been doing this kind of work for 5 years, but in the future she hopes to set up a complete beauty salon so that she could offer better service to her customers.

She will use this loan to buy hair dye, permanent solution and beauty products from the Avon and Yanbal lines.  She has been with her communal bank for 3 years, and she enjoys the support that is provided by her fellow group members.

Her dream is to have a larger beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, permanent solution and beauty products from the Avon and Yanbal lines

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Victoria, la socia tiene 34 años, la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 años de 16, 15, 13, 5 años de edad; la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia invertirá la mitad del dinero que requiere en la construcción de su casa, y la otra desea invertir en la implementación de la tienda de abarrotes, la socia comprara arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros de productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y en su vivienda.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank goes by the name “Señor de Coylluritti de Ccorao” and it is located in the town of Ccorao – Pisac, which forms part of the Province of Calca and the Department of Cusco.

Victoria is 34 years old, has a live-in partner and has four children (16, 15, 13, 5). She has a grocery store and will invest half of the loan into building her house, and the other half into her grocery store. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of basic needs items (rice, sugar, pasta and other items) and in her house.

Victoria is grateful and wishes to state that she will be disciplined and make her loan repayments.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic needs items and in her home.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa Delia tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Rosa se dedica al comercio de compra y venta de legumbres. Además tiene dos solares donde siembra maíz y trigo. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y comprar un vehículo..

Le gusta hacer compras, salir con los hijos de paseo a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has five children.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

Rosa buys and sells vegetables.  She also has two plots of land where she grows corn and wheat.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and her sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dreams are to improve her business and to buy a vehicle.

Rosa enjoys shopping and going out for walks in the city with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: David

texts.es: David, tiene la edad de 32  años, está soltero y vive solo. El  lo que pretende con su crédito es realizar la compra de abono para abonar su plantación de café. El cuenta con el terreno apto y ya sembrado con producciones anteriores y lo que pretende es mejorar la producción este año. El quiere poder seguir adelante con su proyecto de café y establecerse como un caficultor de la zona y a su vez generar las ganancias necesarias para su bienestar familiar y su futuro.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
David is 32 years old, single and lives alone.  He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers to fertilize his coffee plantation.  He has a suitable plot of land which is already sown with existing plants.  This year he plans to improve his production.  He would like to move ahead with his coffee project and establish himself as a coffee grower in his area.  At the same time, he would like to make enough profits to look after his family's well-being and provide for their future.

This is the first loan that David has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este comité tiene muy buena organización, son unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. 
Se encuentran con la renovación del cuarto ciclo. Se reúnen semanalmente para organizar el trabajo en equipo turnandose cada una por igual.
Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Mbocayaty - Villarrica, en mayoría microempresarias, pues se dedican a la fabricación, compra y venta de prendas de ao poi. Manifestaron que su sueño de crecimiento y solidez del grupo sería abrir una microempresa  juntas y con la ayuda que la Fundación Paraguaya mediante los créditos que otorgan cada etapa; aprenden a ahorrar  y el día de mañana tendrán su propia microempresa de Comité pudiendo trabajar en paralelo a lo que están realizando actualmente.
La sra. Emilce se dedica desde hace tiempo a la fabricación y venta de prendas de ao poi, ella es jubilada también pues fue docente por más de 25 años y ahora como no le alcanza el dinero para poder mantener a su familia, se dedica al microcomercio.
Ella espera contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas de Kiva para poder comprar más telas y elementos necesarios para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
This committee is very well organized; they are united, hard working and mutually supportive.  They are in the fourth cycle renewal.  They meet weekly to organize the teamwork trading off equally among them.

These women are from the city of Mbocyaty-Villarica.  Most are micro entrepreneurs.  They are manufacturers and buyers/sellers of Ao Poi garments (traditional Paraguayan embroidery).  They stated that their dream of growth and group solidarity would be to open a micro business together with help from Fundación Paraguaya and its regular loans granted at each stage.  They learn to save and in the near future will have their own committee micro business to work alongside what they are currently involved in.

Emilce has been making and selling Ao Poi garments for a long time.  She was a teacher for over 25 years and is now retired but because her pension isn’t sufficient to be able to support her family she‘s working her micro business.

She hopes to have support from Kiva lenders to buy more fabric and necessary supplies to make her items.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old, married, with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He dreams of having a permanent house and educating his children up to the university level. He has been in the goat-rearing business for 10 years in addition to being a tea trader and farmer. His major challenge now is shortage of labor as he tries to expand on his tea plantation.

He needs the loan to buy tea seedlings and also to pay labor for clearing more land for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings and also to pay labor for clearing more land for planting.

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children. 

He is dedicated to raising sheep. He owns sheep and breeds them together with the help of his wife. 

In order to further develop his business, Zahir wants to take out a loan to buy more sheep and the feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then, Zahir will be able to use the profit from his business for the well-being of his family. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to feed them and have provided them with good living conditions. 

Zahir wants to develop and invest in his business through the purchase of more cows and cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and 6 sheep

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 25, is married to Joyce. They live in Migori and have four children who are still in school.

Daniel runs a retail shop and has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy more sugar, rice, flour and other items to add to his stock. He says that the loan will help him boost his business and in return help him generate more income.

He hopes to be able to open up a general store in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and other items to add to his stock.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 56 years old, married and has five children. For five years she has sold green and yellow bananas.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more green and yellow bananas to sell. In the future Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more green and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 26 años vive en una a casa alquilada junto a su esposa Cecilia, con quien convive desde hace 4 años. Ambos tuvieron una hija: Cecilia, a quien cuidan y educan en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Desde su niñez, sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber sobre la agricultura y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, que sumas 4 terrenos agrícolas en las cuales siembra café, palta y plátano, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, donde viaja muy seguido, pues también se dedica al trabajo de cerrajero en un taller de soldadura, ahí obtiene un dinero extra gracias a sus conocimientos, ya que es uno de los mejores en su área. Pero lo que más le gusta, son los tiempos que pasa trabajando la tierra y cultivando sus frutos, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 10 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de las plagas. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos y así poder minimizar los gastos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que agradece el apoyo recibido. Juan de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de peones para que le ayuden en la siembra de maíz y plátanos que muy pronto lo realizará.
texts.en: Juan is 26 years old and lives in a rented house with his wife Cecilia, with whom he has lived for 4 years. They have a daughter, Cecilia, whom they are caring for and raising in the native community of Alianza. Since childhood, his parents taught him everything he had to know about farming and little by little he took over caring for his parents' crops. Now he has extensive cropland- 4 agricultural plots where he grows coffee, avocados and plantains. He sells them in the market of the city of La Merced, where he goes frequently. He is a locksmith in a welding shop where he makes extra money thanks to his abilities; he is one of the best in the area. But what he likes the best is the time he spends working the land and growing his product. This is the activity that feeds his family. He has 10 years experience and he considers the most difficult thing is protecting his products from pests. He really wants to buy a car to transport his products and thus lower his costs. He belongs to the “Alianza al progreso” [Alliance for Progress] community bank and this is his fourth loan with MFP. He has always made his payments on time, since he is grateful for the support he has received. Upon receiving your support, he will invest the money he has asked for in paying laborers to help him plant corn and plantains, which he will do very soon.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de snack,ella vende hamburguesas, gaseosas y empanadas, ella tiene en el distrito de Limatambo, ella también trabaja en una empresa de turismo y el snack lo administra su hermano, por medio de este negocio y trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de snack y mejorar en su trabajo de la empresa de turismo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para su snack y enviarlos a Limatambo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the San Rafael communal bank, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Edith. She is 38 years old, single and has one son. She divides her time between her daily activities and her snack bar business. She sells hamburgers, sodas and empanadas in the district of Limatambo. She also works at a tourism agency, while her brother manages the snack bar.  Through the business and her job, Edith helps her children to get ahead. She wants to expand her snack business and to improve her work at the tourism agency. Edith is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs for her snack bar and to send them to Limatambo.

She is happy about this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and send them to the district where she owns a snack bar

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old and married. She has four children, three of them have their own family and live on their own while the youngest still attends college. 

Evangeline manages her small sari-sari (variety) store in one of the windows in her house. She wants to sell more items in her store but she has insufficient funds to buy soft drinks, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee. She is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy these items that would increase her sales.  

In the future, Evangeline wants to establish a more convenient store outside her house to orderly stock her groceries for her customers. Evangeline wants to continuously generate more income to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and the father of two children.

In 2005 Mohamad opened a food market selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field.

His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Mohamad decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to purchase two fridges for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two fridges for his market.

loans.name: Ma. Jessica

texts.en:
Ma. Jessica is 45 years old and married with six children.

Ma. Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, beverages and other groceries to sell.

Ma. Jessica has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for two years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

Ma. Jessica aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, beverages and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Miguelito De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MIGUELITO DE COLLPANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pamela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, taller de llantería, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, comerciante de frazadas.

La señora Pamela,  indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de un familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones y lámparas que viene trabajando hace cinco años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de edredones y lámparas) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo venderá en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Miguelito de Collampi" communal association will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Collpani office.  It is composed of six members, and is run by a board headed by Pamela. 

The businesses run by the members of the communal association are varied. They include clothing sales, a tire shop, a neighborhood store, and selling blankets. 

Pamela says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of a family member. Currently, she has a business selling quilts and lamps, that she has been working on for five years.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital, by buying  quilts and lamps. She will buy these at markets, and sell them later at her sales location. 

This activity allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single.  When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the skill development.

loans.use: To buy lamps and quilts.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 31 years old and a single mother of one. She runs a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person to assist her in her tasks. She also sells cereals and does farming for extra income. Juliana hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan of 100,000 kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with one child 17 years old living in Hoima, Uganda.  She has dependents, and her spouse also earns an income for the family.
 
She has been operating a fresh foods business for the past 11 years. However, she still has a challenge of price fluctuations. She hopes her business will grow bigger in the future. 

Jane intends to use the loan to purchase fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase  fresh foods.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is 52 years old, married, and has four children. One of her sons is a worker with a decent salary, the other has a gift stall with a low income. Etaf wants to help her son to purchase more gift items so he has a better collection to sell thereby increasing his income. 

Etaf is requesting a loan for $1,500 from FATEN, which she will use to enable her son to purchase more gift items to sell. Etaf  will contribute positively to improve her son's living conditions. Etaf is a conservative woman, so her son  with the gift stall is in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase gifts to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 46 years old woman, she is married with two sons and one daughter, her husband works in agriculture with low income. Hanan has a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries to have a better collection to resell, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Hanan gets the loan, she will purchase all groceries she needs to has more collection to resell and increase her income, this enables her to provide better living conditions to her family. Hanan is a conservative woman, so her husband Maher is photographed instead in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Jerry Lou

texts.en:
Jerry Lou is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are students. He is married to a teacher and is busy managing his 1.2 hectare rice field. Jerry Lou is glad because he is able to provide his family needs through his wife's salary and income generated from his rice field. He is thankful because his previous loan enabled him to improve his farming business.

Jerry Lou would like to continually improve his farm but due to increased household expenses and high interest rates on his farm inputs he is asking for a additional loan of P27,000. He will use the amount requested to buy farm inputs to improve the growth of his rice crop. He is hoping that through his patience and new strategies for the plant care of his rice crop he can be able to increase his income. This way, he can support his children's education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his rice farming business

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de solidario y muy amable. Convive con Jesenia quien es ama de casa y ambos tienen dos hijos de 14 y 2 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. Las actividades que realiza Segundo, es el de transporte de pasajeros para eso cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con un capital propio más un préstamo bancario hace 4 años. Desde entonces sale a trabajar en sus ratos libres; del mismo tambien se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno contando con un terreno de 40 hectáreas que compró hace 12 años, donde cría 20 vacas, asimismo cultiva pasto, que le sirve de forraje para ellos, por tanto debe contratar peones, a quienes les paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios. Le gusta su trabajo de campo, ya que con eso tiene un oficio pues no terminó sus estudios y viendo que le permite tener un ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, y la educación de sus hijos ya que considera que es la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar, pues el no tuvo esa oportunidad. Tiene planes de abrir una bodega en su casa donde atendería su pareja y de esa manera tener más ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero para poder avanzar con sus planes. Además dice estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros, a quienes considera ser personas responsables y cordiales. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio de crianza de ganado pensado comprar vacuna para sus animales y para la preparación del terreno para sembrar más pasto para las vacas.
texts.en: Thirty-three-year-old Segundo is a hardworking and industrious man who is also supportive and very kind.  He lives with his partner, Jesenia, who is a housewife and together they have two children who are 14 and 2 years old and whom they love very much.  They live together in their own home.  For a living, Segundo transports passengers on the mototaxi he bought with his own capital and a bank loan four years ago.  Since then he goes out and works when he has free time.  At the same time, he also raises cattle for a living on the 40 ha. he bought about 12 years ago.  He is raising 20 cows and he also grows grass that he uses as their fodder.  He has to hire workers, whom he pays 20 nuevos soles per day.  He likes working in the fields because it gives him a trade since he didn't finish school and because it provides him with the income to take care of his family and pay for his children's education.  He considers that to be the best inheritance he can leave them because he didn't have that opportunity.  He is planning to open a small grocery store in his home that his wife would attend to in order to have more income.  This will be his sixth loan with MFP and he is thankful for the financial support to be able to go ahead with his plans.  He also says that he likes his communal bank because he gets along with all the members, who he considers responsible and friendly.  He will invest the requested 3,000 nuevos soles in his cattle-raising business by buying vaccines for his animals and preparing his land to plant more grass for his cows.

loans.use: to buy vaccines for his cows and to grow more grass

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Esterlita has a furniture shop that sells furniture like beds and cabinets. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the furniture shop.

Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture shop.

loans.name: Los Guadalupes Group

texts.es:
Edgar cuenta con 22 años de edad, es casado su esposa se llama wendy tiene dos hijos Yoselin de 4 años y un bebe de dos meses  aun no tiene nombre, el es albañil ya tiene un año desempeñando ese trabajo, dice que pondrá un negocio e invertirá su préstamo en un taller de bicicleta espera que le ayude su préstamo ya que dice le pondrá todo de su parte para que su taller salga adelante.

Edgar pertenece al grupo "los Guadalupe" el cual esta integrado por 5 hombres y 6 mujeres a continuación serán mencionados: Felipe, Fermín, Mario, Rosa, Roció, Inés, Oscar, Edgar, Luz Divina, Romelia, Celedonia, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de tamales, pescados, taller de bicicletas, ropa, verduras, pan, etc.
texts.en:
Edgar is 22 years old and married.  His wife is named Wendy.  He has two children, Yoselin, 4, and a two-month-old baby who does not have a name yet.  He is a bricklayer and has been doing this work for a year.

He says he will set up a business and invest his loan in a bicycle repair shop.  He hopes his loan will help him because he says he will put everything he has into it so his shop will get ahead.

Edgar belongs to Los Guadalupes Group, which has these five men and six women: Felipe, Fermín, Mario, Rosa, Roció, Inés, Oscar, Edgar, Luz Divina, Romelia, and Celedonia.  They all work in commercial activities such as selling tamales, fish, bicycle shop, clothing, vegetables, bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and materials for bicycles.

loans.name: Rina's Group

texts.en:
Rina is aged 39 years old and married. He is a father of one daughter. To make a living, he and his wife have growing and selling vegetables for 3 years. The current business earns him about 60,000KHR per day to support the family. 
Rina’s group consists of two male members who live in the same village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He is the first cycled client. Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Rina, who is the leader, will user his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.ru:
Худойберди  родился в семье колхозника в районе Рудаки. Он занимается животноводством. Покупает на рынке района Рудаки животных по дешевле, откармливает их и продаёт немного увеличив цену. Худойберди с семьёй живёт в кишлаке и имеет три ребёнка. 
Худойберди пришёл в МДО Арванд чтобы подать заявку и получить кредит. Он хочет улучшить свой бизнес по животноводству, но для этого не хватает его собственных средств. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Khudoyberdi is from the Rudaki district of Tajikistan and he comes from a farmers' family.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  He buys cattle at the local market for a low price, fattens his animals and resells them at a higher price.  He lives with his family in a very small village, and he has three children.  Khudoyberdi has come to us, MDO Arvand, in order to receive a loan and improve his animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан мужчина 31 года. Имеет среднее образование. Женат. У жены тоже среднее образование, занимается наёмной работной  в поле.  Отец и мать  пенсионеры . Имеет   3-х детей в школьном возрасте. Хасан имеет 3,80га. земли под арендой, и посеял люцерну и сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он хочет приобрести кредит   для откормленные крупно рогатого скота. Хасан обычный плотник но опытный в своем деле в Зафарабадском районе. Хасан ещё занимается купли продажи крупно рогатых скотов уже многие годы, на этой сфере уже имеет большой опыт. Сам  ухаживает за ними и еще ему помогает отец. Хасан признателен МДО Арванд и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Hasan is a 31 year old man. He is married and has a secondary education. His wife also has a secondary education and works in the fields for hire. Hasan's father and mother are retired and he has three school-age children. He has 3.80 hectares of rented land where he plants alfalfa and other crops. He wants to obtain a loan to fatten cattle. Hasan is an ordinary carpenter but has experience in the Zafarabad region. He has also been buying and selling cattle for many years and has a lot of experience in this area. He looks after the cattle himself with help from his father. Hasan is grateful to MDO Arvand and thanks them in advance for the support.

loans.use: to feed his cattle

loans.name: Kamasek

texts.en: Kamasek is such a hardworking lady who has come along way from selling ghee to raising steers for sale. She is 40 years old and has 6 children, two of them are married and others are in school. At present, she has 5 steers and these will be sold as they mature because they are of different age and size. The bigger the steers, the higher the price and so is the profit. Besides the steers business, Kamasek makes necklaces, belts and bracelets out of beads. These are sold to her group member Emily who sells them to Nairobi markets and Westlands. Also, she sells milk and this gives her daily income that covers the day-to-day expenses at home.

loans.use: Kamasek would like to buy 8 steers.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en: Eli I. (his employee is pictured) owns a computer/stationary store In the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Eli is looking for funding so that he can purchase new computers for his store.

loans.use: To purchase new computers

loans.name: Fuamatala

texts.en: Fuamatala P. has a food vending business and sells cooked Samoan dishes, like taro, banana, fish and yam all mixed with coconut cream. She sells her product to the public in front of one of the shops near home.  Her husband works fultime on their small plantation and gives her a hand in running the business when needed. Her stall is open Mondays, Tuesdays and Saturdays. Her weekly net profit helps a lot in supporting her childrens' education. She is requesting a loan so she can upgrade her business and earn more money for her children's studies and for improving the home that they live in.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and upgrade her food stall

loans.name: Ada  Luz

texts.es:
My name is Ada Luz, I am a merchant and I have a small grocery store at home called “Pulpería SAN JUAN". I have dedicated many years to this type of business. With the profit that it generates, I am able to contribute to our family’s expenses. The location of this store is very good and each day the sales’ volume is larger, which requires a larger investment to offer my clients a larger variety of products.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ada luz, soy Comerciante, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia "SAN JUAN", tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio y con las utilidades que me genera puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, la ubicación de mi negocio es muy buena y cada dia el volumen de venta es mayor, por lo que requiere una mayor inversión para poder ofrecer a mis clientes con variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, lard, beans, corn, toilet paper, soap, and milk products.

loans.name: Juan  Crisostomo

texts.en:
My name is Juan Crisosto and I have a small home-based business making baskets used in the harvesting of coffee beans. This business generates the income necessary to support my family and meet financial obligations to my suppliers. It has also allowed me to make improvements to my home.

Coffee harvest time is approaching and I need to manufacture enough inventory to meet demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Juan Crisosto, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una Micro empresa de elaboración de utencilios de Carrizo, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, gracias a los ingresos de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, tomando en cuenta que ya se acerca la temporada de corta de cafe necesito preparme con producto para poder satisfacer la demanda. Con las utilidadade que me genera este negocio he podido hacerle algunas merjoras a mi vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase ditch reed to manufacture baskets

loans.name: Alba

texts.en: Alba, 30 years old, has been separated from her husband for two years, and on her own she is taking care of her well-loved son.  Since then, she started a small business, selling gold filled jewelery.  She also sells hand and body lotion and deodorants.  She has a well established clientele.  In fact she sells her products to teachers of the schools and also to the personnel of the town council.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a larger amount of products in order to sell the jewels at special prices for the holiday season.  That way, she will increase her sales volume and her income.  This loan will help this young single mother continue taking care of her son and improve their life.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of gold filled jewelery for her business, in order to satisfy the demand of her customers

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
A. Tehran is 34 years old. He is from Azerbaijan in the Armenian conflict territory of the Fizuli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives in Sumgayit city with his family. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He works in a café in the central market. He began his business 5 years ago.

He wants to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment for his cafe. He had already gathered some money for making repairs, but it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow money.

Tehran would like to receive a $500 loan in order to repair his café and to buy necessary tools and equipment. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes to expand his business eventually and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Wants to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment.

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en: Ms. Minaya is a 34-year-old woman. She lives with her family in the village of Saatli city, which is situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2002 when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. Since then, Minaya collected up to seven cows. She buys calves, breeds them, and sells them to the butcher, who works in the local big market. Minaya has collected enough customers and needs to increase the number of animals in her herd. This project requires investment. For this purpose, Minaya applied for a $1000 loan to buy five calves from Normicro.  She hopes to expand her business eventually.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Mrs. Jovita’s daily activity is retail sale of bananas. Doña Jovita describes herself as a hardworking lady who has the capacity to fight for what she wants. Her product is sold at a very well-known harbor of Malecón Grau where her bananas are very popular among a large group of people. Jovita is a 46 year-old single mother of five children who are independent with their own families and therefore she is always praying to the almighty to protect them and, above all, guide them. She wishes to invest in her business and also start selling cds and cosmetics and she needs capital to make her achieve her purpose. She awaits the unselfish support from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La venta al por menor de un producto comestible (plátanos) es la actividad diaria de la señora, Jovita, quien se califica como una mujer emprendedora y sobre todo capaz de luchar para conseguir sus propósitos, dichos productos los vende en un puerto muy conocido del Malecón Grau ya que existe una gran acogida de personas que degustan de este producto. Jovita a sus 46 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene cinco hijos los cuales ya son independientes y poseen sus propias familias, es por eso que siempre le pide al todo poderoso que los proteja y sobre todo los guíe por el buen camino. Ella quiere invertir en su negocio y también quiere dedicarse a la venta de CDS y productos de belleza, y para ello requiere de un capital el cual la ayudará a lograr sus objetivos. Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To increase sales and add other products to business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a business

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.ru:
Gulsifat S. lives in the town of Vahdat in Mehron. She is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has secondary education and is not employed. However, she desperately wants to help her husband. Currently, her family has a cow and a calf. The cow hadn't had milk for a long time. For this reason, Gulsifat wants to obtain a credit to purchase a milk cow. This will help her increase family income since she will be able to sell milk to her neighbors. In addition, her neighbors will have an opportunity to buy fresh milk at low prices.

After she pays off the credit, she will still have a cow, that she will use for breeding to further increase the amount of cattle that the family holds. She plans to pay off the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Солехова Гулсифат Муродовна проживает в городе Вахдат в поселке Мехргон. Клиентке 46 лет , она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , но очень хочет помочь мужу . У них в хозяйстве есть корова и теленок. Но корова уже давно не дает молоко. Поэтому клиентка хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить дойную корову, для того чтобы получать молоко. Это поможет ей зарабатывать деньги, так как получаемое молоко она сможет продавать соседям. Кроме того ее соседи смогут покупать свежее молоко по низкой цене. После того как она расплатится с кредитом ей останится корова , которую она сможет разводить и увеличивать поголовье скота у себя дома. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Prisca's Clothes Seller Group

texts.en:
Prisca is 33 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 9 years old. Prisca is a seamstress and clothes seller (khanga); she started in 2003. Every day she works from 9am to 18pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Prisca has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) and tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Catherine and Maria, who have businesses dealing in clothes (vitenge) sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga) and tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Dara Salam 2007-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Asunta C.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Asunta is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has one child who is two years old. Each week, Asunta makes approximately 25 Sudanese Pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Asunta is joined in her small group by Omijima M., Christhine K., Susan P., and Mary S.. Omijima M. has a business selling clothes and wants to construct a house. Christhine K. is currently operating a business selling breads and wants a loan to buy property for her work. Susan P. operates a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Mary S. is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to carry out her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Sorry For Me Group

texts.en:
Aminata K. is the leader of the "Sorry for Me" Group. She is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. The members originated from a rotating savings club. The group pulled their savings together and helped each other with loans to start small businesses but they had insufficient capital to enable them to make a good profit.

With the advent of SMT, the solidarity group joined the program. The group is very happy that, since then, their profit increased and most of them were able to pay their children's school requirements and have two meals a day. With unemployed husbands, the members' businesses are the main source of income for the family. Aminata, the leader, and Mamusu sell rice, beans and peanuts. Isatu S. sells local food made out of cassava flour, and Isatu L. sells dishes in the market of Magburaka. The group is therefore requesting a loan of SLL 2,800,000 to increase their stock and earn more income for their families.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs and home utensils to increase stock and income

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mrs. Rim S. lives in Taing Bonteay Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and she sells second-hand clothes in the local village. She is a 52-year-old widow without any children and she now lives in hard conditions because she does not have anybody to help her in her business activities.

Mrs. Rim S. has difficulties traveling to buy clothes to re-sell in the village. Thus she decided to buy a motorbike for traveling to purchase clothes. Previously, Mrs. Rim S. obtained a loan from AMK to start her clothes selling business and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for traveling to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: L. Brigitte est célibataire sans enfant et est née le 24/07/1985 au Ghana. Elle n’a plus d’autre activité à part son salon de coiffure. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat des produits cosmétiques  servant au traitement des cheveux et développer son activité.
texts.en:
Brigitte L. is single with no children and was born on July 24, 1985 in Ghana. Her only business is her beauty salon. She is requesting this loan to purchase cosmetics used for hair treatment. She wants to grow her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cosmetic products for hair

loans.name: Chanreung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanreung R., 28, sells many products from her house, including vegetables, meats, and food ingredients. She has been selling groceries since 2005 and earns approximately US$4.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ratha Sok, 27, is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns US$4.00 per day. Ratha also cares for one child in the family's home.

Chanreung lacks the capital to improve her business. She would like to request a loan of US$350 to purchase more grocery inventory to sell.

Chanreung is a leader of small group that has three other members:

  • Mrs. Vuey C., 34, is a farmer. She would like to request a loan of US$250 to buy vegetable seeds to grow.
  • Mrs. Channy B., 28, sells perfume. She would like to request US$350 to purchase more perfume to sell.
  • Mrs. Ry N., 48, sells vegetables in the market. She would like to request a loan of US$350 to purchase more vegetable inventory to sell.
The women all live Chomka Somrong Commune, Battam Bang Province.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi Z. est née en 1984 à Bégbé. Célibataire avec trois (03) enfants à charge,  elle pratique l’agriculture, la culture du mais, la seule activité génératrice de revenu dans son milieu. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et augmenter sa surface cultivable. Ce crédit lui permettra d’accroître conséquemment ses revenus et de faire face à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi Z. was born in 1984 in Bégbé. She is single raising 3 children, and she farms, growing maize, the only way to earn money in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and increase the area she has under cultivation. This loan will allow her to increase her earnings and provide school-fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and increase of area under cultivation

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Originaire de Savalou dans les Collines au centre du Benin, dame D. Virginie est née le 08/07/1965 à Cotonou. Mariée  à GBAGUIDI Jean ,chauffeur de formation, elle est mère de 04 enfants dont  Innocent le benjamin (18 ans) est en classe de terminale. Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CE2. Après l'abandon classes, elle a commencé par vendre des fruits (oranges surtout), du pains sucrés et autres  menus articles de consommation immédiate avec ses propres revenus. Elle a aussi orienté son activité vers la vente de conserves et de savons. Depuis 05 ans elle a maintenu la vente de ces divers artcles mais ajouta la vente des tissus pour laquelle elle est ambulante. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt  de 200000fcfa pour rehausser le niveau de son activité. Elle compte s'apprivisionner en tissus, sucre et savons.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginie D. was born on July 8, 1965 in Cotonou, Benin, and grew up in Savalou in the central Benin hills known as ‘les Collines’. Married to Jean Gbaguidi, a trained chauffeur, she is mother to four children, the youngest of whom, Innocent (18 years old), is in twelfth grade. She attended school up to third grade. After abandoning her studies she started selling fruit (oranges in particular), sweet rolls and other items for immediate consumption, providing her with her own income. She also steered her business toward selling canned foods and soap. She has continued selling these various items for five years, but she has also added fabrics, which she sells door-to-door. She is requesting this third loan of 200,000 FCFA ($400) to strengthen her business. She intends to stock up on fabrics, sugar and soap.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bolt of fabrics, half a case of sugar cubes and a case of soap

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Don Samuel tiene ya mas de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de jugos y licuados, su objetivo es poner una sucursal en la cual tenga otras opciones, como lonches, alimentos rápidos, etc. 
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP le ha invertido a su negocio y sus frutos son muy buenos. 
El negocio lo trabajan él y su esposa Liliana.
texts.en:
Samuel has sold juices and smoothies for more than four years. His goal is to expand in order to offer more, such as lunches, fast foods, etc. He has invested his two previous loans with FVP in his business and the results have been good. He and his wife Liliana work in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify his business

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría 
Luz tiene 48 años es conviviente tiene diez hijos de 29, 28, 25, 23, 22, 18, 15, 13, 12,  y 9 años los mayores trabajan y últimos están en la escuela, su esposó también trabaja, ella empezó vendiendo mazamorra en la puerta de su casa, después se puso a vender espinazos de pollo frito por mucho tiempo, pero lo dejo por que había mucha competencia y ya no le salía a cuenta entonces empezó ayudar a una amiga a vender productos de belleza por catalogo Avon ahora es vendedora directa ya tiene vendiendo los productos tres años le esta yendo  bien pero necesita capital

Luz solicita 400 soles para invertirlos en compra de productos de belleza Avon. Para estas fiestas navideñas. El sueño de Luz es tener un negocio propio de Ropa interior
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Pearls of Wisdom Community Bank. She is 48 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has 10 children, ages 29, 28, 25, 23, 22, 18, 15, 13, 12 and 9. The eldest ones work and the younger ones are still in school. Her husband also works. She started out selling mazamorra, a popular regional dish made with corn, in front of her home and later offered skewers of fried chicken for a long time, but she stopped because there was a lot of competition in the area and it wasn't going as well as she had hoped, so she started helping a friend sell beauty products out of the Avon catalog. Now she is a direct sales representative and has been selling products for three years. It is going well but she needs capital. Luz is requesting 400 soles (approximately $150) to invest in the purchase of Avon beauty supplies to be prepared for the holiday season. Her dream is to have her own underwear business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Manco Kapac Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Manco Kapac” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace más de tres años. Cada catorce días se reúnen en el centro focal Alto Lima, de la ciudad de El Alto a la fecha el grupo  cuenta con trece miembros y  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, cuentan que las ganancias de sus pequeños negocios solo cubren necesidades básicas y no les alcanza para ahorrar. Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la Gastronomía, venta de artefactos electrónicos, la venta  de fruta, venta de detergentes, además de estas otras de las socias son artesanas, realizan tejido a mano de mantas en telares, creación de muñecos tradicionales en aguayo y también tejidos en lana, confección de maletines y mochilas en cuero y aguayo, tejido de chalinas y medias en lana de alpaca y el diseño de joyas en oro y plata. La asociación Manco Kapac necesita de  capital  para comprar materia prima, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "Manco Kapac" association has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for more than three years. They meet every fourteen days in the Alto Lima center in the city of El Alto. The group has thirteen members and has shown itself to be organized with regard to loan installments. The majority of the group's members are married, with children. Their small businesses cover their basic living expenses but don't stretch far enough for them to save. Among the businesses that the group's members operate are buying and selling food, electronics, fruit and detergent. Other members make and sell crafts: home-made woven blankets; traditional cloth dolls; wool cloth; bags and packs made from leather and aguayo; traditional woven scarves; socks made from alpaca wool; and gold and silver jewelry. The Manco Kapac association needs a loan to buy basic materials so that they can increase their earnings and the well-being of their households.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies for group's various businesses.

loans.name: Salune Ibrahim

texts.en: T. is 42 years old and is married with 4 children. T. sells cooked food in her shop at Shibiri Junction, T.’s business is doing well because of her location. There are dozens of motorcycles riders (okada) eating in her shop. This testifies to the high demand for her business. She is asking for a loan of N50,000 ($350) to buy more food and sachet (bottled) water to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet (bottled) water and food to cook and sell

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Dios Proveera consta de dos mujeres y un hombre, Gloria Z. tiene 41 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con Valentin Castellanos con el cual tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan en la secundaria y uno en la escuela, ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella es muy comprometida con su trabajo el cual le genera ingresos para mantener su familia, el negocio de vender tortillas es bueno porque este alimento es muy vendido todos los dias.
Aida D. vive en union libre con Carlos T. quien se dedica a la venta de paletas y ella se dedica a la produccionn y venta de tortillas, tienen 3 hijos pequeños y junto con los ingresos de su compañero de hogar logran sacar adelante su hogar.
Jeiby T. es un joven de 24 años de edad el cual tiene su propio taxi, el se dedica al negocio de transportar personas, este negocio le genera buenos ingresos, el tiene dos hijos, en estos momentos el necesita comprar repuestos para reparar su unidad ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante y asi poder  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Group Dios Proveera [God Will Provide] is composed of two women and one man. Gloria Z. is 41 years old, and lives with her common law partner Valentin Castellanos with whom she has 3 children; two of her children are in secondary school and one is in elementary school. She dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas; she is very committed to her work which generates income to support her family. The tortilla selling business is good because this food sells very well every day. Aida D. lives with her common law partner Carlos T. who sells popsicles and she dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas. They have 3 small children and with her live in partner’s income they are able to help their household thrive. Jeiby T. is a 24 year old young man who has his own taxi. He dedicates himself to his business of transporting people; this business generates a good income for him. He has two children. At this moment he needs to purchase parts to repair his taxi given that it is his only source of income. All the members of the Group Dios Proveera need a loan to get ahead and in that way better their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn flour, lime, wood, water, and car parts.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Восиев Икром проживает  в районе Варзоб. Возраст 56 лет. Женат и имеет 9 детей. Всю жизнь занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает, откармливает и продает бычков. Сейчас сезон , когда коровы дают потомство и поэтому цены на телят немного упали. Поэтому он решил срочно получить кредит для их покупки.
texts.en:
Ikrom V. lives in the Varzob region. He is 56 years old, married, and has 9 children. He has raised and bred cattle his entire life. He buys, feeds, and resells bull calves. This is the calving season so the price of calves has fallen a bit. He thus decided to request an immediate loan for their purchase. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es grafico y trabaja medio día en una imprenta como empleado y por las tardes esta trabajando como independiente junto a su esposa; ambos están formando una pequeña imprenta que es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos que están en edad escolar. La familia paga alquileres de una vivienda ubicada en la zona Nuevos Horizontes de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito será usado para comprar materia prima (papel por resmas) para incrementar su producción, atender trabajos que recibe y subir sus ingresos familiares. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para otorgarle otro préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Carlos works in the morning part time in a printing company and he does printing jobs independently during the evenings together with his wife. They both have their own printing business, which is their main income source that covers the expenses of their two small children which are still in school. The family pays the rent of a house located at Nuevos Horizontes in the City of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase raw material (reams of paper) to increase their production, cover the jobs they receive and increase their family income. This is the second loan they request to Impro. Their good behavior with their last loan enables them to request for a second loan. Carlos is an IMPRO’s client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Lumateh Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the heart of metropolitan town of Bamenda, Cameroon. She is married to Che Gideon N. and they have four children. She plans to invest this loan in dressmaking. Specifically she will purchase cloth (textile) for dressmaking, a zigzag machine, zip and thread. Her dressmaking workshop is in the town.

This is Lilian's second loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 2007. She is a long-time fashion designer and has many customers.

With the profit from this loan, Lilian plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medication. She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the small repayment installments.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Lumateh Lilian from  Cameroon

loans.use: To buy cloth, zigzag machine, zip and thread.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. JOSE ROBERTO C. GONZALES tiene una pulpería desde hace 8 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en la Populosa Colonia San Juan, es casado y padre de 3 hijos, solo uno depende de su matrimonio, su hija cursa la secundaria en un centro Educativo de la ciudad.
Con los ingresos que le genera dicho negocio le permite cubrir con los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, tambien tiene una pequeña finca de cafe esto le genera otros ingresos economicos.  El y su amada esposa atienden su negocio por lo que es bien administrado y a su vez don BETO como se le conoce en la colonia, realiza trabajos de albañileria esto tambien de da mas ingresos extras para cumplir con sus compromisos,  esta solicitando un credito finanaciero para surtir su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de su amable clientela.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Roberto C. Gonzales has operated a general store for 8 years. His business is located in his house in the San Juan neighborhood. He's married and the father of 3 children, only one of whom still lives at home. His daughter is a student at a city high school. The income from the business is enough to cover family expenses and other financial commitments. He also has a small farm where he grows coffee, a business that generates additional income. He and his beloved wife make sure the business is well managed. At the same time, Don Beto, as he's know in the neighborhood, works in construction, another way that he earns the money he needs to meet his commitments. He's applying for a loan so that he can stock his business and meet the demand of his terrific customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Mahsudchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махсудчону Султонову 25 лет, но не смотря на его молодость, он уже достаточно хорошо умеет зарабатывать деньги. Махсудчон торгует на рынке мужской обувью. Покупает товар у поставщиков и продает его на рынке. Первый раз Махсудчон кредитовался у нас в январе месяце, ему понравились наши условия кредитования, и он получил хорошую прибыль от продажи обуви, которые приобрел на полученный кредит. Теперь он опдал заявку на получения нового кредита, так как его доход и наш кредит, дают ему возможность разнообразить свой товар. Махсудчон планирует в ассортимент своего товара включить детскую обувь.
Наш клиент женат и ростит дочь.
texts.en:
Mahsudchon S. is 25 years old, but even he is so young he knows well how to make money. Mahsudchon sells mens shoes on the market. The buys the merchandise from suppliers and resells on the market. Mahsudchon has taken out a loan for the first time in January. He liked our loan terms and he received good profit from selling of shoes which he bought using the loan money. Now he has applied for a new loan as his income and the loan let him add variety to his merchandise. Mahsudchon plans to include children's shoes into the assortment of his inventory. Our client is married and raising a daughter.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's shoes

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: La Sra. Lizet M. H., tiene como actividad económica la venta de verduras en el mercado El Tejar puesto fijo, actividad que desarrolla hace ocho años, constituyéndose en una fuente de ingresos para su familia, la misma  que esta compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, siendo el esposo tarbajador a destajo, es decir no tiene un trabajo seguro.
texts.en:
Lizet M. H. sells vegetables at a stall in the El Tejar market. She has been doing this work for eight years and it is a source of income for her family. Her family is made up of her husband and two children. Her husband does piecework, which is to say that he doesn’t have a secure job.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A loan for increasing her working capital so she can buy vegetables and grocery items

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is forty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters who are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Western Region of Ghana.

Gloria is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells at the market square. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

Gloria desires to give all her children a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Joffre

texts.en:
Joffre has done laboratory work for dental clinics since 2001 when he moved to the U.S. from Ecuador where he studied orthodontics. One day, one of the clinic doctors told him he would give him some space for his own lab if he worked in his clinic. Joffre immediately took the chance to form new relationships with other clinics and help them do more lab work.

He now has two employees, and he wants to make his lab bigger. Though he hasn’t used other forms of credit before, he heard about ACCION USA’s micro-loans from a friend who was a client. Though he struggled with the decrease in income during the off-season (around December), he is excited to start building his credit with loans from AUSA.

Joffre is using his loan to purchase a new machine that specializes in forming dentures using a special plastic-based material. These dentures are more durable and mold better to the gums. He plans to continue improving his business and watching it grow. As a true craftsman, he loves his job and enjoys seeing the way that his business helps people.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for forming dentures

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To process fish products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mahmoud has owned a mobile phone shop for over a year. He has owned a mobile phone, accessories and mobile recharge cards and repairs mobile phones. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase used mobile phones, recharge cards and accessories for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because of his good reputation and competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mahmoud first started his business, he had financial issues, but those ended 6 months after he opened his shop. He decided on doing his business because of his experience in IT and mobile phones. In the future, he plans on expanding by opening a second mobile phone shop.

loans.use: To purchase used mobile phones, recharge cards and accessories for his work

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Lourdes es casada, tiene 62 años y 8 hijos, Lourdes tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Lourdes piensa trabajar para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the "Llamkasun" (which means "We Work") Community Bank. Lourdes is married, is 62 years old and has eight children. Lourdes has a shop in her home where she sells general groceries, work that she performs every day. Lourdes needs a loan of 1050 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Lourdes plans to work to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La  señora Juana M. de 60 años de edad, es una mejer trabajadora que desde joven ayudaba a sus padres a trabajar ya que su familia ha sido muy humilde económicamente, es casada, sus hijos viven independientes, su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad, por falta de ingresos no ha podido mejorar su casa es de zinc sarroso. Pero le hecha muchas ganas al trabajo para poder hacer las mejoras  a su casa que espera verla bonita ante de morirse. Reside en el barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua, trabaja en la venta de leña y acarreo de materiales de construcción, como botar basura entre otro en una carreta ayudada de dos caballos, los cuales son parte de su trabajo, con este crédito es su doce avo en Afodenic muy agradecida por el apoyo que le han dado. Con este invertirá en la compra de leña, paca de ropa, carne de cerdo, para vender y ofrecer la variedad a sus clientes como la captación de nuevos clientes y mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Comprar leña, paca de ropa y otros para vender mas

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie J. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 28 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Julie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector.
