While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Julie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Julie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Julie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 35-year-old single mother of five children, aged between 7 and 15 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people. Victoria takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity but no piped water; they get three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying second-hand clothes from Nakawa market.

Victoria works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop selling all types of second-hand clothes in Naguru Go- Down Zone. She sells both retail and wholesale. Victoria works seven days a week .She receives an average of 30 customers a day. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices for second-hand clothes . Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

Victoria has been in this business for over ten years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Victoria joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more second-hand clothes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sexcond-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Zevgee

texts.en:
Zegvee is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two adult children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Zegvee sells livestock and animal meat. He purchases his product from the countryside and sells them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, where the meat fetches higher prices. He started this business in 2006 after three years of running a felt retail business. Zegvee is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) to purchase a large number of livestock for the upcoming winter months which he can sell at a higher profit margin in the city.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.


To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia


To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase a large number of livestock.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 10 años atrás (reingresante), del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
Yanet se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró edredones polares.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar  radios, relojes, cámaras,etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes y que su hijo sea profesional.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las reuniones.
texts.en:
Yanet, 28, has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli" communal bank, which is located in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department, for the last 10 years (returning member). She completed secondary school and is a single mother of a son. Yanet peddles general merchandise. With her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement she bought thermal bedspreads. Yanet now needs 1500 new soles to buy radios, watches, cameras, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store and to see her son become a professional. What she likes the most about her communal bank is the savings and the punctuality of the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches, radios, cameras.

loans.name: Luisa Eloysaa

texts.es: Luisa Eloysaa tiene la edad de 56 años. Tiene 4 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella da inicio a esta actividad por que los ingresos que generaba son muy pocos, además que todos los días tiene que arreglar sus productos ya que tiene que ir al mercado en busca de las diferentes golosinas entre otras cosas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pan, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, jugos, refrescos naturales y gaseosas ya que en esta temporada festiva sus clientes solicitan estos productos.
texts.en:
Luisa Eloysaa is 56 years years old. She has four children that work on their own. Her business is a small grocery store. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than 31 years. She began this activity because the income that she earned before was very low. Every day she has to organize her products, and she has to go to the market in search of various sweets and other things. The financing that Luisa is requesting is for working capital to buy bread, rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, juices, and natural soft drinks, since her clients request these products during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, juices, and natural soft drinks for the holiday season

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en:
KH. H. is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband is pictured here in the photo.

H. is employed in a local garment factory in the town, and she is able to earn an income of USD 2.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been working there since 2005. Her husband sells shoes in the city, earning an income of USD 6.60 per day.

H. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, H. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase equipment to produce shoes for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy equipment to produce shoes

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Betty es soltera, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Betty vende ropa a pedido, sus ventas los realiza a amigos y familiares al crédito, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además compra y vende ganado.
Betty necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos.
Los sueños de Betty es tener casa propia y que su hijos salga adelante.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the Communal Bank “Hormigas” (Ants). She is 43 years old, single, and has one child.

Betty sells clothing upon request. Her sales are made to friends and relatives on credit. She engages in this business every day. In addition, she buys and sells cattle.

Betty needs a loan of 600 soles in order to buy polo shirts. Her dreams include having a home of her own and seeing her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase polo shirts

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Marta Elizabeth E. posee un comercio de venta de Calzados que lleva el nombre de Calzados Ysapy
posee antigüedad en el ramo y cuenta con clientela formada
también posee local propio en el nuevo circuito comercial.

Vive en casa propia en el barrio San Pedro de la cuidad de Encarnación.

La cliente es soltera y tiene una hija de 9 años. 
El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercaderías de estación que son calzados escolares.
texts.en:
Sra. Marta Elizabeth E. manages a shoe store called “Calzados Ysapy”. She has experience in this sector and has accumulated an established clientele. Her store is located in the newer commercial district.

She owns a home in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Encarnación. Marta is single and has a nine year old daughter. Her loan will be used to purchase seasonal merchandise, such as school shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school shoes

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en: Jennifer D. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 27 years old and is the group leader of a 20-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jennifer D.. Jennifer is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn G. is an industrious woman who is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI. This is for additional capital for growing her current cattle and hog/pig fattening business using her previous loan received from ASHI. Now that she has proven her capacity to pay back the full amount of the previous loan and her business has brought happiness to her and her family, she aims to make it profitable and sustainable as a source of financial support to sustain the education of her children until they graduate from college and their lives are changed.  

Being a mother to her 10 children, Marlyn has no other wish but for them to experience life not just being poor.  For now, she knows she has a lot of challenges to face in order to achieve her dreams, especially for her one special child.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Agnes is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a food stall selling specialty food products in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa B., 32 years old, is a rice farmer from Veruela Agusan del Sur. She has a dream, to see her children become successful professionals in different fields, a dream that all of them will grow healthy and respectful. She started her livelihood last April 2008. The farm income really helps her provide for the daily needs in their home.

She would like to apply for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Aba Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Agartha K. calls herself a humble and honest petty trader who sells all kinds of fruit, vegetables and other foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past 20 years and has been able to support her family with the proceeds from her business. As a result of her honesty she buys from farmers on credit and pays back only after she has sold everything. She says this comes with a cost since she has to pay more than the normal price for items sold to her on credit. 

Agartha hopes to own her own store in Sunyani township where she will sell a variety of food items and has been working towards this goal over the years. She also has the dream of supporting her children's education to a level where they will be gainfully employed.

Aba Pa in our local language means a "good seed" and for Agartha and colleagues, whatever loan they receive from lenders is a good seed sown in their business. They hope that this good seed will enable them to attain the dream of expanding their business to the desired level. This group of 10 has been together for a year and hope to maintain forever the unity cord that brought them together.

loans.use: Tomatoes, mangoes, cassava and plantains

loans.name: Virgilda

texts.en:
Virgilda C. is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old and is married with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Virgilda owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Virgilda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virgilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilda successfully repaid her first loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She has now requested a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline N. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell. Jackline is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Longisa Ole

texts.en:
Longisa Ole K. is 50 years old. He is married to Sereya K. and a father of two school-going children. Longisa is a farmer and he has been doing farming for the last ten years and later selling his produce at a profit.

He learned about KADET from a friend who is a registered client of KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Longisa's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend 20,000 KES on ploughing, 10,000 on harrowing, 10,000 on seeds and fertlizer, and 10,000 on planting

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun V. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Chun V. has been married for years and has four children. Three of her children are employed in a nearby country and one is a teenager attending school. 

Chun V. lacks farm supplies to use on her field during the coming season. To help meet her goals, Chun V. has applied for a loan in order to buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction tools like: polisher, saw, hammer, etc.

loans.name: Maria Delma

texts.es:
Doña Maria Delma Z. es madre soltero, comerciante, de la tercera edad pero con mucha energía para sacar adelante su pequeño negocio de venta de comida desde hace treinta y ocho años lo tiene ubicado en el mercado Bisne sector comida, viaja diario desde el municipio el viejo en donde vive junto a su hijo desde hace treinta años, dice sentirse muy agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado ya que son créditos a corto plazo que me permiten tener todo lo necesario para mi negocio y estar lista para atender el gusto de mis clientes
 Doña Maria Delma Z. es clienta activa con más de tres años de trabajar con créditos en CEPRODEL de los cuales ha cancelado veintidós créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad  cabe señalar que todos estos créditos son revolvente cada dos meses, el crédito que tengo activo lo utilice para la compra de granos básicos y otras mercadería que son necesaria para mi negocio
texts.en:
Maria Delma Z. is a single mother; a businesswoman; a senior citizen; and full of energy for moving ahead with business, a 38 year old small food stall, located in the Bisne market’s food section. She travels daily from the town of “El Viejo,” where she has lived with her son for 30 years, and tells us that she is very grateful for the trust that we have placed in her, and that the short term loans have allowed her to have everything she needs for her business, so that she can be ready to attend to her customers’ needs. Maria Delma Z. has been active with CEPRODEL for more than three years and has had 22 previous loans, having demonstrated her responsibility and honesty. It’s fit to say that all of these loans revolve every two months. She says, “I used the current loan to buy basic grains and other items that I needed for my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Lira's Group

texts.en:
Lira A. is the leader of this group. She is forty-three and married. She has three children: her daughters are thirteen and ten and her son is five years old. Her daughters go to school. Her husband is a builder. In 1999, she started planting potatoes. Once, they sold six tons of potatoes for six KGS per kilogram and earned $1045. They used this money for the purchase of cattle for cattle breeding. Now they breed cattle along with planting potatoes. Now, they want to buy saltpeter for the potatoes. However, they don’t have enough money, so she is applying for a loan which would help her to have a better crop, and as a result, higher profits this year.

Group members:

Aizat A. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-one and married.  She has seven children: her five daughters are thirteen, six, three and two years old, and her sons are eleven and ten years old. Following the suggestion of her farther, Aizat bought chickens. She raised them and started selling eggs and she makes about $50 each month. For four years, she provided for the education of her children with the help of the profits from her business. She wants to increase her profits, which can be achieved through an increase in turnover, but she needs more hens for that. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have enough funds, so she applied for a loan in order to buy hens.

Zinakan O. is thirty-four and married. She has three children: her son is eleven and her daughters are seven and two years old. Her two older children go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is applying for a loan with the purpose of covering their family's temporary needs. In the future she is planning to significantly improve her living conditions.

Adilbek S.  is thirty and married. He has two children: his daughter is six years old and his son is eight years old. Both of them go to school. His wife is a teacher. In 2001, he started planting potatoes. With the money received from planting potatoes, he bought cattle. Now, he combines potato planting with cattle breeding. He is applying for a loan in order to buy saltpeter for the potatoes for the autumn season. 

Bolotbek S. is thirty-nine and married. He has three daughters. They are four, three and one year old. He is a farmer, and he grows potatoes. During the eleven years that he has planted potatoes he was able to buy household appliances. He is applying for a loan to buy saltpeter for his potatoes and collect the potatoes this autumn.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy saltpeter

loans.name: Beny

texts.en: Beny T. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old and is married with eight school-aged children. Beny owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals. In 2007, Beny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Beny is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 8th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es: Vivian R. es una mujer soltera que tiene  41 años de edad y confecciona todo tipo de ropas,aprendizaje que adquirió de su tia con la cual vive y trabaja; su experiencia data desde el 2002 cuando al observarla  se interesó en este negocio, pero solo  hasta el 2004 lo inició; su especialidad es  la ropa deportiva y ultimamente consiguio como clientes colegios quienes le hicieron un pedido, por eso necesita  comprar telas, para fabricarle esta línea a sus estudiantes, igualmente  necesita comprar una máquina  terminadora,  con la cual aumentará  la calidad de estos productos y seguramente ganará nuevos clientes.  Este es justamente la razón por la cual solicita  su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización en la que fue  referida por una buena cliente de la Fundación y Vivian con ella de la mano sueña con crecer, porque  su meta es ampliar su taller de confecciones, para continuar aumentando su nivel de vida; actualmente no tiene un capital de trabajo adicional, que la ayude profundizar el mercado de instituciones educativas  y el poco capital con el cual trabaja, no  le permite responder efectivamente a sus clientes reales, que son los colegios a quienes les confecciona sudaderas, ropa deportiva y buzos, para que sus estudiantes practiquen las actividades deportivas, incluidas en su currículo. Otro de sus mercados son los vecinos a quienes les fabrica vestidos, porque la conocen y le gusta como trabaja Vivian  las confecciones y ella espera hacerle su ropa de fin de año para que luzcan elegantes y continuen como sus clientes rentables.
texts.en:
Vivian R., 41, is single. She makes all kinds of clothes. She learned these skills from her aunt with whom she lives and works. Her experience dates back to 2002 when she became interested in this kind of work watching her aunt but only since 2004 that she actually went into it. Her specialty is athletic wear and recently she acquired as customers local schools that placed an order. She, therefore, needs to buy fabric to manufacture this line of student athletic clothes. She also needs to buy a finishing sewing machine that will allow her to improve the quality of her products and surely gain new customers. This is precisely why she is asking for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she was referred to by a good client of the Fundación. Vivian plans to grow hand in hand with it because her goal is to enlarge her workshop to continue improving her quality of life. She currently lacks additional working capital that would help her deepen her involvement with educational institutions and the little capital she works with does not allow her to respond effectively to the real customers she has which are the schools for which she makes sportswear so that the students can participate in athletic activities that are part of the curriculum. Another one of her markets is neighbors for whom she makes dresses because they know her and like the way Vivian makes clothes. She hopes to make their clothes for the end of year festivities so that they will look elegant and continue to be profit generating customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make athletic clothes for students.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Loem H. is a 20-year-old married woman who currently resides in the province of Siem Reap. Loem Hengis has been married for several years, but she doesn’t have any children yet. Loem H. and her husband sell different kinds of products such as perfumes, beauty products, bags and other goods to people who come to buy something in the market. They have experience in this business since 2008, and their business now is running very well because of their good communication skills with all clients, both retailers and wholesalers.

 In order to earn more profit and to make the business more successful, Loem H. will be using the loan she has requested to buy a larger quantity of her inventory items.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Dortsogmaa

texts.en: Dortsogmaa J. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two adult sons in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son is disabled and the youngest son operates a taxi service. Her husband is a carpenter and produces a variety of wood products. Dortsogmaa has been working as a hairdresser since 2008, after working as a butcher from 1998 to 2008. Over this short period of operation, she has built a stable business and has used her earnings to purchase all necessary equipment and tools for her hair salon. For the future, Dortsogmaa hopes to have her own hair salon.  She works very hard and is a clever woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment

loans.name: Gavaa

texts.en: Gavaa U. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and nine-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local secondary school. Gavaa operates a firewood and coal selling business in his town, with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2005 after working and living as a herder in the countryside till 2004. For the future, Gavaa says, "I would like to save more money in order to establish my own fuel trading market further." He is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and has four adult children. Lolita is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Lolita plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clay products to resell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 21 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yamadibougou, sous-préfecture de Konobougou ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du savon et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire et                                                                        BAKO COULIBALY compte s’approvisionner en arachide hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village et au marché de Konobougou après transformation en pâte d’arachide, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes surtout.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married 21 year olds with three children each; they all live in traditional extended families in the Yamadibougou village, in the Konobougou district of the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family links and sell soap and peanuts for a living. The women of the Danaya group are on their fourth loan and Bako Coulibaly aims to purchase peanuts every week from wholesalers at the Konobougou market. She sells peanut paste in the village and at the Konobougou market for cash or credit sales to a customer base mainly made up of women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for healthcare, food and school expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To grow her husband's business and buy a shop

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel F. Ciprian tiene la edad de 37 años, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Isaias Martinez con el cual tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos son hombres a los que llama Isaias  de 10 años de edad  que estudia la primaria y Ismael de 1  años  y dos mujeres que tienen los nombres, Yanely de 15 años de edad que asisten a la Secundaria de en la comunidad de la Reforma y Yaretzi de 6 años que asiste a la primaria en la comunidad que habita.
Doña Maribel y su familia viven en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa que esta hubicada a unos 40 minutos de Tierra Blanca que es el municipio al que pertenece y que esta hubicado en el estado de Veracruz,  para poder llegar a la comunidad de Vista Hermosa se toma un autobus que te deja en la carretera y debes caminar como 25 minutos  para llegar a dicha comunidad.

 Doña Maribel nos platica que hace 7 años inicio con su negocio de venta de Cortinas, colchas, y perfumes por catalogo, la señora Mariel vende sus productos casa por casa en su comunidad y nos dice que gracias a Dios ya tiene algunas clientas pero que quiere que su negocio prospere y que para eso en algunas ocasiones se va a vender a otra comunidad llama Mata Naranjo y a la colonia Obregon, ellas nos cuenta que decidio iniciar su negocio por que desea que sus hijos tengas un mejor futuro y porque quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos y su hogar. Ella va los jueves a comprar sus colchas y cortinas al tianguis que se pone en ciudad aleman para ir a compar necesita dejar encargado a su bebe con su hermana Rebeca, ella se a comprado una bicicleta para poder salir mas rapido a la carretera a tomar el autobus que la lleva a ciudad Aleman. Doña Maribel espera que su negocio siga creciendo ya que desea en un futuro tener su propia casa pero tambien sabe que para lograrlo tiene que tabajar muy duro de la mano de su familia.  Ella tambien nos dice que se encuentra agradecida con la fundacion ya que con este prestamo su negocio prosperara y con sus ganacias espera comprar una poquita de ropa para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel Fabián Ciprian is 37 years old.  She completed 6th grade.  She’s married to Mr. Isaías Martínez with whom she has four children.  Two of them are boys: Isaías, 10, who is in elementary school and Ismael, 1, and two girls, Yanely, 15, who is in middle school in the community of La Reforma and Yaretzi, 6, who goes to the local elementary school.

Doña Maribel and her family live in the community of Vista Hermosa located 40 minutes from Tierra Blanca in Veracruz.  To get to the community of Vista Hermosa one takes a bus that drops you off on the highway and then you must walk about 25 minutes to reach the community.

Doña Maribel tells us that she started her own curtain, bedspread and catalogue perfume sales business 7 years ago.  Maribel sells house to house in her community and tells us that thanks to God she has some customers but she wants her business to prosper so occasionally she goes to another community, called Mata Naranjo, and to the Obregón neighborhood  to sell.  She tells us that she decided to start her own business because she wants her children to have a better future and because she wants to help her husband with her children’s and her household’s expenses.

On Thursdays she goes to buy her bedspreads and curtains at the swap meet that installs itself in Ciudad Alemán.  To do so, she has to leave her baby in her sister Rebeca’s care.  She has bought herself a bicycle in order to get out to the highway to take the bus that takes her to Ciudad Alemán faster.

Doña Maribel hopes that her business will continue to grow because she’d like to own her own house in the future.  She knows, however, that in order to reach this goal she must work very hard hand in hand with her family.  She also tells us that she is grateful to the foundation because her business will prosper with this loan and she hopes to use the profits to buy a little bit of clothes to continue selling.

loans.use: Clothing, sheets and bedspread sales.

loans.name: Laudelina

texts.en:
Laudelina G. is a 60 year old woman who runs a small bookstore and also sells clothing, underwear, shoes, etc. She has been in business for about 25 years. 

In the past, she owned several stores in different places, one of them in the market.  She doesn't have any family to help her with her business, which is the reason why she works extra carefully and passionately in every little thing she does with the ultimate goal of having impeccable customer service. 

The loan given by the foundation was used to buy different goods for her bookstore.  She took advantage of the situation that school is starting so the items will go fast, and the location of her store will also help her a lot (across the street from a school).  Ms. Laudelina thanks the given credit for which she is allowed to grow in terms of her business, thus she gets closer to her goals set as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying of different bookstore goods (paper, pens, etc.)

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "NUEVA ESPERANZA   " es un Bancos que se encuentra en su octavo   ciclo   donD.   demostraron ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: como Presidenta esta la Sra. Elvira   quien es la líder y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. Abarrotes  en  una d las calles mas populosas D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, Esta Separada    y tiene 5  hijos  D. los cuales todos  son independientes su negocio es propio  y el crédito que solicitó es para compra D. mercadería como fideos, aceites, arroz, y así incrementar su Capital D. trabajo. Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Julia  quien  esta casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas y tiene como negocio una tienda D. barrio en su domicilio, y solicitó el crédito para aumentar su capital   es socia antigua y a demostrado ser  una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas, toda las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la foto no se encuentra una D. las socias.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is in its eighth loan cycle and the group members have proven to be responsible and hardworking people. The following members serve as the group representatives:

Elvira is the president, and is the leader and founder of the group. She has a business selling groceries on one of the most populous streets in the city of Cochabamba. She is separated and has five children who are all independent of her. Elvira owns her business and the loan that she requested is for the purchase of merchandise like pasta, oil, rice, and to increase her working capital.

Julia is the treasurer and is married with two small children. She has a neighborhood store in her house and she requested the loan to increase her capital. She is a previous borrower and has proven to be a very responsible person and punctual with her payments.

All of the group members are responsible and hardworking people and they are grateful to Emprender for the support provided. One of the group members does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like pasta, oil, and rice

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Sophon is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some of it and the rest is used for the family.  Her husband, Chan, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. 

To improve this condition, Sophon is seeking a loan to start a new business by buying four piglets for breeding and pig food for them.

She is the mother of a child who is five months old.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig food

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Cliente nuevo La Sra Rosa Maria P. C. tiene 29 años , solicita el credito para capital de trabajo con el dinero comprara mesas y invertir en el negocio su esposo que  es transportista alquila tico tiene tres hijos en edad escolar vive en la casa de su abuela que lo comparten con sus tios es una pareja joven que tiene los deseos de superacion y salir adelante con sus tres hijos y lograr tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Sra Rosa Maria P. C. is a new client. She is 29 years old and requesting this loan to use as operating capital. She will buy tables and invest in her husband’s business. He works in transportation by renting out a taxi.

Rosa and her husband have three school age children. They live at her grandmother’s house along with her aunt and uncle. This young couple has the desire to succeed and move their three children forward. She also wants to have her own business.

loans.use: To purchase tables and invest in her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es:
Grettel  U. P.
Operación 2011-81
500000 colones

Grettel U. P. tiene 41 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto año del colegio, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad, uno está en la escuela y el mayor en el colegio. Llegó a Fundación Mujer por referencia de una clienta Elia Ruiz, quien tiene una panadería y ha trabajado con esta institución desde el año 2004. Gretel está solicitando su tercer crédito y ha tenido una excelente conducta de pago.
La clienta se dedica al comercio de ropa de hombre, mujer y niño desde hace mas de 10 años, ella trabaja con su esposo quien se dedica también al comercio, su herramienta principal es el vehículo, el cual utilizan para el transporte de mercadería y el cobro, hace unos meses sufrieron un accidente de tránsito, la persona responsable no se ha hecho cargo de los daños, por lo que solicitan este préstamo para comprar repuestos para el carro y ponerlo en funcionamiento nuevamente, ya que es urgente para su negocio.
Entre sus labores diarias esta la visita a sus clientes, recoger pedidos y atender las labores del hogar, esto se ha dificultado a causa del accidente. Una de sus metas es realizarse como comerciante y poner un local en la zona céntrica de Puntarenas, cuidad de la costa pacífica de Costa Rica, donde ella reside.
El beneficio con el crédito sería enorme, ya que pondría en funcionamiento una de sus principales herramientas para el negocio.
texts.en:
Grettel  U. P.
Operation 2011-81
500000 colones

Grettel U. P., 41, finished tenth grade.  She lives with her husband and two minor children. One of them is in elementary school and the oldest is in secondary school.  She came to Fundación Mujer referred by a client, Elia Ruiz, who has a bakery and has worked with the institution since 2004.  Gretel is asking for her third loan and has had an excellent payment history.

She has been selling clothing for men, women and children for over 10 years.  She works with her husband who is also a merchant.  Her main work tool is a vehicle that they use to transport the merchandise and to collect payments.  A few months ago they were in a traffic accident.  The person to blame has not paid damages to date so they need a loan to buy replacement parts for the car and get it in working order again because it’s urgently needed for their business.

Among her daily tasks is visiting customers, taking orders and seeing to her domestic chores.  Because of the accident, all this has become more difficult.  One of her goals is to become fulfilled as a merchant and to open a centrally located store in Puntarenas, a city on Costa Rica’s Pacific coast, which is where she lives.

The benefit of the loan would be enormous because it would put her main work tool back to work for the business.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Magda Ligia

texts.es: La señora Magda Ligia Chávez, tiene la edad de 47 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , es una pequeña comerciante que lucha día a día para poder salir hacia adelante con su familia ; su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo de seis años actualmente estudiante de primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder darle un mejor bienestar a su pequeño hijo y poder comprar un tramo en el mercado y poner una tienda ya que es su mayor sueño .Doña Magda desde hace más de  ocho años se dedica a la venta de ropa y comestico la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder  contar con mercadería suficiente y poder abastecer a sus cliente . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ropa y cosmético ya que de esa manera su inventario crece y sus ventas serán mayores y a la vez su ingreso para poder pagar en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Sra. Magda Ligia Chávez is 47 years old and resides in the town of Ticuantepe. She is a small businesswoman who struggles each day so that her family can get ahead. Her husband helps with the household expenses. They have a six-year-old son who is currently an elementary school student. Her plans for the future are to provide the best for her young son’s welfare, purchase a stand at the market, and fulfill her greatest dream of opening a store.

Doña Magda has been selling clothing and cosmetics for eight years. Her greatest difficulty is not having enough merchandise whenever her customers place their orders. This loan will be used to buy clothing and cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory and generate more sales. With the income she earns, Magda will be able to repay her loan on time and according to terms.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ QORILAZO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Cachona - Santiago, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Estefa, ella tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 9, 7 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y trabaja atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes, la socia también alberga  a los miembros de este banco en su casa en cada reunión que tiene, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la implementación de sus tienda de abarrotes ella desea compra productos de primera necesidad al por mayor, la socia comprar harinas, leche, arroz entre otros productos.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Estefa's communal bank is called “Qorilazo” and it's located in the town of Cachona-Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco.

Estefa is 33 years old and has 3 children, aged 12, 9, and 7. She is living with a partner and operates her grocery store. She hosts the members of the bank in her house for their meetings.

Estefa wants to invest this loan in merchandise for her grocery store, including products of primary necessity such as flour, milk, and rice, among other products.

Estefa is very grateful and she promises to comply with her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, and rice, among other products, to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry es socio del Banco Comunal Imasumacc, tiene 35 años, conviviente, es moto taxista, solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. Está en Finca Perú con este el cuartos ciclo ingreso por la invitación de la promotora, le gusta por los créditos y se puede ahorrar. Con sus crédito pudo comprar artefactos para su domicilio. Ahora está ahorrando para comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Henry is a member of the Communal Bank “Imasumacc”. He is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and works as motorcycle taxi driver. Henry is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

He has participated in four loan cycles with FINCA Peru after being invited to join by a promoter. Henry enjoys the loans and being able to save. With his loans, he has been able to buy furnishings for his home. Now he is saving to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Union Popular Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Unión Popular", porque así se llama el lugar donde viven. Las clientas consideran que este nombre es de buena suerte. El grupo se encuentra conformado por 10 integrantes entre las cuales esta la señora Eliza quien es originaria de la comunidad. El grupo esta ubicado en Hidalgo, México. La señora Eliza es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 8, y 11 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de helados naturales. Sus clientes la consideran como una gran persona, dedicada al trabajo y al bienestar de su familia. Comenta que comenzó su negocio hace 4 años, debido a que las necesidades de su familia incrementaban y el ingreso de su esposo no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos. Decidió iniciar su propio negocio. Conforme han transcurrido los años el negocio se ha consolidado debido a la atención y dedicación que muestra. Ella quiere el prestamo para invertir en materia prima como agua, azucar, frutas, hielos etc. debido a que se encuentra en una temporada alta, y requiere de mayor inversión. Con las ganancias que obtenga seguira invirtiendo en su negocio y para la educación de sus hijos ya que desea que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is called "Unión Popular" because that's what the members call the place where they live. The members consider the name to be good luck. The group consists of 10 members, and among them is Eliza, who is a native of the community in Hidalgo, Mexico. Eliza is married and has three children, ages 7, 8 and 11. She makes a living selling natural ice creams. Her customers consider her to be a great person who is dedicate to her job and to her family's well-being. She says she started working four years ago out of necessity because her family was growing and her husband's income wasn't enough to cover expenses. She decided to start her own business. As the years have past her business has become established due to the attention and dedicate she shows. Eliza is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials such as water, sugar, fruits, ice, etc., since this it's a busy season that requires greater investment. With the money she makes she will continue investing in the business and in the education of her children, from whom she wants to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as water, sugar, fruits and ice for an ice cream business.

loans.name: Mariecor

texts.en: Mariecor is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and two children. For the last two years, she has made a living running a retail shop where she sells biscuits, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. In this photo, we see Mariecor and her two daughters. She's a new member of HSPFI and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits and bread.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 44 years old.  She is married with six children who are between 6 and 17 years old.  She sells items such as: cooking oil, juice, rice, bananas and so on. Her business is well-organized. She has been in this business for one year and she works from 6 am until 9 pm everyday except on Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her.

To improve her business, Francoise has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods like: rice, bananas, books, water, cooking oil and juice to sell.  With the extra profits, Francoise will reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like: rice, bananas, books, water and so on to sell.

loans.name: Mobil

texts.en:
Mobil is 43 years old, married, and has one daughter. He has 8 years of experience in the animal-husbandry business. He has a small cow-house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Mobil`s wife helps him a lot.

Mobil buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells at the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Mobil wants to buy young cattle and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan of 1200 AZN. He is very grateful to all those who can support him.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and one pregnant cow.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 56, lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Milagros has a retail shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for five years. Milagros has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy green and yellow bananas.

Milagros is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Sylvia has a food shop that sells banana cue (deep-fried bananas with caramelized sugar) and fried bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Sylvia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sylvia hopes to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa, de 47 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre. Es casada pero su esposo vive en el extranjero y ella vive sola en su casa propia.El trabajo de Justa empieza muy temprano, cuando se va a su puesto del mercado Micaela Bastidas a abrir su puesto, ahí ella empieza el día limpiando sus instrumentos de trabajo para después esperar a los clientes. Ella realiza buenos y bonitos cortes de pelo a caballeros y modernos cortes a mujeres. Justa es dueña de dos puestos en uno de ellos esta un trabajador que ella contrato y en el otro está ella. Lleva ya 21 años en este trabajo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener libertad y tener a los tipos de compañeros que tiene a lado. Siempre tiene clientes y por eso genera buenos ingresos, además ella tiene muchos proyectos en mente, le gustaría mas adelante poder mejorar su local y comprar mas cosas para tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus fieles clientes.Este es el préstamo número 16 entre Justa y la institución, se lleva bien con todos del grupo y espera seguir recibiendo el apoyo brindado hasta ahora por la institución MFP.Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, ella comprará productos para tener en stock, además de arreglar y refaccionar su local.
texts.en: Justa, 47, is a hardworking and cheerful woman.  She is married but her husband lives outside the country, so she lives alone in her own house.  Justa starts her work very early in the morning when she goes to her stall in the Micaela Bastidas market to open her business.  There, she starts her day cleaning her work tools and awaiting her customers.  Justa provides attractive haircuts for men, and modern cuts for women.  Justa owns two stalls; she works in one of them and hires a worker for the other.  She has been doing this work for 21 years.  What she likes most about her work is to have freedom and to have companions at her side.  She always has customers and so generates a good income.  In addition, she has a lot of plans for the future in mind; she would like to be able to improve her stalls and buy more items so that she can have a greater variety of products to offer to her loyal customers.  This is the 16th loan between Justa and the Institución.  She gets along well all of the members of her group, and hopes to continue receiving the support that has been provided up until now by the Institución MFP.  With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy products to have in stock, and she will also repair and refurbish her business premises.

loans.use: to buy products to have in stock, and repair and refurbish her business premises

loans.name: Rayil

texts.en:
Rayil is 62 years old and a responsible man. He is married and has two daughters and two sons, all of whom are married. Rayil and his wife did their best to provide a better life for their children. 

All of his life, Rayil has been buying and selling animals. With help from his eldest son, Rayil sells dairy and meat in the local bazaar. He is a hardworking man and wants to expand his animal-breeding business. For this reason, he decided to apply for his second loan from AqroInvest. He requested 1500 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy 10 more sheep and feed for them. He hopes that the extra income this loan will provide will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более 16 лет занимается животноводством. В основном он закупает крупнорогатый скот, разводит и через некоторое время продает. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Nurali lives in the Bohtar region. He is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been in the animal husbandry business for more than sixteen years. He mainly buys large horned cattle, breeds and then sells after a period of time. He is taking out the loan to buy several heads of calves.

loans.use: to buy several heads of calves

loans.name: Mersal

texts.en:
Mersal is a 37-year-old married man who has been working selling curtains and cloth for 13 years. He is well-known in the region with his good quality products and special prices.

Mersal also works at tailoring curtains and home decorations. He works hard to improve his business more and more in the region, and that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new cloth collections at affordable prices.

Mersal is a man with a good reputation who hopes he can expand his business more and more in the future to start a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy new cloth collections.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 59 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.  Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace varios años tiene un negocio en el garaje de  su casa, allí vende ropa, accesorios, productos de papelería, y artículos para el hogar, pues debido a su situación económica se vio obligada a generar ingresos para las necesidades de su familia, y con la ilusión de ir incrementando esos ingresos actualmente vende comidas rápidas los fines de semana a las afueras de su miscelánea.

A sus 53 años de edad Luz Mery sueña con un mejor futuro por lo que quiere ampliar su negocio, comprando un surtido de mayor cantidad en accesorios, ropa y papelería, logrando un aumento de las utilidades, sin embargo no cuenta con el monto de dinero necesario para hacer estas compras, es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un préstamo que le permita mejorar las ventas, satisfacer mas clientes y aumentar sus ingresos, así su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente y su sueño de tener un futuro mas tranquilo y estable comenzará a cumplirse poco a poco.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is an enterprising woman who has operated a business out of the garage of her home for several years. There she sells clothing, accessories, stationery, and household goods. Due to her financial situation, she was obligated to generate income for her family’s needs. In order to increase her income, she currently sells fast food on the weekends outside of her variety store.

At 53 years of age, Luz Mery dreams of having a better future, so she wants to expand her business. She plans to buy a large stock of accessories, clothing, and stationery so that she can increase her profits. However, she does not have the necessary funds to make these purchases. For this reason, she is requesting a loan today that will help to improve her sales, satisfy more customers, and increase her income. As a result, her quality of life will improve considerably and her dream of having a more peaceful and stable future will start to take shape a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, and stationery.

loans.name: Sisimukha Group

texts.en:
Gladys is the facilitator of the Sisimukha loan group. Gladys and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Gladys takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's prices, to ensure food security for her family, and later to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Gladys had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gladys was only able to harvest three and a half bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Gladys will educate her children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of the Sisimukha group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 54, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Peregrino, 53, who is self-employed. They have two children. The older child helps her in her business; the younger is in elementary school. Her business is a big help in sustaining the family. 

Alma owns a variety store. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Apart from her business, she also maintains a small apartment that is being rented for 2,500 PHP a month. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items so she can have more stock. She also plans to make her store a little bit bigger. She believes that this will help her to gain income and profit as it will definitely attract more customers to buy in her store. It will help her to save more money for the expenses of her children in school. 

Alma hopes that her business will turn into a grocery someday. She wants to become a successful businesswoman. She hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life once they settle down. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as the sharing inspires her to be optimistic in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jua Kali Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jua Kali Group in Western Kenya! Zipporah is the facilitator of the Jua Kali group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Zipporah takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Zipporah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Zipporah was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zipporah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Zipporah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jua Kali group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amani B Group

texts.en:
Erastus is the facilitator of the Amani B group. Erastus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Erastus takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Erastus had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Erastus was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Erastus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Erastus will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amani B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Romelita has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands (tasty dishes) like afritada (tomato-based chicken dish) & caldereta (beef stew). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Romelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Komeza I Group

texts.fr:
Pamphile est une commerçant âgé de 64 ans qui habite à Rutegama . Il vend des planches depuis 17ans. Il a commencé cette activité alors qu’il faisait l’agriculture. Il  a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Il est marié à Pauline et ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de planches à vendre, une autre partie du crédit servira à l’achat de bananes destinées aussi au marché. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Komeza I».
texts.en:
Pamphile is a 64-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Rutegama. He has been selling boards for 17 years. He started this business when he was a farmer. He studied up until the sixth year of primary school. He is married to Pauline and they have seven children together of whom three study.

The Kiva loan that he gets will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy many boards to sell; another part of the loan will be used to buy bananas also destined for the market.

He is a member of the community group Komeza I.

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy many boards to sell, and to buy bananas also destined for the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: La señora Zulma es una mujer muy trabajadora  que la mayoría del día se la pasa fuera de su casa, como es divorciada y tiene un hijo como de 12 años se preocupa por su bienenestar. Zulma observando en la situación que está en el país con tanta delincuencia se preocupa por el patrimonio que será para su hijo. Por lo que pensó en instalar protecciones en las ventanas de su casa para brindar a su familia mayor seguridad y de esta manera cuidar sus cosas que con mucho esfuerzo ah comprado. Para realizar su proyecto necesita capital para comprar las protecciones y pagar la instalación; de esta manera ella se irá a su trabajo sin pendiente.
texts.en:
Zulma is a very hard-working woman, who spends the majority of the day away from home, as she is divorced, and has a 12-year-old son whose well-being is her concern. As Zulma looks at the situation in the country, with so much crime, she is concerned about what she will be able to pass on to her son. 

So she thought about installing bars on the windows of her home, to offer her family greater security, and in this way take care of her possessions, that she has bought with much effort. 

To carry out her project, she needs capital to buy the security bars, and pay for installation. This way, she will leave for work without worrying.

loans.use: To install security bars on her windows.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a young lady aged 21 years, married and has one child. She is a strong member of Inkiramat women group. Peninah loves learning new things and makes sure that she attends all trainings normally organized by WEEC. Peninah is hard working and focused. Her business is buying and selling steers and milk to residents of Isinya and Kitengera Town. She sells 35 litres of milk per day and this brings in daily income thus, paying back will not be a problem. Peninah has a manageable family and the surplus income she is making is being saved to build rental rooms. She has a plot of land at Kitengera which she wants to develop as soon as she gets the money. She will be assured of passive income every month which is the right path to financial freedom.

loans.use: Peninah wants to start building rental rooms in Kitengera.

loans.name: Sirinbeyim

texts.en: Sirinbeyim M. lives in Agsu city and runs a small booth at the local bazaar selling clothing. She is married with four children. She has owned her business for three years. With this loan she hopes to expand her inventory by purchasing more stock.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 26, and her husband is 30. They have no land, but they rent from a neighbor to grow vegetables. Their activities include selling groceries and growing vegetables. Their income is $11 per person/month. They would like a loan of $75 from the Kiva program to purchase a variety of goods for their grocery. They are going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for their grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a cereal business.

loans.name: Reina Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is Reina Suyapa and I have a small business selling clothing from a shop centrally located in my city. I have been in business for 3 years and fortunately have been able to generate enough income to support my family. I am a single mother with two school-age children.

I am requesting this loan to buy more inventory to be able to provide my customers with a better selection of clothes, because more variety results in greater sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Reina Suyapa, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que gracias ha Dios me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos los que estan en la escuela.

Actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos, tomando en cuenta que estos negocios entra mas surtido esta mejores son las ventas ya que el cliente se atrae con el surtido, con la variedad de productos.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
MARIA ROSA has a convenience store out of her house where she sells: sugar, rice, cooking oil, drinks, cookies, and sweets. She is 39 years old and has three children. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 2 together with Ms. Magdalena Méndez López (handicraft artist) and Ms. Teresa López Hernández (handicraft artist). Maria Rosa will invest in the purchase of a variety of products to add to her convenience store. Magdalena and Teresa will invest in the purchase of cloth and thread in order to increase production of their handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ROSA tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en donde vende: azúcar, arroz, aceite, bebidas, galletas, dulces. Ella tiene 39 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 2 junto con doña Magdalena Méndez López (artesana) y doña Teresa López Hernández (artesana). Maria rosa invertirá en la compra de una variedad de productos para surtir la tienda de abarrotes, Magdalena y Teresa en la compra de telas e hilos para aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: Convenience Store

loans.name: Nonoussi

texts.fr:
Born in 1962 in Vo-Koutimé, Mrs. Nonoussi A. is married and the mother of seven (07) children, she lives in the village of Avégloédjigan. Very early on she embarked on the second-hand clothing business that she has been practicing for almost 30 years. She manages with her inadequate means and contributes to the expenses of the household with the little income she draws. To reinforce her business and increase her income, she is requesting a loan of $ 250. This will allow her to buy clothing of different styles and fulfill her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1962 à Vo-Koutimé, Madame A. Nonoussi est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants et vit dans le village d’Avégloédjigan. Elle s’est très tôt lancée dans le commerce de friperie qu’elle pratique depuis bientôt 30 ans. Elle se débrouille avec ses maigres moyens et arrive à participer à la gestion de son ménage avec le peu de revenu qu’elle en tire. Pour renforcer cette activité et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit de $250. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter plus d’habit de tout genre et satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of bale of used clothing

loans.name: Chini Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Chini Devi M., 40 years old, lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district, Nepal. Thecho is one of the developing village of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one son, and one daughter. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 9 and 8 respectively.
