Her husband, Mr. Gopal M., is a plumber. Her husband’s work is the only source of family income. For his work he needs various types of tools and other raw materials. So Mrs. M. is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to help her husband to buy modern tools for his work. She will be very grateful if this first loan through Kiva is granted to her.

loans.use: To buy modern tools for her husband's plumbing business

loans.name: Rosa Marlenis

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Marlenis M. is a woman who makes a living by selling food. She started gaining experience in this line of work when she was young, since she previously worked with a woman who made food. She tells us that she started her business when she noticed that her husband's income wasn't enough to support their nuclear family. This is why she started selling food only at night at in their home, and she says that this helped her because her husband later abandoned her when their children were still small.

Doña Rosa has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she feels very satisfied with the credits offered to her. They came at opportune moments, helping her to supply the necessities to her business. She has a record of 21 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Rosa Marlenis M. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, ella desde joven tiene experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio, ya que anteriormente ella trabajó con una señora en la elaboración de los alimentos. Nos cuenta que el negocio lo comienza cuando nota que los ingresos de su esposo no le ayudan para mantener el núcleo familiar, por lo que comienza a vender comida solo por las noches en su casa y según dice, esto le ayudó porque posteriormente su esposo la abandona cuando sus hijos todavía estaban pequeños.

Doña Rosa trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se les ha brindado en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio, ella tiene un record de 21réditos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her food

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria R. is 36 years old and she studied through middle school. She has two dependent children. She lives in the district of Mache, in the province of Otuzcu, in La Libertad department, Peru.

She buys and sells cereal grains, such as wheat, barley, and dried peas. She also has farm plot where she plants potatoes. She sells all of these products in the city of Trujillo. Aside from this business, she also raises small livestock animals: guinea pigs, turkeys, and chickens, which she later sells.

Her mother-in-law introduced her to the communal bank “Mujeres de Mache” (Women of Mache), where she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00. With this money she bought two turkeys and some guinea pigs. It was around Christmas time and she wanted to take advantage of the good opportunity to sell these animals.

With this loan of S/. 2,200.00, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy two average-sized bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria R. tiene 36 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad - Perú Se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales tales como trigo, cebada, alverja, además tiene su chacra en la que siembra papa, todos estos productos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Trujillo. A parte de este negocio también cría animales menores: cuyes, pavos y gallinas para venderlos posteriormente. Por medio de su suegra ingresa al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Mache” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro dos pavos y cuyes ya que por ese tiempo era campaña navideña y quería aprovechar en vender estos animales. Con el préstamo de S/.2,200.00 el cual pagará en cuatro meses comprará dos toros de regular tamaño.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy 2 bulls

loans.name: Mahmurod

texts.ru:
Mahmurod H. lives in Gissar distrct. He is 40 and married with three children. He does not have a formal education. He owns a store that sells food products. He has been in business for about six years. However, the store alone doesn't provide enough income for his family, so Mahmurod also raises livestock. He buys calves and fattens them for 40-45 days, then sells them on at a profit. This business is popular and well accepted in rural areas and for this reason, brings Mahmurod income. At the moment, the amount of money he can put into his business has decreased, and he needs to increase the number of calves in his care. He needs a loan to do this. This will help Mahmurod re-establish his business and get the income his family needs. He plans to repay his loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Махмурод живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 40 лет , женат и имеет 3 детей. Образования не имеет. Имеет магазин продуктов питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 6 лет. Магазин дает доход не достаточный для его семьи, поэтому клиент еще занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности , поэтому дает доход. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru:
Abduvohid A. lives in Rudaki region. He is 43 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a high school diploma. He finished school and opened his own farming business. Abduvohid has a large plot of land where he raises vegetables. Soon, it will be potato collecting season, and after that he will need to plant new potatoes. For this purpose he needs seeds and fertilizer. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months. Abduvohid's business ensures that markets have ecologically clean goods.

Абдушукуров Абдувохид живет в районе Рудаки. Ему 43года , он женат и имеет 2 детей. Образования среднее. Он закончил школу и занялся частным предпринимательством в сфере сельского хозяйства.. Имеет большой участок земли. Там он сей и выращивает овощи. Скоро начнется сбор картофеля и землю нужно будет засеить снова. Для этого нужно подготовить семена и удобрения. Для этого он хочет получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Его деятельность позволяет обеспечить рынки экологически чистыми продуктами.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Y. Karim is 40 years old. He is married. He has three children. Karim is a market vendor. He is selling the brooms in the local market. As a rule, he purchases the brooms from the neighboring country Uzbekistan, from the city of Kokand. Karim has been in this business for eleven years. His wife and elder son help him with painting the brooms. Usually they paint the brooms with the red color in order to give them a good look to attract clients. Therefore his goods are in great demand.

The business is stable and allows Karim to use the generated income for improving the living conditions of the family. He is trying to do all the best in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. Now his elder son is going to enter the University, and that’s why he needs to expand his business and increase the working capital for purchasing the brooms. With this purpose, he requests $700 for the term of 9 months. Karim is counting on your help and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase of the brooms

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru:
Tahmina V. lives in Dushanbe. She is a saleswoman in the Sadvarg shopping center. She has been selling women’s clothing for almost five years. She is married and has two children. Her husband is unemployed, so she and her business are the family's sole source of income. She would like to import women's underclothing, so she turned to us for a loan. She will pay back the loan over 12 months. This will help her increase sales volume and widen her range of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Васиева Тахмина проживает в городе Душанбе. Занимается торговлей в центральном торговом центре «Садбарг». Торгует уже почти пять лет женской одеждой. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Муж нигде не работает , поэтому она и ее бизнес является основным источником доходов. Хочет привезти нижнее белье для женщин и поэтому обратилась к нам за кредитом.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.Это поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и пополнить ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Mrs. Thida H. is a farmer in Damnak Smach Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business, she makes and sells desserts. She is 42 and a window with five children, two of whom are clothes sellers while the others are attending school.

She now would like to start a cow breeding business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy calves for breeding in order to improve her standard of living. So far, Mrs. Thida H. has obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy calves for breeding.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 40 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 22. She also takes care of 1 other person, aged 56. She has owned a small food shop since 2000. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Farida now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, salt, and sugar for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en:
Semeni, a clothes seller since 2005, is the married mother of four children between the ages of 12 and 1. She works daily from 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Semeni is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the improvement of her business.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en:
Mrs. Soa Y., age 46, is a widow and the mother of two children, ages 18 and 21. Her 18-year-old son works as a construction worker and make around $3 each day. 

Mrs. Y. buys recyclable items from different locations in her town and resells them to the recycling plant, making about $4/day of net income. 

In order to make her recycling business operate faster and more easily, Soa Y. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorbike to use for business transportation. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy more recyclable items to sell so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use for business transportation

loans.name: Elvy Gloreny

texts.es: El Sr. Elvy Gloreny, vive en la Localidad de San José en Santa Cruz, Bolivia, hace 3 años que vive en el lugar y su actividad es la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante, donde tambien tiene una pequeña radio, trabajando además como locutor en sus tiempos libres. Él cuenta con casa propia vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Su objetivo es agrandar su negocio y agrandar su radio.
texts.en:
Mr. Elvy Gloreny lives in the San José locality in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He has been there for three years, and his activity is the sale of food in a small restaurant where he also has a radio and works as an announcer in his free time. He owns his home, and lives with his wife and school-aged children. His objectives are to grow his business and his radio activities.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 49 años  de edad, vive solo con sus tres hijos que estudian, ya que ella es madre soltera. Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, sus productos los vende en las afueras de su vivienda en unas mesas que implementó para ello, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quien comparte muchas conversaciones. Su bodeguita le es rentable, porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y le va bien. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco e implementarse de más productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is 49-years-old and lives only with her three children, who are in school, because she is a single mother. She has sold groceries and basic goods for four years. She sells her products outside of her home on some tables she implemented for this. She likes her job a lot because she gets to know many people with whom she shares many conversations. Her little store is profitable because it's in a good loacation and it's going well for her. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she is going to have a kiosk constructed so she can sell more products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal San Juan 
Juana es conviviente, tiene 41 años. Ella tiene una casa propia y por la crisis económica que pasaba decidió alquilar la parte de delante de su casa para tienda y dos habitaciones
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles quiere acabar de construir la habitación que va alquilar  y comprar un stock de productos de belleza de Avon   
Su sueño es remodelar las habitaciones para seguir alquilando
texts.en:
Juana is a partner in the Community Bank of San Juan. Juana is 41 years old and lives with her partner. She has her own home and because of the recent economic crisis she decided to rent the front rooms of her home as a store and two bedrooms. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles so that she can finish construction on the room that she'd like to rent. She'll also use the money to buy a stock of Avon beauty products. Her dream is to remodel the rooms to continue renting them.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock beauty products.

loans.name: Julio Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Julio A. cuenta con 36 años de edad, es casado de oficios Albañil, habita junto a su Esposa e hijos,  lleva 4 años de trabajar en la construcción de viviendas en Totonicapán, cuenta con 2 empleados, su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en el Caserío Tzamnimasac II de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de sus servicios ha aumentado, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para poder aumentar sus activos, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar Herramientas y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ingresos y así cubrir sus necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Julio A. is 36 years old, married, works in construction, and lives with his wife and children. He has 4 years of work experience in housing construction in Totonicapan with 2 employees. His house is located in Caserio Tzamnimasac II de la Aldea de Nimasac, Totonicapan district, Guatemala. Currently the demand for his services has increased, but the economic conditions are not sufficient to increase his activities. For this reason, he came to ASDIR association to request a loan with the intention of buying tools and in this way, increase his income and cover his financial necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moradeyo

texts.en: Moradeyo sells rice and palm oil wholesale. She learned this business in working with her sister for 4 years and she has been in the business for the past 7 years. Moradeyo is 32 years old and is married with 4 children. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more food to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Leonel Mejia

texts.es:
El negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica el señor Leonel Mejía es a atender su pulpería el cual posee desde hace varios años en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es importante destacar que el señor Leonel ha logrado salir adelante y por esto ha buscado la manera de cómo mantener su núcleo familiar.

La razón por la cual el señor Leonel ha acudido  a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería ya que los requiere a lo inmediato porque se le agotan y es su necesidad volver a llenar los estantes y así continuar brindando un servicio de alta calidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonel Mejia works extremely hard serving customers at the convenience store he has had for the past few years in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. It is important to mention that Mr. Leonel has managed to do well and for this reason has looked for the best way to take care of his family. He has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan in order to purchase the products that his store has run out of, so that he will be able to fill his shelves and continue to provide high quality service.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for general store

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Miguelina A. N. is a bank coordinator for Union con Esperanza (The Union of Hope). She is 39 years old and single. She has three children; 21, 18 and 16 years old. The 15 women of the bank are now looking for a loan with Esperanza. Miguelina and nine of the other women have never received a loan.

Miguelina used to have a business selling clothes, but decided to go another route because there are a lot of people selling clothes near her. She wants to start a new business selling shoes for men. A friend of hers makes shoes and she wants to sell his shoes in her neighborhood, in Puerto Plata. She also thinks it will be easier to sell shoes to men than clothes to women because men do not take such a long time to make a decision and also pay more (her words).

Miguelina first heard about Esperanza because some of her family members have already received loans. Now she hopes it will be possibly for her to receive a loan so she can start her new business.

Miguelina wants to learn English and hopes that in the future she will be able to study at a school that teaches English. It is important to her that she will be able to help her children. She owns a house in the countrysiD., but lives in a rented house in Puerto Plata. Her dream is that one day she will own her own house in the city.

On behalf of Miguelina, Union Con Esperanza, and Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María Francisca Solís tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña María tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña María es la producción del derivado de maíz. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que dio inicio desde muy joven, por lo que decidió recurrir a este medio de supervivencia para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña María son de estabilizar su negocio ya que las ventas han disminuido. Y así solicita al financiamiento para realizar la compra de la mayor cantidad de producto que vende.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca Solís is 66 years old and single. She has three children who go to school. María makes corn products, and has done so for more than 30 years. She started when she was young, for her family's survival. María wants to stabilize her business because sales have dropped. She requests a loan to purchase more of the product she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza has owned a small food vendor store in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa for three years. She belongs to the Ipogolo E group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximetly $145. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes, carrots, coconuts, and onions to add her current stock. She needs these for the improvement of her business. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Eliza is 26 years old and is married with a one-year-old baby and a seven-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, carrots, coconuts, and onions to add her current stock.

loans.name: Simon Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Simón V. tiene 46 años de edad, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, vive con su compañera de vida que es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos y todos trabajan.Los planes a largo plazo es construir su vivienda.Don Simón su principal actividad económica es la venta de leña y matanza de chancho con 15 años de experiencia en el destace de cerdos. Iniciando su negocio con fondos propios negocio requiere de mayores ingresos para ser reinvertidos ya que se necesita un vehiculo en el cual se pueda expandirse la venta de leña.El préstamo que solicita en Afodenic es para la compra de materia prima como: mayores cantidades de leña, cerdos, iniciar la venta de gas y de otros productos.

loans.use: Comaprar leña, cerdos y gas butano

loans.name: Saylimuhabbatkhon

texts.ru: Сайлимухаббат Сиярова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сайлимухаббатхон вместе с детьми занимается земледелием. Она выращивает картофель и продает на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Saylimuhabbat S. lives in the Rumy region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has eight children. Her husband is in Russia as a laborer. Saylimuhabbatkhon together with children are in agriculture. She grows potatoes and sells on the market. She has been in this business for more than five years. The client is asking for a loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expansion of business

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Orlando Antonio P. M. de 50 años de edad reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Orlando vive con su esposa Doña Florinda de 53 años de edad ella se dedica a su negocio que es un comedor ubicado en la zona. Don Orlando también tiene su propio negocio en el cual se desempeña muy bien tras muchos años de experiencia, se trata de un taller de estructuras metálicas y mecánicas por el cual ahora solicita un crédito ya que necesita compra de materiales para su taller.
texts.en:
Orlando Antonio P. M., 50, lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. He lives with his wife, Florinda, who is 53. She has a business, which is an eatery located in the zone. Orlando has his own business, which he manages very well through his many years of experience. He has a metal working shop. He is now asking for a loan because he needs to buy materials for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is married and is blessed with 3 children. He and his wife run a retail store and bake cakes. He started the business as a grocery shop in 2003 and later expanded into the baking business. He is requesting a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to increase his stock. His dream is to build a business empire in Machakos.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de 02 hijos, ella tiene estudios de educación superior completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar joyas en la Ciudad de Arequipa para luego venderlo en  Ilave y ferias de la zona.

Su sueño es poner una joyería  y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan mucho los encuentros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Bertha is a partner of "Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto" which is located in Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 34 years old and is a single mother of two children. She has completed her studies in higher education. For the past six years, Manuela Ramos has been her Field Partner. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, an amount which helped her acquire goods. Now she is asking for a loan of an additional 3,000 Peruvian soles. The loan will help her buy jewelry in Arequipa that she will sell in Ilave and in several markets in the area. Bertha's dream is to open a jewelry shop and to educate her children. She enjoys meeting people and social gatherings.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jewelry.

loans.name: Stand Strong Group

texts.en:
This is Mahawa K., Zainab K. and Adamsay S.. They named their group Stand Strong. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. This loan will create a tremendous impact into the businesses and personal lives of these entrepreneurs. They will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improving their businesses and standard of living. 

Mahawa K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Mahawa is thirty-two years of age. She was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. Mahawa’s husband works for a non-governmental organization and the two of them have three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School I, the other in class five and the last is in class I. Mahawa sells dishes, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and many other types of locally produce food items. She has been in the business for many years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
H. is a 50-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Pursat Province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparents who died of senility many years ago. 

She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbage, cucumbers, and morning glories, that she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband has grown these crops with her. The couple is married and has five children, three of whom are married and two of whom are single and attend school. 

In the past, H. has hired her neighbor's buffalo to help her on the farm because she did not have her own buffalo. She will use this loan to buy a buffalo that she will use to eliminate the cost of renting.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Margarita Vélez es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal Dinámicas   ubicado en el cantón  Tosagua a una hora de Portoviejo  en la Provincia de Manabí. Gloria es casada,  tiene 66 años pero es una persona muy jovial, argumenta que aun le quedan fuerzas para salir adelante, su esposo era agricultor pero por problemas de salud ya no trabaja  y es ella la que solventa los gastos de su hogar.

Gloria  tiene un pequeño bazar de materiales de costura ya lleva tres años en esta actividad,  en su  casa tiene unas vitrinas donde ofrece a sus clientes desde agujas hasta los más  bellos botones para acabos de sus prendas  y adornos para el hogar.

El préstamo que Gloria está solicitando a la  fundación es para invertir en la compra de  materiales para el bazar como relojes, porta retratos y álbumes para fotos, así como también mas artículos de costura para sus clientes dedicados a la confección de ropa.

El sueño de Gloria es terminar de construir su casa porque aun le falta la cocina y el comedor.
texts.en:
Gloria Margarita Vélez is an active member of the Dinámicas Communal Bank, which is located in Tosagua County an hour from Portoviejo in the Manabí Province. Gloria is 66 and married. She is a very jovial person who says that she still has the strength to get ahead. Her husband is a farmer. Due to health problems, he no longer works. She is the one that pays the household expenses. Gloria has a small bazaar where she sells sewing and dressmaking materials. She has been doing this for three years. In her house she has display cases where she offers her customers things like needles, the most beautiful buttons for finishing clothes, and decorations for the home. The loan that Gloria is asking the foundation for is to buy materials like clocks, picture frames, photo albums, and sewing supplies for her customers who make clothes. Gloria’s dream is to finish building her house because it still needs a kitchen and a dining room.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her bazar like clocks, picture frames, photo albums, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Liliam Del Socorro

texts.es: Lilliam T. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la comarca sabana grande, casada tiene un hijo de siete años, su esposo le ayuda en lo económico, juntos iniciaron su propio negocio que es una marisquería, desde hace cuatro años la establecieron en su casa de habitación, unas de la dificultades que se le ha presentaron es las temporadas de ventas bajas por la situación económica del país. Los planes a corto plazo es aumentar sus ventas  y variar sus productos también poner en practica la venta a otras zonas del país. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lo invertida en la compra de: camarones, mejoras, chuletas, hielo para el mantenimiento y  de un nuevo producto carne molida. Ofreciendo variedad y aumentando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Lilliam T. is 32 years old and lives in the region of Sabana Grande. She is married and has a 7 year old son. Her husband helps with the finances, and together, they started their own seafood shop. Lilliam has been in business for 4 years and manages it from her home. Some of the difficulties she has faced include a season of low sales resulting from the national economic situation. Her short-term plans are to increase her sales, vary her product offering, and open new markets in other parts of the country.

Thanks to her loan from AFODENIC, Lilliam will be able to purchase shrimp, fish, fillets, and ice. She plans to introduce ground beef as a new product in order to offer more variety and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shrimp, fish, fillets, and ice

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah W. is 38 years old.  She is a single business lady who lives in Shanzu, Mombasa, where she operates a general merchandise store. She has been in the business for two years. Veronicah has diversified her source of income and also sells second-hand clothes and potatoes.  In the future Veronicah hopes to expand her business into a major supplies store and to also become a major horticulturalist supplier. 

This will be her Veronicah's first loan from KADET and with the money she will purchase general merchandise for her shop, clothes for resale, and potatoes to sell. Her main customers are the residents of Shanzu.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise shop, clothes for resale and to also purchase potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Fatou Moussa

texts.fr: Fatou Moussa M. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle achète des bananes en gros pour revendre au détail dans le quartier. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Moussa M., age 40, is married and the mother of 8 children. She's been a member of the village bank of Kande Baneto for seven and a half year. With this loan, she will buy bananas wholesale, and retail them in her neighborhood. Her profits will enable her to contribute to her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Parn

texts.en: Parn V., 36, is married and lives in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make about US$3 of profit every day. She has one child and currently she lives with her mother and her sister. Her mother stays at home raising pigs and chickens to earn a living. Parn V. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase clothes to resell at the garment factory. This is a new business that she hopes will provide an extra benefit to raise her standard of living. (Parn V. is pictured with her mother from home)

loans.use: To sell clothes.

loans.name: Talon Kpalohala Group

texts.en:
Bandu M. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Talon kpalohala'. She is married with 7 children aged 1-21 years old, and their educational levels are 3rd to 7th grade.

Bandu is an illiterate due to lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods. She buys goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga.

Bandu has been running this business for 2 years, and is hoping to improve business to a real shop. She sells goods that customers need in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Bandu faces a problem with the long walking distance to sell her goods.

She needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve business. Bandu dreams of sending her children to a better school.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to improve business

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria es una mujer muy alegre de  45 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia a la que  cuida con mucho cariño, y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.El negocio al que Demetria se dedica es la venta de productos andinos, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado Manco Cápac (gran mercado importante de la ciudad), vende papa, quinua, oca, entre otros tubérculos, pasa todo el día en espera para que sus clientes le compren los productos que vende, ella es muy alegre por lo que su puesto siempre esta muy concurrido.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer más amena la venta, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. Para más adelante, desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos andinos y atender mejor a sus clientes.Es el quinto préstamo de Demetria con  MFP y esta dispuesta a separar una parte de las ganancias del día, para pagar el crédito sin problemas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás socias.Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende.
texts.en:
Demetria is a very happy 45 year old woman. She lives in her own house together with her family, and cares for them very affectionately. What she most desires is to give them a better quality of life. Demetria works selling Andean products. Her stall is located in the Manco Cápac market (a large, important market in the city), and she sells potatoes, quinoa, yucca, and other tubers. She spends the whole day waiting for customers to purchase the products she sells. She is very happy that her stand is always very busy. What she most enjoys about her job is that she can converse with her customers and have more pleasing sales interactions. She has worked doing this activity for 23 years and she thinks the hardest part is having to remain all day at her stall to watch over it. In the future, she wants to have a store where she can sell a larger assortment of Andean products and attend to more customers. This is Demetria's fifth loan with MFP, and she is willing to divide a part of each day's earnings to pay for the loan without problems. She is beloved in her community bank, as she brings much happiness to the other members. With the 1,500 requested soles, she will buy more products to increase the quantity of products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock business

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pot N. is a skillful tailor in her city. She is married and lives with her only child in Dangkao, Cambodia. She is able to earn US $3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has had this business since 2006. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning US $5 per day. 

N. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. N. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more metal for her husband to expand his business as a blacksmith. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more metal to expand a blacksmith business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos (Gabriela tiene 12 años y Julio Cesar tiene 10 años). La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos. La socia y su esposo tienen un taller de carpintería donde fabrican muebles como mesas, roperos y sillas. Ya son ocho años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como madera y clavos. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member is 30 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children: Gabriela, who is 12, and Julio Cesar, who is 10. She gets up very early to perform her household chores; for example, to prepare breakfast for her children. She and her husband have a carpentry workshop where they make furniture such as tables, wardrobes and chairs. They have had this business for 8 years and it has gone very well, thanks to all of the effort they put into their work. She needs a loan to buy more materials such as wood and nails. She belongs to the communal bank "Las Hijas de Maria," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and likewise she pledges to make her payments according to the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood and nails

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima S. sells smoked fish (salmon) at Abura.  Fatima has received a junior high education.  She is single and has four children. Fatima has been selling smoked fish for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and the general up keep of the house. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process (smoking the fish) for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business and supply other people.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So S. is a silk cloth trader. She started her occupation at the beginning of 2007. She buys silk in bulk from weavers and sells retail by hawking door-to-door around the community. From this, she is able to make about $3 per day to cover her family's expenses. 

Mrs. So S., age 42, is a single woman. She owns a small wooden house where she lives with her sister who helps support the family by working in the garment industry. So S. will be using her loan to accrue enterprise capital to purchase more silk cloth to sell.

loans.use: To accrue enterprise capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Santa Ines East, Santa Ignacia, Tarlac. She is 42 years old and married with an adult child. To make a living, Erlinda runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, in order to purchase new items and expand her product offering.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the product offering in her general store.

location.town: Sta. Ines East,  Sta. Ignacia, Tarlac

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 25 years old. Alberto is single. To make a living, Alberto owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Alberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberto is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a small fishing boat. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta E. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling household items & cellphone load in their local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will also be used as additional capital. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Nyetaa sont au nombre de quatre, toutes mariées  dans des  familles polygames et ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 7 enfants, elles habitent toutes  le quartier Darsalam, Commune Urbaine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié, de mariage et  de leurs activités commerciales qui n’est autres que l’achat vente d’articles divers : des habits, des draps de lit, des cosmétiques et des  déodorants. 
C’est le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce qui les motiva à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire. 
Madame Salimata G. est un des membres du groupe qui excelle  dans l’achat vente de cosmétiques et d’habits. 
Elle compte utiliser  son prêt pour acheter : deux douzaines de cartons de parfums et déodorants  de variétés et de qualités différentes. 
Elle s’approvisionne généralement à Bamako et quelques fois à Ségou.  Elle revend ses produits à domicile, au grand marché de Ségou  les jours de foire. 
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour, rembourser son prêt, contribuer à l’achat de nourriture et participer aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes, funérailles).
texts.en:
The four members of the Nyetaa group are all married and living in polygamous families. On the average, they are 38 years of age and have seven children. All of them live in the Darsalam district, urban community of Ségou (the 4th administrative district of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, friends or family members, and their commercial activity consists in purchasing and reselling miscellaneous articles: clothing, bed linens, cosmetics and deodorants. It is the need to boost their business capital which has motivated them to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their 7th group loan. Mrs. Salimata G. is one of the group members who excel in selling cosmetics and clothing. She plans to use her loan to purchase two dozen boxes with perfumes and deodorants of various types and quality grades. She usually purchases her stock in Bamako and sometimes in Ségou. She sells her wares at the big market of Ségou on market days. She hopes to achieve a monthly income of 65,000 West African Francs which will be used to repay her loan, and allow her to contribute to the cost of food and social events (weddings, baptisms, funerals).

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics [for resale]

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie E. wants to increase the production of her rice farm and fishing business in partnership with her husband. They want to be able to earn more profit and build up a savings fund for the future education of their two children, ages 13 and 16 years old. They hope their children can go to college until they graduate and have their own stable careers. The rice they harvest is sold wholesale to a rice retailer at the market, while Vergie sells the fish her husband catches from the ocean to people around their village and in the marketplace of their town.

In spite of being poor, Vergie is hopeful that her life's aspirations for her family and business will be achieved. She is happy that through ASHI she has had the opportunity to obtain a loan which will financially support the needs of her business to grow and become sustainable one day.

loans.use: For farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and rental of equipment; and for fishing gear and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray owns a business that resells or leases GPS (Global Positioning System) units. He also provides GPS and security camera system installations for other organizations and companies. The 53-year-old computer and electronic services consultant advises clients on what equipment best suits their needs. 

Ray has been in the business for 10 years and has received 3 previous loans from ACCION USA. In order to further expand his business, Ray has requested another loan. This loan would allow him hire a temporary worker, add a store-like function to his website, and add money for working capital. Ray is expecting to close a deal soon which would require an extra worker and additional supplies to fulfill the order. 

Ray plans to continue expanding his business by partnering with larger companies and expanding his market base. With purchasing options on his website, he expects to gain more customers and boost sales. As his company grows, he will hire more workers and empower the hard-working men and women in his community.

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. 

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Hiring a staff member and improvement to his website

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama C. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcaol to sell.  Siama is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia A. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Hermenia is single and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Hermenia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Hermenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hermenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermenia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Hermenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 
e borrower's
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo R. es un hombre muy emprendedor, que quiere el bienestar de su familia, el señor Arturo es albañil y el mismo con ahorros le ah hecho muchas mejoras a su vivienda. Tiene una familia muy unida. El requiere de este credito para la instalacion de el drenaje en su localidad, ya que no cuentan con este servicio tan necesario para su familia, El señor Arturo siempre esta al pendiente del bienestar de su familia. y el les agradece su apoyo.
texts.en:
Arturo is a very entrepreneurial man who wishes for his family’s well-being. Arturo is a mason. He himself has made many improvements to his home with savings. He has a very close family. He needs this loan to install drainage in his area since his family does not have this much needed service. Arturo is always on the lookout for his family’s well-being and he thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drainage Installation

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio reside en cantón corralito Corinto departamento de Morazán, es casado vive con su esposa Ana María y cinco hijos los mayores de los hijos estudian,
cuenta que desde que era pequeño su papa le enseño a trabajar en el campo en la producción de granos básicos como maíz, frijol, maicillo entre otros cuenta Rogelio que es un trabajo muy pesado por que se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana y sale a las cuatro de la tarde.
el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla y fertilizantes ya que sin ellos el maíz no crese y no sería una buena producción.
esto le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y su esposa ya que la situación económica esta muy difícil.
sus aspiraciones es tener una buena producción y de esta forma poder darle asu familia un mejor futuro con buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio lives in the Corralito, Corinto canton, Morazán department. He is married and lives with his wife Ana María and five children. The older children are in school. He told us that when he was a boy his father taught him how to work the land to produce basic grains such as corn, beans, millet and others. He said the work is difficult because he must rise at four in the morning and work until four in the afternoon. He will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer and seed. Without the addition of nutrients to the soil, the corn does not grow and the harvest would be small. A good harvest will improve the living conditions of his children and his wife; the economic situation is now very difficult. His wish is to have a good harvest and thereby give his family a better future with a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 32 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-aged children. She is involved in farming and has been helping her husband plant and harvest rice crops for more than a few years. She helps in keeping the farm productive. Her husband also drives their tricycle to earn extra income. Emma said they were able to buy the tricycle out of their income from the farm.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan B. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Alegria De Amaranto Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Alegría de amaranto, está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  9 integrantes.
María Delfina Domínguez H. es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta el 6 año de primaria,  es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de servilletas bordadas que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para compara mas material para poder hacer mas servilletas e invertir en tela, listón e hilos. Sus clientes son personas de la misma localidad, al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta, y con mucho entusiasmo. También espera poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa pues aun les falta mucho para su casa.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
* LIVIA G. P. VENTA DE TORTILLAS
* AGUSTINA G. G. VENTA DE TORTILLAS
* IMELDA G. V. VENTA DE ROPA
* LUCIA M. P. VENTA DE DULCES
* GRISELDA P. G. VENTA DE MOLCAJETES
* CAROLINA R. M. VENTA DE SABANAS
* PATRICIA S. M. MISELANIA
* AGUSTINA T. R. VENTA DE TORTILLAS
texts.en:
This group is called "Alegría de amaranto" (Amaranth joy), and is located in Mexico.  The group is made up of nine members.  María Delfina Domínguez H. is the president of the group.  She is 25 years old, and studied until the 6th year of primary school.  She is a shopkeeper and has two young boys.  She sells embroidered napkins, which she began two years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more material in order to be able to make more napkins and invest in fabric, ribbon, and thread.  Her customers are from the same town.  At the moment of requesting the loan, she feels happy, and has a lot of enthusiasm.  Also, she hopes to be able to help her husband with the household expenses, because they are still lacking a lot for their home.

The other members of the group are:
* LIVIA G. P. Sells tortillas
* AGUSTINA G. G. Sells tortillas
* IMELDA G. V. Sells clothes
* LUCIA M. P. Sells sweets
* GRISELDA P. G. Sells mortars (stone bowls used to make salsas)
* CAROLINA R. M. Sells sheets
* PATRICIA S. M. Small general store
* AGUSTINA T. R. Sells tortillas

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha A. runs a grocery store selling household items such as canned goods, etc., in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Mitimos, Rizal. Editha has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Editha is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock to sell. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family. 

She operates a retail shop selling maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and rice. Her potential customers are the villagers and passersby. Kwekwe faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and coconuts for resale. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and a married man. He lives with five members of his family.

He has been a barber since 2009 and his shop is rented. He is well known in his community and has a good reputation.

He is applying for a US$ 1200 loan to extend his shop and make it spacious. He aims that this loan will help him to grow his business.

loans.use: extending his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Kandahar Cluster Group 2-Lugazi

texts.en:
32-year-old high-spirited E. Moses makes common cause with Kandahar cluster group-Lugazi. This jolly and good-humored gentleman has for the last 7 years been plying a mobile phone accessories business in Lugazi Town.  It is a business venture he says he started with the persuasion of a close friend.  Prior to that, Moses was doing mostly odd jobs, working as a handy man technician in and around Lugazi Town. 

Moses is happily married with 2 kids and he says this business generates for him 100,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more phone accessories to resell.  He feels with this loan his business prospects will only get rosier, especially for the future.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories to resell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Mery de 46 años y de sus 3 hijas menores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Este emprendedor hombre se desempeña como obrero de construcción civil y desde muy joven aprendió todas las técnica necesarias que le permitieron continuar con su labor sin problemas. Luego de algunos años la experiencia le ha permitido llegar a ser maestro de construcción, y en la actualidad labora, con un amigo, en  grandes obras, cuyos ingenieros los contratan por temporadas. Le gusta mucho terminar las obras y ver el gran esfuerzo plasmado en una sólida construcción, lo que no le gusta es que su vivienda esta algo alejada de la ciudad, por lo que debe salir todos los días desde la madrugada para llegar a tiempo. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, y para lograrlo desea terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible que continúe con sus proyectos. Juan tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillos, entre otros) pues tiene pensado construir 3 muros de material noble para empezar a refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan, who is 45 years old, lives in his own house with his 46 year old wife Mery and their 3 young daughters. Together they strive every day to get ahead in search of a better life. This enterprising man is a civil construction worker, and from a young age learned all the necessary skills to continue this work without problems. After a number of years, this experience has made him a master of construction. Today he works with a friend on large projects, whose engineers hire them temporarily. He really enjoys finishing a project and seeing all his efforts embodied in a strong building. What he doesn't enjoy is that his home is somewhat removed from the city, so that he has to leave at dawn every day in order to arrive on time. Since he is a rather enterprising man, he plans in the future to start a grocery store in his house, and to do this he wants to finish building his house with high quality materials. This is his second loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time. He is very grateful to the people who made it possible for him to continue with his projects. Juan plans to invest the amount asked for in purchasing construction materials (including cement, sand, and bricks) as he intends to build 3 walls from quality materials as a start on refurbishing his home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building his home.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song H., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. She is a housewife, while her husband is a carpenter earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Two of her children are employed at a factory and earn an income of USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and 15 on the children’s education.

Song is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cows to raise for their offspring. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to purchase more cows to expand her business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

Song appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise for their offspring

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique, de 42 años, convive con Karina de 37 años. Ambos tienen gemelos Pedro y Araceli de 5 años de edad. La principal actividad de Enrique, es el servicio de transporte en moto, es esta actividad se dedica  todos los días, desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, solo así puede captar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Pero,  a veces en pleno trabajo su moto sufre de averías, y él mismo las repara, ya que aprendió viendo como reparaban los  mecánicos. Desde entonces; solo gasta en compra de repuestos y  más no en el mantenimiento. Se siente muy contento y orgulloso del dominio que tiene, ya que su trabajo le gusta mucho, por ello brinda un buen servicio en el transporte a sus vecinos y demás transeúntes de la calle, además es muy  honesto en el cobro de los pasajes. Su mayor anhelo es sembrar café en su tierra de origen y exportarlas finalmente. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. De obtener el crédito solicitado, las invertirá en la compra de repuesto para su moto carro, y de se modo continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Enrique, age 42, lives with Karina who is 37 years old. They have five year old twins named Pedro and Araceli. Enrique’s main job is providing transportation services with his motorcycle taxi, an activity he engages in every day from the early morning until the late evening hours. He works alone so that he can earn as much income to benefit his family. Occasionally while working his motorcycle will break down, so he must make the repairs himself. He learned how to do this by watching mechanics perform their work. From that point, he acquires parts so that he does not have to pay for maintenance. Enrique is very happy and proud of everything he has. He enjoys his work, so he provides good transportation services to his neighbors and street pedestrians. Enrique is very honest with the fares he charges his passengers. His greatest wish is to grow coffee in his hometown so that he can export it.

This is his second loan with MFP. Enrique promises to be responsible with his payments because he does not want to look bad to those responsible who made this loan possible so that he could continue working. With the loan he requested, Enrique will invest in the purchase of spare parts for his motorcycle taxi so that he can continue working.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 9 hijos D. los cuales 4 son menores. Vive en la zona D. las Lomas D. Carabayllo km2, distrito D. Carabayllo. Forma parte del grupo “Los Emprendedores D. las Lomas, formado por 10 integrantes. 
Julia hace veinticinco años trabaja reciclando chatarra con su esposo, desD. pequeña tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres. Ella y su esposo pusieron un pequeño negocio en su casa.
Gracias al buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos se compro un terreno, ha logrado tener estabilidad económica y cubre los gastos familiares. 
El sueño D. Julia es tener su propio depósito mucho más amplio para su negocio. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en el capital para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en: Julia is 56 years old, married and has 9 children, 4 of whom are minors.  She lives in the Las Lomas D. Carabayllo km2 region in the district of Carabayllo.  She is one of ten members of the group "Los Emprendedores D. Las Lomas" [The Entrepreneurs of Las Lomas].  Along with her husband she has been recycling scrap for a living for 20 years.  She has had to work since she was very young to help her parents.  She and her husband started a small business in their home.  Because of being financially responsible with their income they were able to buy a piece of land, achieve economic stability and cover their family's expenses.  Julia's dream is to have her own large storage area for her business.  She will use the loan as capital to increase her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcos Augusto

texts.es: El señor Marcos Augusto tiene 28 años,  este señor tiene 5 hijos que todavía estudian. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. El dio inicio hace 4 años, y poco a poco ha logro comprar su propio tricitaxi, para ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Sus sueños son de mantener activo su negocio y de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta es una de las prioridades que él tiene debido a que sus hijos están creciendo y necesita ofrecerle un espacio que sea propiedad de ellos. Ahora solicita la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle reparación mantenimiento a su medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Marcos Augusto, 28, has five children still in school.  His economic activity is providing mototaxi services.  He started four years ago and gradually managed to purchase his own mototaxi to provide his customers with good service.  His dream is to keep his business active and provide some home improvements which is one of his priorities because his children are growing and he needs to provide proper space for them.

He is asking help from Fundación León.  The loan will be for working capital to provide maintenance and repair to his means of transport.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly was born in 1980 and has four children -- two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, and the others are still too young to work or study. 
 
Mrs. Ly and her husband, Mr. Set, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and vegetables to sell to support their family.  Mr. Set also collects palm juice to sell to earn additional income.  

Mrs. Ly wants to breed a cow, but her savings are not enough to buy one.   To achieve this purpose, she is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Gadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe C. Pérez (le dicen lupita de cariño), vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México,    lupita es madre soltera  en donde tuvo cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados y la poyan con un poco de su ingresos.

     Comenta que es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y es para apoyarse en la compra  de ingredientes  para la elaboración de panes, en donde  lleva  quince  años y le va bien, con el crédito que solicito piensa comprar cosas que le hacen falta  y así mejorara su trabajo.

     Al iniciar esta actividad la animaron sus hijos mayores ya que la insistieron de que ella hace unos panes ricos y  se vende bien,   aun así su hermana  también  la apoyo para iniciarlo y gracias a Dios  con este apoyo brindado  ha estado trabajo y la va bien.

    De su venta y de las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad para así, elaborar su trabajo más días ala semana  y su clientela este mas satisfecha  al consumir el producto.

     Su más grande deseo es que dios le siga prestando vida para poder trabajar y comprarse algunas cosas que la hacen falta.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe C. Pérez (lovingly called Lupita) lives in Coapilla State of Chiapas Mexico, is a single mother and has five married children who support her a little financially.

She comments that this is the first time she is requesting a loan and it will be used to buy ingredients to make bread which she has been doing successfully for five years. She plans on buying things she still needs to improve her work.

Her eldest children convinced her to start this business since they told her that she makes very delicious bread and they would sell well. Her sister even helped her and thanks to God this support system has worked and she is doing very well.

The money she will make from this job will be reinvested in her business so she can work more days out of the week and her customers can be more satisfied.

Her biggest wish is that God continue giving her life to continue working and buy things she still needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread such as flour, eggs, oil, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela tiene 73 años y es viuda con 5 hijos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II.
Solicita un crédito D. S/. 1 500.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. carne, aderezos, maíz, lechuga  y leña.
Carmela tiene un horno en su casa, donD. prepara asado D. chancho al horno y luego lo venD. en 5 Esquinas que es una D. las calles principales D. Ayacucho. Es una actividad que lo realiza todos los días con su hijo y nuera. Ingreso a FINCA Perú por la invitación D. su sobrina, le gusta por la facilidad D. los créditos y pueD. ahorrar. Con los ahorros que tenia pudo hacer el mantenimiento a su casa. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Carmela is 73 years old, widowed, and has 5 children.  She is a member of the Unión II community bank.  She is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

Carmela will invest her loan in buying meat, seasonings, corn, lettuce and firewood.

Carmela has an oven in her home where she makes roast pork which she then sells in 5 Esquinas which is one of the main streets in Ayacucho.  She carries out her business every day with the help of her son and her daughter-in-law.  Carmela joined FINCA Perú through an invitation from her cousin.  She likes it because of the ease of the loans and the fact that she is able to save.  She has been able to use her savings to do some work on her home.  Her dream is for her business to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, corn and firewood for making roast pork

loans.name: Antonieta Maricela

texts.es:
Doña Antonieta Maricela Z. T., es casada, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de fajas típicas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en este negocio, lleva 8 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició siendo operaria.

Acude a las oficinas de ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para inversion en una compra de terreno que va a efectuar, compra que haran junto con su esposo. Dese seguir trabajando para mejorar su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonieta Maricela Z. T. is married and is 24 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study and she works sewing typical Guatemalan belts. Her husband supports her in this business. She has 8 years of experience and started as an operator. 

She came to the ASDIR offices requesting a loan to help her and her husband invest in the purchase of land. She wants to continue working to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio es padre de un  niño y vive junto con el y su esposa en una casa propia de material rústico. Toribio tiene 26 años de edad. Su hogar está ubicado en el caserío Chacupe Bajo, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria- Chiclayo. No cuenta con servicio de  luz y el agua que consumen es de pozo tubular. 

Las actividades principales que Toribio realiza son la agricultura, la crianza de animales de engorde  y venta de los mismos  y actividades artesanales. Toribio tiene varios años de experiencia prestando servicio de obrero a diversos agricultores del mismo caserío. Además alquila terreno agrícola  para sembrar camote y verduras, por campaña. 

Toribio solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles cuyo destino será para compra de vigas, calaminas y adobe para mejorar su vivienda la cual es de material rústico. Este será el primer paso que Toribio dará para comenzar a tener un mejor estilo de vida, sobre todo porque su niño y esposa lo necesitan.
