Toribio solicita  su segundo crédito, el primero lo canceló con puntualidad y fue para compra de abono, fertilizantes  para siembra de camote y por ello ahora se le propone la modalidad de Capital Semilla en nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Toribio is the father of a son and lives with him and his wife in their own house made from flimsy materials.  He is 26 years old.  His home is located in the hamlet of Chacupe Bajo which is a small, rural settlement belonging to La Victoria-Chiclayo District.  It does not have electricity and the water they consume is from a well.

Toribio’s main activity is farming and raising livestock; he also makes crafts.  Toribio has several years experience working as a laborer for several farmers in the settlement.  He also leases farmland to grow sweet potatoes and vegetables by the season.

Toribio is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 700 new sol loan to buy beams, plywood and adobe to improve his home which is made of flimsy materials. This will be Toribio’s first step toward having a better lifestyle especially because his son and wife need it.

Toribio is asking for his second loan; he repaid the first one on time and used it to buy manure and fertilizer for the sweet potato crops so now he’s being proposed for our entity’s Seed Capital modality.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: We Go Try Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “We Go Try” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,400,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Hawanatu is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old woman is single and has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Hawanatu has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She sells food such as rice, pepper, onions, oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, onions, oil, etc., at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro Antonio es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es padre de dos niños, se desempeña como obrero en una Institución del Estado donde tiene muchos años de laborar.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su vivienda y darles una mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Antonio is originally from the town of El Sauce. He is the father of two children. Pedro is an employee of a state institution and has worked there for many years.

He has his own home, but one of his existing needs is to acquire a loan so that he can purchase an appliance. This will help improve the living conditions at home and provide a better standard of living for his children. For this reason, he has decided to request his third loan from CEPRODEL so that he can fulfill this need.

loans.use: to purchase an appliance for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different types and sizes of plastic slippers.

loans.name: Zaro

texts.ru: Заро проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии проработала 4 года. На сегодняшний день она занимается изготовлением и торговлей. Она печет торты и пирожное для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сухофруктов и сахара.
texts.en: Zaro lives in Kulob. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She has a higher education in pedagogy. She worked in her profession for four years.  Now she works in manufacturing and trade. She bakes pies and cakes for sale. She has been doing this for six years. She is taking out a loan to buy dried fruit and sugar.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesús

texts.es:
Rescatar la cultura indígena de Colombia a través de la elaboración de artesanías y de camisas es el negocio al que se dedica Ramiro, quien es estudiante de Economía en la Universidad de Antioquia y quien gracias a las ganancias obtenidas logra transportarse hasta la universidad, sacar fotocopias, comprar libros, entre otros gastos que le generan sus estudios. 

A sus 24 años de edad, este joven emprendedor espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su madre, para ello además de seguir adelante con su negocio, aspira terminar sus estudios hasta convertirse en profesional. 

Actualmente Ramiro necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de las artesanías y las camisas pues sus ganancias no son suficientes para comprar mayores insumos y abastecer así los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
To rescue Colombia’s indigenous culture through crafts and shirt making is Ramiro’s business.  He’s a student majoring in Economics at the University of Antioquia and profits earned make it possible for him to transport himself to the university, to make copies and buy textbooks, among other expenses his studies create.

At the age of 24, this young entrepreneur hopes to improve his quality of life and that of his mother.  For that he hopes not only to continue with his business but to finish his studies to become a professional.

Currently Ramiro needs a loan to buy raw materials to make the crafts and shirts because his profits are insufficient to buy larger amounts of raw materials and fill his customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of raw materials to make shirts and crafts.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a 42-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past ten years, Cleophas has been dealing in a number of business activities including selling cloth and poultry farming. He got his initial capital to set up his current business from farming. Cleophas’s major business challenges are bad debtors and diseases that affect poultry. 

Cleophas is requesting a loan to buy chickens for his poultry farm. His vision is to rear at least 2,000 birds and educate his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Jocelyn Llanos Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in Clarin. She is married with six children. She has a dress shop where she sells different styles of fashionable dresses. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her dress shop.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.  

Jocelyn is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her dress shop.

loans.name: Yhony

texts.es: Yhony, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 25 años, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Crispín de 22 años y su querido hijo Dyron de 02 años, a quien desea brindarle un buen provenir. Yhony mujer de ardua labor, lucha por sobresalir adelante con su puesto de ventas donde ofrece al público variedad de productos entre  menestras, cereales y entre otros, ella abre las puertas de su bodega desde tempranas horas y esta lista en espera de sus primeros parroquianos quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que ofrece terminan comprándole de dos a mas productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con los niños, quiene son sus pequeños consumidores y siempre acuden a la tienda por los mandatos de sus madres. Yhony menciona que adquirió el capital gracias al apoyo de los financistas quienes depositaron su confianza en ella y hoy su negocio le es muy rentable. Con el tiempo, anhela  crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y en esta oportunidad espera seguir beneficiándose con el crédito  para seguir prosperando y por lo cual ella esta decidida a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo puntualmente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles comprará, variedad de conservas, azúcar, leche, arroz y otros productos.
texts.en:
Yhony is from the city of Quimbiri.  She’s 25 years old.  She’s a charismatic, hardworking woman living in a rented house with her husband, Crispín, 22, and her beloved son, Dyron, 2, that she wants to provide a good future for.

Yhony, a woman who works hard, strives to get ahead with her stand where she sells a variety of products, like vegetables and cereals, among others, to the general public.  She opens her store’s doors very early and awaits her first customers of the day who, aware of the variety of goods she stocks, end up buying two or more items from her.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with the children who are her little consumers and always come to her store on some errand for their mothers.

Yhony mentions that she got the capital thanks to support from lenders who trusted her and today her business is quite profitable.  In time, she hopes to make her business grow and offer her customers still better service.  This will be her second MFP loan and she hopes to continue to benefit herself through the loan to continue making progress.  She is, therefore, determined to repay her loan punctually.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy a variety of canned goods, sugar, milk, rice and other products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa  de 22 años de edad que vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años en a ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde tiene como sus ingresos principales una peluquería y también vende productos de belleza, bisutería, kid de aseo etc.. Su principal negocio es mejorar la imagen personal y/o profesional de su clientela, conformada por hombres, mujeres, niños y niñas, a través de peinados, maquillajes, tratamientos capilares etc. 
Narcisa cuenta que inició su negocio con un espejo y pocos implementos de trabajo, pero su espíritu de superación la llevaron  a capacitarse en peluquería y como manicurista y en limpieza facial, para finalmente decidir emprender su aventura de negocios y hacerlo crecer, iniciando en casa de su hermana, de quien ha recibido un gran apoyo y sin necesidad de crédito. Hoy no solo corta cabello, embellece el rostro con maquillaje, y ofrece servicios de belleza, sino que también asesora y vende  productos con los que trabaja en la peluquería y mercancías variadas, que su concentrada clientela le encarga. Sus compras las realizan a crédito y de contado, pero necesita dinero para tener mas libertad sobre los productos que aplica, e incluir nuevos proveedores en su registro, para modernizar sus técnicas de atención. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará de contado y en mayor volumen, productos de belleza y kid de aseo y bisutería, lo cual le proporcionará descuentos en su compra, que trasladará al aumento de sus servicios y por consiguiente a sus rentables clientes.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 22, lives with her two children who are 2 and 7 years old in the city of Cartagena de Indias where her main source of income is a barber shop but she also sells beauty products, costume jewelry, cleaning kits, etc.  Her main business is improving the personal and/or professional image of her clientele, composed of men, women, boys and girls, through haircuts, make-up, hair treatments, etc.

Narcisa relates that she started her business with just a mirror and a few work tools but her get ahead spirit led her to take hair cutting, manicure and facial cleansing courses in order to finally set off on a business adventure and make it grow.  She started out in her sister’s house who has been of great support and not asking for any thanks.  Today, she not only cuts hair, uses make-up to beautify faces and offers other beauty services but she’s also a beauty consultant and sells the products she works with in her barber shop as well as assorted other merchandise her clientele orders from her.

Her sales are for cash and on credit but she needs money to have more freedom over the products she carries and to add new suppliers to her roster to modernize her service techniques.  This is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to be able to buy and pay cash for large amounts of beauty supplies, cleansing kits and costume jewelry, which will make her eligible for discounts on her purchases that will in turn translate to increased services and thus more profitable customers.

loans.use: to buy and pay cash for larger volumes of beauty supplies, facial cleansing kits and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
This is Annaliza, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy, a construction laborer, and mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annaliza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annaliza hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chanika One Group

texts.en:
Florence, who is in her mid 20s is single.  She has been running a charcoal business for one year now. She works from 6 a.m  to  9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania,  which she wants to use for purchasing more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Chanika One" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rasheeda Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda bibi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. She has been involved in this business for past eight years. In these years, she has earned a good reputation among her clients for her good behavior and quality products.  

With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk to sell in her store. 

Rasheeda has a son who is a daily wage labor. Her husband is a mason and constructs buildings.  

She is hopeful that after the loan investment her business will improve further and as a result her family will be able to live a better standard of life.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasheeda bibi.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Juan desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas, cerdos y aves), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Juan es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar a su familia adelante y brindarle otras oportunidades en la vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 46 years old, lives with his wife and children in their own house. The house, which does not have basic services (utilities), is located in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura department.  In this zone people work in agriculture, livestock-raising, and handicrafts.

For several years Juan has raised and sold barnyard animals (sheep, pigs, and poultry). His pens are located behind his house, and they are suitable and big enough. He feeds the animals with balanced feed and natural grains so that they have an ideal growth and he can offer them for sale at the different markets in the zone and thus obtain good earnings to pay his family obligations.

He has applied to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN for the purchase of balanced feed to produce healthy animals. With the earnings that he will obtain from the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as have a better quality of life. Juan is a person who with effort and much determination has known how to raise his family and offer his children other opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and raise healthy animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman with seven children one of whom attends school while the others are grown up. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly challenge is food for her family and school fees for her child.

Winnie has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years; in addition, she runs a business selling cosmetics. Her potential clients are women from the local area. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. She aspires to expand her business.

With the Kshs 65,000 loan, she wants to purchase sixteen sacks of charcoal and cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sixteen sacks of charcoal and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Aida De Jesús

texts.es: Aida de Jesús de 54 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su hija la cual ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Aida se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, responsable y carismática. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado establecer un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la zona donde habita en el cual vende medicina.  El negocio está muy bien ubicado ya que es un lugar muy concurrido y visitado por muchas personas. Aida ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a su familia y gracias a Dios su hija ya se encuentra trabajando y colabora un poco con los gastos del hogar.  Para Aida su negocio es parte de su vida no se imagina estar sin el. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de mantener surtido su negocio de tal manera que pueda mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo.  El crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra diferentes medicamentos (vitaminas, pastillas para dolores, medicamentos naturales, medicamentos para parásitos, etc.)  de tal manera que los clientes se sientan satisfechos con el servicio que ella ofrece. De esta forma  espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Aida de Jesús, age 54, lives in her own home with her grown daughter, who helps out with the household costs. Aida is a very hard worker. She is responsible and charismatic. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has been able to establish a small stall in a local market where she sells medicine. Her business is in a very good location, as it is a high-traffic area. Aida has worked for a long time to get her family ahead, and thanks to God her daughter has found a job and can help out a little with the household costs. For Aida, her business is part of her life and she couldn't imagine not having it. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL with the goal of keeping her store stocked so that she can keep it going for a long time. She wants to invest this loan in different medications (vitamins, pain pills, natural medicines, anti-parasitic medicines, etc) so that her customers will be satisfied with her service. She hopes to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy: vitamines, pain pills, natural medicines, anti-parasitic medicines, etc.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y de tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus hijas de 12 y 10 años de edad, tiene 8 meses en el negocio, hasta el momento todo le ha salido bien, espera adquirir más experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, estos materiales le servirán tanto para hacer las tortillas como también para hacer las pupusas, mejorando así su disponibilidad de productos para la preparación de la venta.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, poco a poco y con la ayuda de préstamos.
texts.en:
Yaneth sells pupusas and tortillas for a living.  She lives with her husband and her 10- and 12-year-old daughters.  She has had her business for eight months and so far everything has gone well for her.  She hopes to acquire more experience.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood, oil, and condiments.  These materials will help her make both her tortillas and her pupusas, thereby improving the availability of products she has to prepare and sell.

Her aspiration is to grow her business little by little with the help of loans.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Magdalena has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Magdalena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Magdalena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Twiyunge I Group

texts.fr:
Donatien est une commerçante âgée de 36ans qui habite à Gitega. Il vend des tomates depuis 8ans. Il a commencé cette activité alors qu’elle faisait l’agriculture. Il a un niveau d’études primaire. Il est marié à Geneviève et ont ensemble 4 enfants dont 2 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une  grande quantité de tomates à revendre.

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire«Twiyunge».
texts.en:
Donatien is a 36-year-old retailer who lives in Gitega. He has sold tomatoes for eight years. He began this activity while he was a farmer. He has a primary school education. He is married to Geneviève, and the two have four children together, two of whom are in school.
The Kiva loan he obtains will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy a large quantity of tomatoes for resale.

He is a member of the community group "Twiyunge".

loans.use: To augment his capital in order to buy a large quantity of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years of age, married to Tom, and they have five children. She has been operating a used clothes retail business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6500.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd for Kes 20000. She plans to use the funds to buy more stock of used clothes for sale. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children.

Her hopes are to grow her business and to buy a plot to build a family home.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Lusot, Baliangao in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 55 years old, married and has six children. She plants, harvests, and sells rice for a living, earning 3,500 PHP from her farming.

In 2010 Aida became a member of GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Aida hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Leana

texts.en: I need the credit to purchase 2 new freezers to cool beers and other softdrinks that I sell. I also need to repair and maintain the building as presentation is very important in a business like mine. If the clients do not like the bar, they will go to another bar.

loans.use: Purchase 2 freezers to cool beer and sodas.

loans.name: Dilruba

texts.en: Dilruba is an IDP from occupied Lachin region. She settled in Beylagan region with her family in 1992. As traditionally they were engaged in cattle breeding she started this business in Beylagan. Her first loan from Normicro Beylagan branch was in the amount of $500. They buy cattle, breed them and sell to butchers. Now she needs $1100 to buy cattle and expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin S. is 58 years old and is a construction worker in Phnom Penh. His wife is 53 and they have 2 children together that go to school daily. Sin S. has grown his business so that he has several employees. He needs to pay these employees regularly, but he does not get the money from his project until it is completed.

He will use this loan to cover his employees' wages until the project is complete. In the future, he hopes to continue growing his business so that he is more of a manager rather than a worker. He also wants to help his wife open a grocery store at the local market.

loans.use: To pay the advanced wages of his employees

loans.name: Tezgul

texts.en: K. Tezgul is 46 years old, is married and has 5 children. She is a teacher in a local school and owns one milk cow. The cow is main source of income for her family. Her large family lives under difficult economic conditions, so she has decided to apply for a 1200 USD loan in order to purchase one more milk cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit selling business.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo León. She is a very hard-working and enthusiastic married mother of three. Her family was the motivation in deciding to start her own business five years ago; since her husband's salary was so low they couldn't cover household expenses or their children's education. First, she started helping one of her girl friends in a beauty salon, and a year later, with the experience she gained, she opened her own shop.

Fortunately, the high-quality service she offers has helped her increase her clientele, but the size of her salon is too small to accommodate them all. So she is requesting a loan of $750, which she will use to remodel her shop and purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Tomasa and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León vive Tomasa, ella es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, está casada y tiene tres hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual decidió emprender su negocio hace 5 años, ya que con el bajo salario que recibe su esposo era imposible cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus pequeños, primero comenzó ayudándole a una de sus amigas en su estética y un año después, con la experiencia que había adquirido en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, abrió su propio salón de belleza.

Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido incrementar su número de clientes, pero el espacio que tiene es insuficiente por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local y en la compra de insumos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Tomasa y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and supplies; remodel

loans.name: Tojigul

texts.ru:
Tojigul Z. is 44 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 5 children. She is a housewife and also raises livestock. She has been doing this for 20 years. Tojigul plans to use the loan to purchase 2 pieces of livestock which she plans to resell every 40-45 days, using her revenues to purchase new livestock.

At the end of the loan period, after repaying the loan, Tojigul plans to earn 2 pieces of livestock as profit which she will use to get milk for personal use and profit. She plans to repay the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зиёева Таджигул, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Максуда домохозяйка и помимо домашнего хозяйства занимается разведением домашнего скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 20 лет. На полученный кредит Таджигул планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, которого после откоормки каждые 40-45 дней будет продавать и на вырученные деньги приобретать молодняк. В конце кредитного срока, после погашения всей суммы кредита, Таджигул планирует получить в качестве прибыли 2 головы собственного домашнего скота, который в дальнейшем будет использовать для получения молока для личных нужд и для продажи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of 2 pieces of livestock

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: I am Yasmeen Z.. I am married and a mother of two: one son and one daughter. I live with my family in my hometown Lahore, Pakistan. My daughter has completed her college and currently she is teaching at a local school whereas my son is in grade ten. My husband has a heart problem and therefore cannot work and I stitch bed sheets to earn a living. I need a loan of $175 to expand my business.

loans.use: Need loan to expand bed sheets business and buy cloth

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Mrs. Olivia Teresa O., who is 49 years of age, has been selling food for a long time, since she gives board to the sawmill employees who work near her home. In order to improve her family’s standard of living, she counts on the collaboration and support of her dear husband, Richard, who works independently. Both of them have the goal of building a motorized boat so as to transport papaya throughout different cities in their country. She wants to develop her fast food business in order to expedite her goals, but she needs capital. With your generous support, Mrs. O. will swiftly achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Olivia Teresa de 49 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, puesto que da pensión a los trabajadores de los distintos aserraderos que se han instalado en su ciudad natal y muy cerca de su domicilio.Para incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia cuenta con la colaboración y ayuda de su querido esposo, Richard, quien es trabajador independiente, ambos tienen el propósito de construir un bote a motor para transportar papaya y exportarlas a las diferentes ciudades de su país. Ella quiere implementar su negocio de venta de comidas para cumplir a corto plazo con este propósito, para este fin requiere de un capital de trabajo. Con tu gentil apoyo doña Olivia Teresa podrá hacer realidad en corto tiempo su objetivo.

loans.use: Increase capital for fast food business

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sokhoeun is a widow with four children -- one son and three daughters. Two of her daughters work in a garment factory and the other two children study at the local school.

Sokhoeun grows rice and sells desserts in her village. She and her children live in an old house along national road number five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $400. She will use this money to add to her own money for repairing her house.

loans.use: For repairing her house

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is divorced and has one child. She lives in the town of Ordzhonikidze, where she sells wedding accessories in the central city market. Her small business is well known for having a good assortment of merchandise at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 12 years. Every month she grosses about $3,000, $500 of which is her profit.

Yevgeniya is a skilled and hard-working manager. She is also an organized and an motivated saleswoman, with an excellent reputation among other businesspeople. She has come to us for a loan of $500 to buy more inventory. With the increased income made possible by the loan, Yevgeniya plans to continue expanding her business so she can generate a stable, good income from her current location.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory to sell to customers.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Born around 1967 in ZANGNANADO in ZOU county in central Benin, Ms. Marie D. is married and a mother with one child to take care of. She is a distributor, wholesale as well as retail, of pagnes (colorful printed fabrics) of wide-ranging quality. An energetic individual, she has very good advantages in terms of selling power. Also, she enjoys a fair amount of fame among those close to her. Currently, she is experiencing some trouble because the demand is very strong, and the necessary goods to meet it are lacking, due to financial means. And so she is applying for this loan to resupply her inventory in order to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers les années 1967 à ZANGNANADO dans le département du ZOU au centre du BENIN, dame D. Marie est mariée et mère d’un enfant à charge. Elle est une distributrice en gros comme en détail de pagne de diverses qualités. Très dynamique, elle possède de très bons atouts en termes de force de vente. Aussi, jouit elle d’une notoriété non moins négligeable dans son entourage. Actuellement, dame D. Marie éprouve des difficultés car la demande est très forte et les produits nécessaires à cet effet manquent, faute de moyens financiers. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 25 lengths of pagne

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia B., wife of Mr. M., lives in a small city of Pakistan named Chichawatni. She has been living in this city for the last 40 years. She has a four room brick house. She has six sons. Her first two sons are married. All of her sons are in a mature age. The second son works in a paint shop. The son next to him has a motor bike business. Her husband runs a Pan shop. She needs a loan for her husband’s business.

Safia has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Shazia B. wants a loan to expand her meat business; Suraiya B. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Nasreen B. wants a loan to expand her fruit business; Irshad B., wants a loan to make sacks of flour and fine flour to sell in the market and earn a profit.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To entertain peoples' demands

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married, and he has a 9-year-old son. He and his family live in Stryi. For the past 4 years, Sergey has been in the business of offering transportation services all over Europe. Currently, he has one employee working for him, and his net profit is approximately 3,200 Grivnas (i.e., over $600) per month.

Sergey is seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000 Grivnas ($875) to purchase two new tires for his vehicle, which will help him meet all the standard customs' requirements when he crosses the border in his car. With the loan proceeds, he is hoping to generate additional profit and to eventually purchase a second vehicle for his business. Moreover, the expected additional income will help Sergey pay for certain medical expenses he incurred when his son had surgery to have a tumor removed from his leg.

loans.use: To purchase two new tires for his business' vehicle and to eventually purchase a second vehicle

loans.name: Romana's Rabella Group

texts.en:
Romana is divorced and the mother of four children who range in age from 20 to 26 years old. She owns a shop and a house which she rents to other people. Ramona started her businesses in 1993. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $350.

In the past, Romana successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania that she used to expand her business. She has now applied for a new loan to buy more items to sell from her shop. She will divide this loan among the other members of her group, Winifrida, Helena and Emyrose, who run small businesses of their own, including operating a general store and raising livestock.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from their businesses.

loans.name: Pedro Clemente

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro V., age 28, is married and weaves traditional clothing. He resides in the Aldea Vásquez, in the department and municipality of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has two looms in two separate locations in the same village, he and his wife work in one while an employee works at the other. From an early age he worked on manufacturing traditional fabrics, since his parents were not able to provide an education due to their living conditions. Being a young and enthusiastic worker, he harvested the knowledge he gained from his father and started his own workshop. Now he needs to increase his capital to by buy raw materials and two looms and thus also generate more jobs and help improve the standard of living for both his employees and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pedro Vásquez de 28 años de edad, casado de oficios Tejedor “Fabricante de cortes Típicos” con residencia en la Aldea Vásquez del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala, Cuenta con un taller de 2 telares en diferentes lugares de la misma Aldea en la cual él y su esposa trabajan en la misma y cuentan con un empleado. Desde su temprana edad ya laboraba en la fabricación de cortes típicos, ya que sus padres no le pudieron dar estudio debido a las condiciones de vida que tenían, siendo un joven entusiasta trabajo y cosecho los conocimientos de su padre e inicio su propio taller, con la cual ahora necesita incrementar su capital, comprando materia prima y dos telares mas y asi también generara empleos y ayudara a mejorar su condición de vida tanto la de sus trabajadores como la de su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase raw materials for fabrication of traditional fabrics

loans.name: Hadia's Imani Yetu Group

texts.en:
Hadia is 40 years old. She is divorced with 7 children aged between 22 and 1 year old. She has been a clothes and bread seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Hadia is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members MwaJ. and Rehema, who have businesses selling food and soap and dressmaking.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to bolster her business

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: Jamshed has owned a transportation business for the past 2 years. He transports people around his town. As he is the only bread-winner in his family, his car service business is the only source of  family income. When he bought his car it was new, but as his auto is always on the move it is in need of some repairs. This loan will help to make a fast and quality repair of his car.

loans.use: Repairing his car

loans.name: Edicson

texts.es: El Sr. J. Alvarado, pequeño productor de arroz, socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, actualmente tiene establecida 4 mzs de arroz, el que asiste junto a su esposa, la que atiende el hogar y produccion de especies menores que le genera ingresos adicionales que le permitan mantener el sustento familiar; en los periodos de siembra y cosecha apoya al marido en las labores de manejo de cultivo, a travez de la cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio de un trillo en la comunidad de la peña, para lo cual requiere de C$.15,000.00, lo que permitira realizar sus sueño para el futuro y asi contar con mejores condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. J. Alvarado is a small producer of rice and an associate of "La Esperanza" (Hope) cooperative agribusiness. At present he has established 4 plantations of rice, which he works along with his wife, who attends the home and the production of smaller crops that generate additional income which permit them to maintain the family living. During planting and harvest seasons, she helps her husband with the cultivation management work. Because of the cooperative he has the opportunity to participate as an associate of a store of rice for the community of La Peña, for which he requires of 15,000 cordoba (Nicaraguan currency). This will permit him to carry out his dream and in this way provide better family living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay 30% of the cost of producing a store of rice for the community of La Peña

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is a hard-working woman who dreams to see her two children finish college education. She is 39 years old and married to Roosevelt who is also her business partner. Their children are Sheila Mae - 16 years old, a college student and Lara Kaye - 11 years old, a high school student.

Her family lives in a community surrounded by hospitable, responsible and God-fearing people. She and her husband are engaged in farming which is their major source of income, but with their desire to provide a better life for their family, they also engage in other businesses such as hog-raising, furniture-making, welding and a small store in their village. Delia's products include basic commodities, rice, soft drinks, personal care items and hog feed.

Delia is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 (USD$325) which will be used in their farm business since their income is not enough to sustain the next planting season. She hopes that through her loan their economic status will improve.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm.

loans.name: Audelia María

texts.es:
La señora Audelia G. se dedica a la venta de ropa teniendo su propio establecimiento en la ciudad de León en el mercado La Terminal donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella se prepara para iniciar su jornada de trabajo vendiendo la ropa

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora y se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual le han permitido la compra de la mercadería. Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella solicita el crédito es para adquirir la mercadería y de esta forma continuar en el negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Audelia G.’s job is selling clothing from her own stall in the market of La Terminal in the town of León. Starting in the early morning every day she gets ready for her day’s work selling clothes. She says she is an excellent worker and has been much helped by loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel. This money has allowed her to buy more merchandise. Today she is asking for a loan to buy more goods and so continue her clothes-selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
José Ernesto O. V. tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es casado, Don José tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hija mayor tiene 6 años y cursa el 1 grado de primaria y su hijo menor de 4 años cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañera de vida labora como mesera, sus propósitos son de seguir manteniendo este tipo de negocio por lo que en estos días es muy difícil ya que los precios de la comida están muy altos por lo que los diferentes clientes no pagan el precio de los variados, sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su establecimiento ya que en sus intereses se encuentra que su negocio sea un lugar acogedor para que sus clientes queden satisfechos con sus local, sus deseos son de establecer otro tipo de negocio ya que así podrá poseer 2 fuentes de ingresos para su familia ya el negocio que le gustaría establecer seria el de una distribuidora ya que este le dará los beneficios para en un futuro que le favorecerán a sus hijos.

Su actividad económica es la de bar y comedor, la ubicación de su negocio es en parque del san Felipe 1 cuadra al sur, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, Don José inicia esta actividad económica luego de que su Mama le pide que administre el negocio debido a su avanzada edad aunque en años anteriores le otorgo los derechos de la actividad económica a una hermana quien por su enfermedad de artritis se desfiguro completamente su cuerpo y le impidió realizar las actividades motoras y debido a esta situación es que Don José asume el control total de los negocios contando con el apoyo de su esposa y de su Mama quien a pesar de su edad se siente comprometida con el negocio familiar posteriormente asume la obligación crediticia que había dejado su hermana con la institución Fundación León 2000 y a su ves le da la oportunidad de establecer su propio record de pago siendo hasta la fecha un buen cliente quien a pesar de su cargado horario de su trabajo por lo que tiene un trabajo adicional  que le proporciona cubrir los gastos necesarios, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que quiere realizarle las respectivas condiciones a su local ya que quiere invertir para darle las mejoras necesarias.
texts.en:
José Ernesto O. V. is 31 years old and married. José has 2 children: his elder daughter is 6 years old and is in the 1st grade of primary school, and his younger son is four years old and in the 3rd year of preschool. His partner works as a waitress, and their aim is to continue maintaining this type of business even though in these days it is very difficult as the price of food is very high and the customers don't pay the difference in price. Their dreams are to make improvements to their establishment, as it's in their interests that their business gains a reputation as a welcoming place so that their customers remain satisfied with the locale. Their hope is to establish another type of business so that they will have two sources of income for the family. The business they would like to establish is a distribution centre, as this will give them the profits to provide a better future for their children. José's economic activity is running a bar and diner, located one block south from the San Felipe park. He has owned this business for 5 years, José began this economic activity after his Mama asked her to administer the business thanks to her advanced age although in previous years she had given the rights to the business to a sister, but whose body was completely disfigured as a result of her arthritis which prevented her from undertaking any mobile activities. As a result of this situation, it was José who assumed total control of the business, counting on the support of his wife and his mother, who despite being such an advanced age still felt committed to the family business. Later he assumed the creditor's obligations that his sister had left with the Leon 2000 foundation, and in his turn had the opportunity to establish his own repayment record, and up until now he has been a good client despite his heavy work load (as he has an additional job which covers essential household expenses). The loan is for work capital as he wants to undertake various repairs and renovations to the business site, investing in order to provide the necessary improvements

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 28-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Haytham has been working as a car repairer for two years. He repairs cars, as well as he changes cars oils, tires and steering wheels. Haytham requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cars tools and merchandise for his work like cars batteries and other things. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Haytham is special in his work because of his experience in his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on purchasing his garage.

loans.use: Haytham will use the loan to purchase cars tools and merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been a clothes and bites seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for two years. She belongs to the Kitanzini group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works for six hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes (Vitenge) to sell and buy other items for preparing bites. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children and to get more food for her family.

Amina is 30 years old, single, and has two children: ages 11 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos 4 Group

texts.en:
The members of Group 4 from the Unidas Venceremos Bank of Hope have been clients of Esperanza International for the last three years. They have paid their previous loans on time and have remained together as a group all this time. They think being together in a Bank of Hope has helped them be closer as neighbors and to contribute to their community. 

Ruth J. is the group coordinator, which means she is responsible for watching out for the well being of the rest of the group members, collecting payments, and being in permanent communication with their loan officer Nelly. She sells clothing and has built a large, faithful clientele. With this loan, she plans to add shoes to her sales, in order to offer this option to her clients who have asked that she start selling shoes. 

Ruth's health is not very strong. She gets sick rather easily and this keeps her away from her clients for extended periods of time. She hopes that during the time she is healthy, she can sell enough to attend her sickness with proper medical attention. Her dream is to travel to the United States someday as a tourist.
 
Please help us support the hopes and dreams of these entrepreneurs. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy shoes to add to her clothing sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a mother of five children who runs a restaurant in Bamenda, Cameroon. Restaurants in Cameroon can be as small as a menu with three items and a couple of benches under an overhang. Veronica’s restaurant is just that way. With this loan, she plans to buy food to serve: cocoyams, corn, rice, beans, palm oil, groundnut (peanut) oil, flashes (matches), groundnut, meat, fish and spices. She will also use the loan to pay for transportation costs associated with her business.

This is Veronica’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. Her first loan from GHAPE was used much in the same way, investing in her business. She has seen success from her past experiences, and knows how to alter her business practices when there is a failure, she says.

Veronica has struggled with living in poor conditions and not always having enough money for things like her children's school fees or house rent. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay for food for the family and her children's school fees, as well as save money for medical fees. Veronica chooses GHAPE loans because unlike her other options, like loan sharks or private groups, she pays her loan back little by little without fear of being chased down.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, corn, rice, palm oil, groundnuts and other supplied for her restaurant.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., age 29, is married and is the mother of one lovely young child who is enrolled in the local primary school. She owns a store in the local market where she sells different kinds of souvenirs for tourists. Most of her customers are foreigners who come to visit her community. Her husband, who works as a goldsmith, also contributes to the family's income.

The family has been facing difficulty with transportation for a long time because of they do not own a vehicle. Therefore, S. has decided to seek a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, HKL, to purchase a motorcycle for family's driving needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for family's driving needs

loans.name: Hushvaht

texts.ru: Таджиев Хушвахт проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Хушвахт по профессии более 10 лет работает гидротехником. В данный момент более 20 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает овощи и бахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Hushvaht T. lives in the Rumy region. He is married and has four children. Hushvaht has worked as a hydro technical engineer for more than ten years. At this time he has been in agriculture for more than twenty years. He grows vegetables and melons. The client is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Las Amapolas
Maria  es casada tiene 33 años, cuatro hijos de 12, 9 que están en la escuela estatal y dos hijos de 4 años que son gemelos   
Maria  estudio administración de empresas  pero no termino por que se caso y salio embarazada y puso en su casa una tienda  
Desde que Maria esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar, las charlas que ha recibido le han ayudado para su negocio.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche para su tienda.
El sueño de Maria es crecer en el negocio  con su esposo en la venta y compra de carros usados.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank group called “Las Ampolas” (The Poppies). She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. The oldest two children (ages 12 and 9) attend a state school and the other two are 4 year old twins.

Maria studied business administration, but she had to quit school when she got married and became pregnant. She then opened a store out of her home. Since joining FINCA, Maria has learned how to save and the advice she received has helped her business.

She needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk for her store. Maria dreams of growing her business with her husband and purchasing a used car.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Alice L. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée sans enfants. elle tient une boutique dans laquelle elle étale plusieurs articles. Pour augmenter la taille de son commerce, Alice souhaite avec ce crédit, approvisionner son magasin de nouveaux articles afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle ; et par ricochet une augmentation des recettes et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alice L. is 37 years old, married, and without any children. She has a shop in which she displays several items. To increase the size of her business, she wishes to use this loan to supply her store with new items in order to respond better to customer needs. Consequently, she would increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Anteriormente Elenita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad de Juanjui. Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, que los realiza en su casa, como también viaja a los pueblos aledaños, en épocas festivas.  Lleva poco tiempo en este tipo de actividad de venta de ropa y nos cuenta que le va muy bien es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, ya que tiene como meta implementar su negocio con ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, a su edad el trabajo que realiza no le causa mucha molestia, y esta muy tranquila con lo que hace. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada,  en el barrio ya es muy conocida y es la única que cuenta con este tipo de negocio  y esto le da mayores ventajas para sus ventas y sus precios son muy cómodos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Se siente muy contenta, tiene muchas fuerzas aun para seguir adelante, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena O. is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” Microfinance Institute in the Junajui district of the Mariscal Cáceres province, department of San Martín. She is a 40-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children, 2 of whom are her dependents and are in school.

Elenita, as she is lovingly referred to, used to sell vegetables at the Central Market in the city of Juanjui. Nowadays, she sells used clothing both from home and at the nearby towns during the holidays. She has not been in this business for very long, but she states that she is prosperous. This is how she managed to save the money she needed to purchase a large variety of clothing because her goal is to launch an apparel business for men, women and children. This job is not very strenuous for a person her age, and she is at ease with what she does.

She still runs the same business and now has faithful customers. She is very well-known in her neighborhood because she is the only person with this type of business. This gives her a sales advantage, and her prices are very reasonable.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more apparel like pants, T-shirts, dresses, and shirts for men, women and children. She feels very satisfied and still has the energy to keep getting ahead in life, which is why she recognizes the support that the Manuela Ramos Movement has been giving her and other women in the San Martín region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia Cordelia S. tiene 55 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella decide iniciar este negocio porque su esposo y ella no tenían un ingreso estable, por lo que deciden establecer una pulpería que le ayude a sufragar los gastos de su familia. Es por esto que solicita el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de papel, arroz, frijoles, jugos, jabón, detergente, aceite entre otros. Su deseo es que logre alcanzar todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Claudia Cordelia S. is 55 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. She has been operating a grocery store for the past 4 years. She started this business because she and her husband did not have a steady source of income, so they decided selling groceries would be a good way to help cover their living expenses.

For this reason, Claudia is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy paper, rice, beans, juices, soap, detergent, oil, and other products. She hopes to succeed in meeting all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 57 year old, a widow with 8 children. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for the past 9 years. She hopes the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito B. is a farmer who lives in the village of Sto. Nińo Aurora, Isabela. He is a man with strong fighting spirit who will do anything for the future welfare of his family. He is blessed with two children: his first child is now a teacher and his youngest child is in his second year of college education. Aside from farming, Juanito also maintains a hog raising business in his yard. His business incomes enable him to pay the tuition fees of his child in school and to support and feed his family.

He wanted to take out a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy a sufficient supply of feed for his pigs. Some of the loan amount will be used topurchase another piglet to raise. Eventually, Juanito hopes to have his own pig pen where he can raise larger numbers of pigs so as to earn enough profit to improve the life of his family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed as well as to purchase a piglet to raise

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo García B. tiene 53 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella realiza esta actividad hace 16 años, Consuelo empezó a vender estos tipos de productos por lo que su esposo estaba enfermo con problemas de salud muy serios, y necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia, por lo que decidió salir a las calles en busca del pan de cada día para ofrecerlo a su familia, y así con el paso del tiempo logro aumentar en productos y obtener muchos clientes. En un futuro le gustaría mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que es a pesar de vivir en un lugar muy humilde le gustaría realizarle ciertas remodelaciones. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de nuevos productos, pinturas de labios, cremas y colonias.
texts.en:
Consuelo García B. is 53 years old and has a business selling cosmetics. She began selling this type of products sixteen years ago when her husband was seriously ill and her family needed more income. She decided to seek her daily bread by selling things on the street, and as time passed she was able to expand the products she offered and attract many customers.

In the future, Consuelo would like to improve her family's living conditions, since it is difficult to live in such a humble home and she would like to do some remodeling.

Consuelo will use this loan as working capital to purchase new products, including lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu was born in 1972. She lives in Fuzuli region. She is married and has 2 children. 6 years ago, she started an orchard business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.en:
N. Shahzoda is 54 years old. She is married with three children. Shahzoda's husband does not earn much. In order to help her husband and to support her family, Shahzoda has been running the business for 7 years already. She sells household appliances. All the equipment is imported from neighboring cities. The business generates significant income for the family, allowing improving their living conditions. Today Shahzoda requests a loan of 3000 Somoni. She is going to spend the loan purchasing new household appliances. Receiving loans from IMON since 2006, Shahzoda has shown herself to be a reliable client with a positive credit history.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing household appliances.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina C. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old. Edwina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Edwina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing products in the local community. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edwina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Edwina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ADELA tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene dos hijas: Lizbeth tiene siete años y Caty tiene nueve años ambas están en el programa social “URPI WASI” donde estudian y viven.   
      
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella tiene su puesto de venta en los mercados de “Cascaparo” y “Huancaro” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas y verduras como cebollas, repollos, lechugas y muchas más. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   La socia en la foto esta acompañada de su sobrina Mariela de siete años.
texts.en:
Our partner, Adela, age 32, is from Cusco and lives with her partner. She belongs to the village bank "Patron Santiago de Santiago", part of the Arariwa Association. She has two children. Lizbeth is only 7 years old and Caty is 9 years old. They are both in the social program Urpi Wasi where they go to school and live. Adela spends some of her time selling fruits and vegetables from her home, and some of her time selling from her stall in the Cascaparo and Huancaro markets of Cusco. She has had this business for several years, and it has done well thanks to all the effort she puts in to her work. She is a hardworking, enterprising mother who has helped move her family forward. She would like a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables like onions, cabbage, lettuce and much more. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and promises to complete her payments according to the schedule. She is pictured with her niece, 7 year old Mariela.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria  Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa es comerciante madre de dos hijos está domiciliada en el Km 5 Monday de la Ciudad de Presidente Franco la misma se dedica a  la compra y venta de bebidas, en una bodega que tiene instalada en su domicilio.
 Las mercaderías que se ofrece en su negocio son  adquiridas de la Argentina, y son de primera calidad y son productos bien variados a fin de mantener la con clientela formada que la misma tiene, elle solicitó el crédito en la Fundación Paraguaya y a la vez para  aumentar la demanda que se registra en fin de año, se trata de una persona trabajadora y honesta, y agradece el apoyo de la función.-
texts.en:
María Luisa is a shopkeeper and mother of two children. She lives on Km 5 Monday in the city of President Franco. She dedicates herself to buying and selling drinks through a liquor store located in her house. The merchandise that she offers in her store is from Argentina and is high quality. She offers a variety of products so that she maintains the clientele that has formed. She requested this loan from Fundación Paraguay in order to meet the increased demand that occurs at the end of the year. She is a hardworking and honest person and is thankful for the support of the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of drinks consumed during this season of festivities, such as wine, cider, soft drinks, liquor, etc.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
39-year-old Bernie manages a rice field and owns a sari-sari store in Norala, South Cotabato. He has three children and the eldest is 11 years old. He started his business in 1990.

in November 2008, Bernie joined CEVI. Now he’s requesting a loan of Php 12,000 to help finance his business. He will be able to purchase groceries for his store and supplies for his farm with this amount. The income he will receive is very helpful in continuing to send his children to school.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and groceries for his store

loans.name: Maria Auxiladora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 66 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita, pues han sido muy beneficiosos para su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de botones, telas, agujas, hilos entre otros productos. Ella quiere aprovechar esta temporada que es cuando los niños entran a clases y es la mejor oportunidad para realizar pedidos que ya le han encargo es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es seguir con vida para continuar con este humilde trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 66 years old, her economic activity is sewing; this is not her first loan since she has benefited a lot from the loans for her business. The loan will be used as work capital to buy buttons, fabrics, needles, threads among other products. She needs to take advantage of this season since this is when children go back to school and it is the best opportunity to complete all the work that has been commissioned, this is why she needs the loan to buy the materials. Her wish is remain alive to continue with this humble job.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital.

loans.name: Juanita Yoana

texts.es:
La señora JUANITA YOANA C. B. tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Juanita se dedica a la venta de manjar blanco, rosquitas, queso, quesillo, etc. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a vender sus rosquitas que compro al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará rosquitas, quesos, manajar blanco, quesillo para cubrir los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Ella sueña con aumentar su negocio y empezar a vender todos los días en el mercado que esta cerca  a su casa.
texts.en:
Juanita is 25 years old and lives in the “Del Provenir” district of the “Trujillo” province in the “La Libertad” department in Peru. She is a member of the “MUJERES DECIDIDAS” (Women of Decision) communal bank and has completed the 5th grade. She has two children who depend on her financially. Juanita sells delicacies, bagels, breads, cheeses, etc. After receiving her first loan of 300 PEN, she began selling the bagels that she bought in bulk. She will use the 800 PEN ($300) from this loan to buy items to cover her customers’ requests. She hopes to grow her business and begin selling daily in the marketplace near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread and cheeses for resale

loans.name: Buuveibaatar

texts.en: Buuveibaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter goes to a university. In 2003, he started the intestine processing business with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 351 USD). After seven years of hard work, his working capital has grown to 8,000,000 tugrugs (~ 5,629 USD). Because of his business success Buuveibaatar has been able to pay for his children's tuition fees and provide money to cover family expenses. He is a very hardworking person and has a great business mind. Buuveibaatar is requesting a 3,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw intestines from suppliers in his own province, for processing at his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw intestines

loans.name: Lani Guigue Group

texts.en:
Lani G. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and the leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Lani is married and has three school-aged children. She has owned a retail clothing business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lani joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used for inventory and working capital. Lani is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lani from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación.

Visitando a sus clientes en sus casas, es como Carmen realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza. Ella es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con las ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En la ciudad de Tarma es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar por la venta de sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen plata para pagarle, pero ella siempre se las arregla para que le paguen completamente todas sus ventas. Para más adelante, espera implementar una tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender más cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa.
