Este es el noveno préstamo de Carmen con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más cosméticos, ya que últimamente está teniendo una mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old and she is a very cheerful and hard-working woman; she lives in a rented house with her two beloved children to whom she whishes to provide a good education. She sells her beauty products by visiting customers at their homes. She is a persistent and persuasive salesperson, allowing her to complete the sale of her cosmetics very quickly. She is well known in the city of Tarma and people know that she sells high quality products. What she likes the most about her job is to give advice to her customers on the best-fitting product for their face; she has been selling these products for 2 years and she considers the most difficult part is to collect payment for the products since her customers do not have money to pay sometimes. However, somehow she always manages to collect all the money she is owed. Looking forward, she hopes to setup a cosmetic store, where she would be able to sell more comfortably without the need to go from house to house. This is Carmen’s ninth loan with MFP; she wants to grow her business and for this reason she plans to make all her payments so she can request another loan; she also knows she has the support of her community bank. With the seven hundred Nuevos Soles requested, she will buy more cosmetics, since she has been having a higher demand lately.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 38-year-old hardworking tailor. She has been making and selling clothes since 2000. She uses the income from her business to pay wages to her employee and to support her family. She is a member of the Gitinua Pacesetters group with Faulu Kenya, where she saves her money weekly. She was previously guaranteed a loan of 20,000 KES, which she used to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy embroidery materials. She hopes to be successful in her business in the future. Grace is married and has two children.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Cendy Johanna

texts.es:
Cendy C. de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así por su abundancia de la flor orquídeas, calles ya de asfalto y casas de cemento) de Guayaquil. Es soltera y no tiene hijos. 

Cendy trabajaba en una empresa pero por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió retirarse de esa empresa y empezar a ganar su propio dinero. Aunque tenia miedo de perder todo su dinero continuo con su sueño e invirtió todos sus ahorros en arroz, azúcar y bebidas y construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un local para la tienda.

Cendy ahora trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días en ocasiones sus padres le ayudan en la tienda. Vende legumbres, granos, enlatados, bebidas, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres, bebidas y arroz para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su tienda.
texts.en:
Cendy C. is 30 years old. She lives in Orquídeas (called this due to its abundance of orchids, asphalt streets and cement houses), on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She is single and has no children. Cendy worked in a business but out of desperation to have her own business, she decided to leave that business and start to make her own money. Although she was afraid of losing al her money, she continued with the dream and invested all of her savings in rice, sugar and beverages and built a place for her store in the front of her house. Cendy now works in her store from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day. On occasion, her parents help her in the store. She sells vegetables, grains, canned goods, beverages, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy vegetables, beverages, and rice for her store. In the future, she wants to have more stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beverages, vegetables, rice

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn M., 34 years old, is from the village of Pigsag an Cagayan de Oro City. She is married and has 4 school-aged children.

To make a living Madelyn operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Madelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Madelyn joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Madelyn is requesting her fourth loan, for 14000 PHP, which she will invest in her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of mustard seeds

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
El señor Rómulo F. C., es un productor de leche de la zona tradicional de Sumumpaya a 9 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es casado, sólo ha terminado la primaria y desde muy joven por tradición familiar se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos están en edad escolar y uno no llega a los 5 años.

Entrega su producción a la planta industrializadora de leche y  el crédito le servirá como parte de la construcción de  dos habitaciones para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro poder ver a sus  tres hijos estudiar y salir profesionales así poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rómulo F. C. is a milk producer who lives in the old-fashioned area of Sumumpaya, which is nine kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. His is married, and he only finished elementary school. Following family tradition, he has raised dairy cows since he was very young. He has three children. Two of them are school age, and one is not yet five years old. He delivers his production to an industrialized milk plant. He will use the loan as part of what he needs to build two rooms, which will improve his family’s living conditions. His biggest dream is to be able to see his three children go to school and become professionals in the future. This way they will be able to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House construction

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 52 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 4 children between the ages of 10 and 33. Three of the children are still attending school.

Patrick is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 22 years and has six employees. His products are pineapples, maize, tea, and milk which he sells locally. He also buys and re-sells cows at a profit.

His biggest challenge has been the high cost of farm inputs like fertilizers and chemicals which affects his produce and the inconsistent markets and pricing of his farm products.

Patrick has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a dairy cow. He says that with this loan, he will have more disposable income through the sale of milk and this will improve the living standards of his family.

In the future, he would like to increase the quality of his dairy breeds and purchase a truck that will assist him in transportation. He would also like to access loans of higher amounts in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantrea V. is 25 years old and her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Pov, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have two children – one son and one daughter – both of whom are still young. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Chantrea runs a grocery store at her home. She has just delivered a baby. Her husband has been a blacksmith for ten years. She is applying for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorcycle for her brother to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her brother

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba S. is a widow and has five dependents. She has received senior high education. Araba sells foodstuffs at Takoradi. She takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales.  She will use the loan to purchase extra food items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: purchase extra food items for sale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane’s biggest dream is to have a successful pig farm someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of hog fattening is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of shortage.  

Over the years, she has provided for her family by managing hog raising. Now she is proposing another loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos for hog fattening, a common business for people in her area suffering from poverty. Mary Jane will buy additional piglets, sacks of feed and supplements and vitamins for the piglets. She will raise them for approximately four to six months until they are ready for sale. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her hog-fattening business will generate a steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy addditional piglets, sacks of feeds, supplements and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Noriline

texts.en: Noriline M. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Noriline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Noriline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma tiene una tienda de abarrotes que ha hecho crecer con muchos esfuerzos, le ah dedicado mucho tiempo y ahora es una tienda mas grande y con mas variedad de abarrotes, ella y su esposo se han encargado de levantar el negocio, requieren de este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para surtir la tienda de  abarrotes.
texts.en: Norma has a grocery store that she has helped to grow with a lot of effort.  She has dedicated a lot of time to it and it is now a bigger store with a greater variety of groceries.  She and her husband have been in charge of boosting the business.  They need this loan for the purchase of more merchandise to stock the grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana Beatriz M. D. L. D. 28 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Unión, en donD. vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos D. 6 y 3 años D. edad, y junto a sus padres. Ana es una persona muy detallista, la cual posee un negocio en el cual se encarga D. elaborar recuerdos, centros D. mesa, ramos para fiestas, y adornos para decorar recepciones y fiestas. Su trabajo es muy delicado y bonito por lo que llama la atención D. muchas personas, las cuales la toman en cuenta para cualquier celebración, así mismo Ana procura mantenerse con todas las tendencias D. arreglos, D. manera que sus clientes siempre la prefieran y D. esta forma la pueda recomendar con otras personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar su trabajo, elementos como: globos, flores, telas y otros más son lo que ella desea comprar por mayor y D. esta manera percibir más ganancias.
texts.en: Ana Beatriz M. D. L., 28, lives in the La Union department with her husband and his parents and their two children who are 6 years old and 3 months old.  Ana is a very detail-oriented person, who has a business where she makes keepsakes, centerpieces, flower arrangements for parties, and decorations for receptions and parties.  Her work is very delicate and pretty, which is why it captures the attention of a lot of people who keep her mind for when they have any type of celebration.  In addition, Ana seeks to keep up with all of the trends in arrangements so that her customers always prefer her and are able to recommend her to other people.  She requests a loan to buy all types of raw materials for her work, items such as: balloons, flowers, fabrics, and other items that she wants to buy at wholesale so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy balloons, flowers and other materials to make arrangements and keepsakes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from Jenin.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee.  Ahmad is a very good employee, known for his discipline and honesty.

Ahmad is ready to have his own house and now he wants to purchase home appliances as he is preparing for marriage.  He took a $2,000 loan from FATEN to purchase the needed items.  

Ahmad appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina A., age 22, is a rice farmer. She earns her living by planting and harvesting rice to offer for sale. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She is unmarried and lives in the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. 
 
In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds and seedlings to raise. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure for her rice field

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Darling Maribel

texts.es: Darling Maribel, tiene 38 años su actividad es la venta de cosméticos.  Es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Los encargos que realizan sus clientes ya que la rapidez con que ellos obtienen los pedidos los pone muy contentos, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que no le gusta andar muy tardes en las calles lleva 15 años con su negocio. Este crédito es para comprar lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes y otras cosas. Su sueño es tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en: Darling Maribel is 38 years old.  Her business activity is selling cosmetics.  She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman.  Her customers make their orders and she fills them quickly because that makes them very happy.  She works from Monday to Saturday from 8.00am to 9.00pm.  She doesn't like staying out in the street any later at night.  Darling Maribel has been in this business for 15 years.  This loan will be used to buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes and other products.  Her dream is to have premises from which she can sell her products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Timinandja Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Timinandja, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de tubercules, de l’arachide des condiments et des habillements. Les femmes du groupe Timinandja sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                              
TATA T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des tubercules.                                                                     
Elle s’approvisionne en tubercules au marché de Fana pendant les jours de foire. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de tubercules.
texts.en:
The women of the Timinandja group are all married, are on average 40 years old with four children, and live in traditional extended families in the Banankabougou district of the city of Fana, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties and are in the business of selling tubers, peanuts, condiments and clothing. The women of the Timinandja group are on their first joint loan with Soro Yiriwaso.
TATA T. plans to use her loan to buy tubers. She gets her supply of tubers at the market in Fana during market days.  She makes her sales daily from her home for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. 
She plans to make a monthly profit of 20,000 CFA which will be used to pay interest on the loan and  to make contributions to social ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her tuber business.

loans.use: to buy tubers

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
Mrs. Ley S. (in the photo), 49, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. The daughter is a garment-factory worker, one son is a security guard and another one is in school. She lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ley sells vegetables in the local market. Her house is old and breaks down in some parts. She wants to repair it, but she does not have money. So she decided to ask for her first loan of $1,000 to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 67 años, es viuda, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su  tres hijos ya mayores. Desde que en vida fuera su esposo, durante 20 años, se dedicaban a la fabricación de muebles, en el taller de su casa. En la actualidad Marcela,  ha tomado el control y la administración de la  carpintería; por ser su única fuente de trabajo, que le ayuda con el sustento de su hogar. Por esta razón, su hijo también la apoya, ayudándola en la fabricación de estos muebles, de esa manera se gana la confianza de los clientes, quienes no dudan en hacerles más pedidos de puertas, mesas, sillas, marcos de ventas entre otros. Se siente muy contenta con su trabajo; por ello desea ampliar su taller. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para acceder a posteriores créditos, pues quiere continuar progresando con su taller. De obtener el crédito que solicita, los invertirá en la compra de melamina, triplay y madera, para continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 67 year old widow.  She lives in her own house with her three grown children.  For 20 years, when her husband was alive, they made furniture in the workshop at her house.

Marcela has currently taken over the control and administration of the carpentry shop.  It is her only source of work to help support her household.  That is why her son also supports her by helping her make the furniture.  This is the way she earns her customers’ trust.  Her customers do not hesitate to place more orders for doors, tables, chairs, and frames, among others.  She is very happy with her work, and she wishes to expand her workshop.

This is her 12th loan with MFP.  She pledges to make all of her payments on time in order to access future loans.  She wants to continue making progress with her workshop.  She will use the requested loan to buy melamine, plywood, and wood to continue carrying out her work.

loans.use: To buy melamine, plywood, and wood

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 33-year-old woman from Hebron city. Sameera lives with her mother and takes care of her as she is sick and needs regular treatment and a lot of medications that costs Sameera a lot. Sameera saved a good amount of money giving private lessons to students. Sameera used the money to buy a small store and start a grocery store. She came to FATEN to take a loan and purchase goods to sell, increase her income and cover the household expenses.

Sameera is photographed in FATEN's branch in Hebron.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Eda Maria

texts.es: La señora emprendedora Eda Maria tiene 42 años. Esta señora tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Tiene sueños de mantener su negocio activo y poder sostener todas sus necesidades.  Su actividad económica es la venta de CD, DVD y accesorios para celulares, desde hace 8 años que tiene este negocio. Sus inicios empiezan cuando consiguió un tramo en el mercado, pues fue así que con poco capital ha logrado avanzar con este medio de vida.  Por lo que es necesario el financiamiento para la compra de CD, DVD y los accesorios ya que actualmente tiene una gran demanda.
texts.en: The enterprising Mrs. Eda Maria is 42 years old.  She has three children and dreams of keeping her business up and being able to take care of all of her necessities.  She has made a living selling CDs, DVDs, and cell phone accessories for eight years.  It all began when she got a spot in the market and with little working capital she was able to get ahead with this business.  The loan is needed to buy CDs, DVDs, and accessories since there is a great demand right now.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Enkhbat is 45 years old. He is married and the father of two young men.  His family lives in a small house in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a legal advisor at a private company while his oldest son is a section chef at a restaurant.  The youngest son attends university.  In most cases, the family relies on him.

Enkhbat has been operating his transportation business with his small lorry since 2007. He mostly transports goods by his lorry from a construction and building materials market, called Gurvaljin. He has lots of competitors at the market, yet he still has a large number of constant customers. Over the past few years, he managed to pay his sons’ tuition expenses with the profits.
He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase a new engine and other spare parts that need to be changed. He is working hard to support his oldest son to go to Japan to study.

loans.use: to purchase an engine and other spare parts

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace S. is from the village of Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of her service. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

location.town: Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Lydia is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service such as nail polish & brush. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nail polish & brushes.

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Nub C., 32, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. C. and her husband sell palm sugar, earning an income of about USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 46 on food and USD 31 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport coconuts to resell. This will be her second from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport coconuts.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer soltera de 51 años de edad, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en nueva esperanza que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, es una zona urbana.  Chiclayo se caracteriza por tener mucha actividad comercial, turismo y agricultura.
La actividad que realiza Delia  esa  la compra y venta de sandalias, cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en el negocio, ubicado en la parte exteriores del mercado modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo. A pesar de la competencia que tiene trata de que con sus ingresos pueda cubrir sus necesidades,  pero a visto la oportunidad  de vender  otro tipo de productos (ropa), para seguir incrmentando sus ventas.
El préstamo solicitado por  Delia a Edpyme Alternativa mediante el capital Semilla es de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual será destinado  para la compra de sandalias y ropa.  Al contar con más variedad de productos  Delia está dispuesta a que su negocio sea más rentable y atractivo para el cliente.
Delia está dispuesta a que su negocio cresca cada vez más con su esfuerzo y dedicación, permitiéndole mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Delia is a single woman who is 51 years old. She has her own house with water and light service. It is located in Nueva Esperanza [New Hope], which belongs to the province of Chiclayo in an urban area. Chiclayo is characterized by having a lot of commercial activity, tourism, and agriculture.
Delia buys and sells sandals. She has ten years of experience in the business, which is located in the outer part of the model market in the city of Chiclayo. Despite the competition that she has, she tries to make sure that her income covers the cost of her necessities. But she has seen the opportunity to sell another kind of product (clothing) in order to continue increasing her sales.
The loan that Delia has asked for from Edpyme Alternativa by means of the capital Semilla is for 2,000 nevos soles, which will be used to purchase sandals and clothes. Since she will have more variety in products, Delia is determined that her business will be more profitable and attractive to customers.
Delia is determined that her business will grow more and more with her efforts and dedication, allowing her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sandals and clothes.

loans.name: Tiacaque Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Tiacaque" este nombre fuen elejido por que las señoras viven en la comunidad de Tiacaque que significa lugar donde nace agua entre peñascos. Está ubicado en el estado de México y esta comunidad se caracteriza  por que hay un centro turistico en la localidad donde hay una enorme presa de agua y la mayoria de los habitantes se dedican a la crianza de borregos. El grupo está conformado por 13 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicitan un prestamo. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama Adriana M. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es ama de casa y se dedica a la crianza de animales, principalmente a la cria de borregos, comenta que la crianza de animales es lo que le agrada ya que es una actividad principal en la comunidad y tiene 3 años criando animales. Ella tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Para ella es la tercera vez que ha entrado en prestamos para fortalecer su negocio y quedando agradecida por la oportunida. Su dedicación en su negocio ha permitido que sus animales sean reconocidos por los clientes al momento de venderlos ya que la carne es de buena calidad, el prestamo le ayudará a comprar alimento y pastura para sus borregos ya que es lo primordial para que los animales crescan rapidamente y asi poder venderlos. Sueña que algun dia pueda incrementar el inventario de sus animales teniendo un corral con 50 cabezas de borregos y poner un local donde venda tacos de barbacoa y obtener mayores ganancias, tambien para contribuir a que sus hijos tengan una mayor educacion y tengan una profesion a futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Tiacaque'.  They chose this name because the ladies all live in the community of Tiacaque which means 'place where water is born between rocky outcrops'.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and their community is noted for the fact that it has a tourist site where there is an enormous reservoir.  Most of the town's inhabitants raise lambs for a living.

The group has 13 members and this is the third time that they have requested a loan.  One of the members is called Adriana M.  She is 25 years old and studied up to high school.  She is a homemaker and also raises animals, mainly lambs.  She says that raising animals is something she enjoys.  It is the main business activity in her community and she has been raising animals for three years.  Adriana has a 3 year-old son.  This is the third time that she has taken a loan to strengthen her business and she is grateful for the opportunity.  Her dedication to her business has enabled her animals to become well known by her customers because their meat is good quality.  This loan will help her to buy feed and fodder for her lambs since this is essential if her animals are to grow quickly and be sold.

Adriana dreams that some day she will be able to increase her inventory of animals, owning 50 head of lambs and setting up premises where she can sell 'tacos de barbacoa' (spicy shredded-beef tacos) and make more profits.  She also wants to help her children receive a good education and have a profession in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her business raising lambs

loans.name: Israel Rene

texts.es: El cliente de nombre Israel es un cliente joven emprendedor tiene el vehículo registrado a su nombre ya que sus Padres están separados y el  vive actualmente con la Mama y sus dos hermanas el prácticamente es el Hombre de la casa por que el mantiene a toda su familia el cliente es soltero y muy responsable y vive en la zona de alto Pampahasi en la casa de sus abuelos y también la hermana le ayuda con los gastos de la familia por que ella vende productos de belleza por catalogo. Invertirá el dinero en el mantenimiento general del  minibús y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. El joven Israel en la fotografia se encuentra junto a su hermana.
texts.en:
Israel is a young entrepreneur who has a vehicle registered in his name.  His parents are separated and currently he lives with his mother and two sisters.  He is the man of the house, so to speak, because he maintains the entire family.  Single and very responsible, he lives in the area of the upper Pampahasi in his grandparents' home.  His sister sells beauty products by catalogue and also helps with the household expenses.

Israel plans to use the loan to provide general maintenance for his minibus in order to give his customers the best possible service.  He is a hard worker and grateful to the institution of its support.  He is pictured in the photograph with his sister.

loans.use: To provide general maintenance for his vehicle.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two children. She lives in Drogobych. Irina sells men’s and women’s clothing and footwear in the local marketplace called ‘Promislovyi’. Polite and friendly customer service, as well as the favorable location of her vending kiosks, have been instrumental in the success story of her venture. 

Irina has been in the trade for 20 years. She started working in this sphere of business when she was only 18. Back then Irina lived and worked in Poland. However, later, she moved her business to Ukraine and stayed in Drogobych. Presently, she has 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to about 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Irina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear merchandise for further retail sale in the market. Her business has solid potential for further growth and development. Irina intends to invest generated funds in consistent expansion of her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal footwear and clothing inventory.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: La Señorita Yovana es soltera sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, tiene su puesto propio en el mercado La Cuchilla con licencia de funcionamiento y pago de impuestos a la alcaldía, cuenta con una antigüedad de cuatro años en la venta de cosméticos para hombres y mujeres y en menor proporción artículos de limpieza para el hogar.   Vive en la zona La Cuchilla desde su nacimiento prácticamente hasta la actualidad, la Señorita Yovana forma parte de los tantos jóvenes de emprendimiento que a su corta edad es una microempresaria exitosa y conocida con un negocio grande, legalmente constituido a su nombre, buena antigüedad, con una buena y estratégica ubicación por lo tanto tiene un buen flujo de clientes lo que se traduce en un buen nivel de ventas, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería al por mayor en artículos de limpieza como en cosméticos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señorita Yovana is a single woman without children. She lives at home with her parents and has her own stall in the La Cuchilla market. She has an operating license and pays taxes to the city. She has four years of experience selling cosmetics for men and women and a smaller amount of household cleaning supplies. 

She has lived in the La Cuchilla region from the time she was born practically until the present. Señorita Yovana is one of the many enterprising young people. At a young age, she is a successful and well-known micro entrepreneur. She has a large, long-standing business, legally established in her name. The store is in a good and strategic location providing a good flow of customers, which translates into a good level of sales. 

With the money from this loan she will buy wholesale cleaning supplies and cosmetic merchandise. She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Doña Maria vive en la comunidad de san Pedro barrio, pero solo viene a su comunidad los fines de semana ya que su negocio lo tienen en la ciudad de México, nos comenta que decidio ir a México hace 2 años cuando veia que su municipio no habia las oportunidade de avanzar y de mejorar, cuando llego a México vio la oportunidad de vender ropa en un tianguis grande y de poder sacar ganancias, fue lo que hizo y ahora ese su negocio, su credito lo tiene pensado invertir en comprar ropa por mayoreo en una fabrica para poder vender, los desafios que enfrenta es la incertidumbre de que algun dia por lo peligroso que es la ciudad le puedan robar la mercancia, no ha pasado nada pero si vive alerta, sus deseos son que pueda prosperar y tambien hacer un negocio de ropa en la comunidad de donde es, Doña Maria es soltera tiene 26 años y vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Doña Maria lives in the community of San Pedro, but she is only there on the weekends because her business is in Mexico City. She says she decided to go to Mexico City two years ago because her town did not offer opportunities to advance and improve. When she arrived in Mexico City, she saw an opportunity to sell clothes at a large flea market in order to earn income. Maria pursued this opportunity and now it is her business. She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of clothing in bulk from a factory so that she can sell them.

Maria faces uncertain challenges because the city can sometimes be dangerous and her merchandise could get stolen. So far nothing has happened to her because she remains alert. Her goals are to continue prospering and to also establish a clothing business in her hometown. Doña Maria is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk from a factory.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
"Try and try until you succeed" is the favorite motto of Warlito. Always believing that trying so hard is not a bad idea but a measurement of a successful person after overcoming all his failures but never surrendering to try again and again. 

Warlito is 49 years old. He is married with three children. One of his biggest dream is to become one of the successful farmers in the Philippines. His wife and children serve as inspiration in the business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow in his rice farm. He will also use some part of the loan to pay for labor fees for those working for him in the field. He further said that this loan will be of big help for him to stop borrowing from traders with high loan interest of five to ten percent each month.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow in his rice farm

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is a proud mother of two, aged 12 and 10, and has been in mixed farming for five years in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces eggs, tea and milk.

Jannifer has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for a total of 30,000 KES to help her buy more poultry birds and enjoy the economies of scale. She says the income will help her in educating her children, and also help expand her dairy farming by acquiring better breeds for the dairy business.

She say diseases are the greatest challenge in a farming business.

loans.use: To pay for more poultry birds.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 4 and 3. She has been a farmer for 7 years now. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. They primarily grow rice crops for sale. Erna does her best to help at the farm and take care of their children.

Erna has applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes to be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Delfa

texts.es:
Delfa de 49 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 5 años Delfa se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, aceite, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1300 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea cada vez más grande y tenga productos surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y solventar sus gastos personales.  Delfa es una persona responsable y dedicada que con empeño desea que su negocio crezca para poder seguir ayudando a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
49-year-old Delfa lives with her family in her own home which has water and electricity.  Her home is located in the rural part of Olmos district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

For five years, Delfa has been selling essential household products (milk, oil, toilet paper, tuna, etc) and drinks.  Her business is located in her own home for her safety.  She uses the profits that she makes from selling her products to try and cover all her expenses and improve her family's standard of living.

In order to stock her business, Delfa has requested a loan for 1,300 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise.  Her sole goal is to increase the size of her business and have products in stock to offer her customers so that she can cover her personal expenses.  Delfa is a responsible and committed person who, through her hard work, would like her business to grow so that she can continue helping her family financially.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Benedete

texts.en:
Benedete is 48 years old and is a mixed-crop farmer. She is married to David who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children ages 20 and 15 years old respectively. She has been in this business for the past ten years with the monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig keeping. 

Her hopes and dreams are to concentrate on pig keeping and keep pigs in large amounts, which will help increase the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Prima has been working hard to manage her grocery store, where she sells food to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Prima has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food to stock her shelves, and will help Prima to generate greater profits and provide for her daily needs. Prima hopes that in the future she will be able to own a supermarket. 

Prima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Prima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her shelves,

loans.name: Suesa

texts.en:
Suesa is 56 years old. She is married and has two children. Suesa owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 5 years of experience in this business. 
 
Suesa needs a loan of 2,500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Suesa joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Suesa's eighth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: El Sr. Porfirio es casado con la Sra. Betty  viven en la zona Pampahasi que esta ubicada a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad de La Paz, su ultimo hijo menor trabaja como chofer en el sindicato de la zona, el Sr.  Porfirio se dedica a la costura de botas y botines para mujeres en un pequeño taller que tiene instalado en su casa. Don Porfirio trabajaba en una fábrica donde aprendió a realizar estos calzados y desde hace varios años que ya tiene su propio taller. En este momento don Porfirio no tiene una máquina desvastadora la cual ayuda a desgastar el cuero por los bordes para poder manipular este material al momento de realizar la costura y es de esta manera que solicita este préstamo para poder comprar esta máquina. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es poder ampliar su taller y así de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Sr. Porfirio is married to Sra. Betty. They live in Pampahasi which is located 20 minutes from the city centre of La Paz. His youngest son, who is still a minor, works as a driver for the local union. Sr. Profirio is a cobbler and makes boots and ankle boots for women in a small workshop he has at home. Don Porfirio used to work at a factory where he learned to make these shoes and he has had his own workshop for several years now. At the moment, Don Porfirio does not have a skiver machine which helps to bevel the leather at the edges so that it is easier to handle when making the seams. This is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy a skiver machine. One of his greatest desires is to expand his workshop and be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a skiver machine.

loans.name: Majambere Group

texts.fr:
Libère est un commerçant âgé de 34ans qui habite la localité de Giheta de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (huile et poissons secs appelés « ndagala ») depuis 7 ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fait ses études jusqu'en 6e année primaire. Il est marie a Médiatrice et ont ensemble 3 enfants qui n’ont pas encore commence l’école. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires (huile et ndagala) à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Majambere»
texts.en: Libère is a 34 year old business man who lives in Giheta in the provide of Gitega in the center of Burundi. He has been involved in the buying and selling of food products (oil and dried fish named "ndagala") for the past 7 years, as well as farming. He attend school for six years, until the end of primary school. He is married to Médiatrice and together they have three children who have not yet begun to attend school. He is asking for a loan for 250,000 Burundian francs will allow him to increase his capital in order to purchase large quantities of food products in order to increase his sales. He is a member of the community group "Majambere" and can be seen raising his hand in the photo.

loans.use: increase capital to purchase large quantities of food products (oil and dried fish) for re-sale

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ramón, está integrado por 12 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cuyo objetivo principal es tener un mayor ingreso para poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas quieren, por medio del trabajo en conjunto, poder ir creciendo, cada una en sus actividades, pero también en el grupo. Están muy conformes con el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya.
Un ejemplo de trabajo es la señora Delia, quien desde muy temprano empieza a trabajar preparando los alimentos que vende. Comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que gustan mucho las comidas que hace. Tiene una clientela ya bien formada, lo que se podría decir que constituye ya un ingreso fijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, harina, galleta molida y otros ingredientes esenciales para sus comidas. Ella al igual que sus amigas está muy agradecida por la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
The group called “San Ramón” has 12 women members who are very hardworking and tenacious.  They goal is to earn higher income to help their families.  They want through teamwork to grow in each of their activities but also as a group.  They are in agreement with Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Program.

One example of work is Delia who starts working preparing the meals she sells very early.  She comments that she does very well because the meals she prepares are well liked.  She has a well-formed regular clientele which means a steady income.

She’s asking for the loan to buy meat, vegetables, flour, ground crackers and other ingredients essential for her meals.  She, like her friends, is very grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, flour, groun crackers and others.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina, tiene 65 años de edad, vive con una hija y su nieta.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, fue su mamá quien le enseño este oficio desde la edad de 8 años. Antes Albertina trabajaba en las algodoneras, pero luego se dedico a la venta de tortillas.

Los insumos que necesita, para elaborar las tortillas los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, que esta a treinta y cinco minutos de su vivienda. Albertina solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para invertirlo en la reparación del piso de la cocina y reparar la fuga de agua de su pila, ya que con las inundaciones que sucedieron en octubre su casa quedo dañada, por lo que ahora ella desea hacerle esas reparaciones. Debido a la fuga de agua que tiene la pila, el recibo del agua es muy alto, albertina tiene que bajar hasta la laguna para lavar la ropa y se le dificulta estarse movilizando tanto, por que ya es una señora. Ella lo que desea es mejorar su casa poco a poco, el ponerle piso, repellar las paredes y construir una nueva habitación.
texts.en:
Señora Albertina, aged 65, lives with a daughter and her granddaughter. She is a hard-struggling woman who sells tortillas. It was her mother who taught her this activity when she was 8 years old. Until recently, Albertina was a cotton farmer, but now she sells tortillas. She buys the ingredients in a town in eastern El Salvador, 35 minutes from her home.

Albertina came to the microfinance institution Fundación Campo and applied for a loan to repair her kitchen floor and her water basin which is leaking. In October, the floods damaged her home and Albertina wants to make these repairs. Due to the leakage in her basin, her water bill is very high. Albertina is forced to go down to the lake to wash clothes, but because of her age this is no mean task. She wants to improve her home step by step, making the floor, plastering the walls and building a new room.

loans.use: to repair her kitchen floor and her water basin which is leaking.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana  tiene  treinta y siete años de edad es una señora trabajadora, alegre con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida y ayudar a su familia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de servilletas, manteles le gusta mucho su  negocio ya que tiene mucha creatividad, y también se dedica a la venta de pan vende pan todos los días en la tardes.
También se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, niñas  caballero y dama.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar hilos, aros para tejer, ajugas y manta de colores  y ropa americana.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en: Ana is 37 years old. She is a cheerful and hardworking lady with much drive to succeed in life and help her family. She sells napkins and tablecloths and she enjoys her business because she is very creative. She also sells bread every afternoon. She also sells boys', girls', men's and women's clothing. She requested the loan in order to purchase thread, hoops, needles, colored fabric and American clothing. She thanks the Fundación for the support she has been given in order to get ahead and succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Она занимается выращиванием овощей. Кроме того она сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Parvina lives in the Jilikul district. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She grows vegetables, and also plants fruit trees. She has been involved in this business for ten years. She is requesting a loan for planting wheat.

loans.use: to plant wheat

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри второй раз получает кредит в нашей организации. Она первый кредит использовала на ремонт квартиры, закончив решила получив кредит и купить  мебель. Её сын работает на заводе специалистом информационных систем. Его заработная плата составляет 700 сомони, а так как у Мехри нет мужа (в разводе), он полностью помогает маме в семейных расходах. В том году Мехри выдала дочь замуж, поэтому пока сына не женила, но есть планы в начале весны сыграть свадьбу. Она работает в магазине продавцом, хозяин  платит ей в месяц 600 сомони (123 доллара США), что даёт ей возможность без проблем погасить полученный кредит.
texts.en: This is Mehri's second time obtaining a loan from our organization.  She used the first loan to make repairs to her apartment and, after repaying it, decided to obtain another loan and purchase furniture.  Mehri's son works as an Information Systems Specialist at a factory.  His salary is 700 somoni, and because Mehri does not have a husband (divorced), he fully supports his mother with family expenses.  Because Mehri married off her daughter this year, she has not yet married off her son, but has plans to hold a wedding at the beginning of spring.  Mehri works as a salesperson at a store, and the owner pays her 600 somoni ($123) per month, which gives her an opportunity to repay this loan without any issues.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en: Mrs. Chhang is 47 years old and the mother of three children who lives in the Baray district. She has earned a living by growing rice for many years, and supplements her income by working in a local primary school where she sells biscuits, sweets, snacks and drinks to school children. She is a hard-working mother who is committed to improve her family's life. She is applying for a loan to buy 10 piglets to raise and sell. Her goal is to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is married with 5 children. She is 60 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. Andresa runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4500. She has requested a loan of 14000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Andresa has been a member of PMPC for more than a year.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarorm is 38 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province and she has five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sarorm just started with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sarorm, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Winnie would like to buy 2 high breed grade cows

loans.name: Najm O Den

texts.en: Najm o D. is 24 years old.  He lives with two family members in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a car that allows him to transport stones. He buys stones from big dealers and sells them in the bazaar to construction company. He needs money to repair his truck to secure a contract with a stone dealer. Due to problems with his truck, he can't receive the contract.  Therefore he needs a loan to repair his truck. He is glad that AFS is able to support poor and weak people.

loans.use: to buy stones

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu K. is 26 years old and married with three children.  She runs her small market stall business in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  Assisted by her husband, she sells essential commodities such as sugar, peanut butter, salt, etc.  The young couple plans to expand their business by renting another stall in the market where her husband could participate in the selling of other items.  She is requesting the loan to diversify and expand their business.

loans.use: To diversify her business by expanding to a second market stall

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
A veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine, Yelena was one of the first clients of our Berdyansk loan office in Ukraine. She is a skilled and driven entrepreneur and has opened three new vending facilities in the central market of Berdyansk within the past ten months. Working with her daughter, Yelena sells women’s lingerie and linens. She is organized and a great manager with an excellent reputation among other entrepreneurs.

Currently, Yelena is requesting a loan for $1,000 to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits, Yelena plans to open a new vending facility near the beach, where tourists and high traffic offer an excellent business market.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 49 years old and has a grandson who she looks after and who is also pictured here. His name is Carlos Manuel and he is 5 years old. The name of her small store is “Colmadito Marzia”. There she sells rice, cornmeal, sugar, juice, and soda.

She took out her first loan with Esperanza a year and half ago for 5000 pesos (US$ 150). Now she's on her 4th loan from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other three. The way Esperanza works is that initially small loans are given out and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow larger and larger amounts. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With this loan, Valentina hopes to buy more products for her small store, including meat, such as chicken and pork.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her small grocery store

loans.name: Goka

texts.fr:
Mr Y. Goka is 35 years old and was born in Atsansi Djita. He is a father of six (6) children, and his main work consists of breeding sheep. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of animals, and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $200 for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 35 ans, Monsieur Y. Goka est né à Atsansi Djita. Père de six (6) enfants, il a pour activité principale, l’élevage de moutons. Cette activité très rémunératrice lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, très ambitieux d’avoir un grand nombre de bêtes et de mieux assurer leur sécurité, il voudrais construire un enclos et en acheter d’autres. Mais faute de moyens financiers il vient solliciter $200 pour la réalisation de ce projet. Ce rêve réalisé lui permettra d’avoir un revenu maximum source de l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: Building a farmhouse for animals

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 36-year-old father of 6. He lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Abbass is a mechanic who fixes vehicles and sells auto parts. This is the 5th time Abbass is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He wants to buy new auto parts to continue sustaining and developing his business.

loans.use: To buy auto parts to use in repairing cars and for re-sale

loans.name: Licialan

texts.es:
Señora Licialan belongs to the communal bank called "Cesar Vallejo" located in Calleria, Ucayali. She's 52 years old. She's separated from her husband and has a son who still depends on her financially. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a little business making intimate apparel.

She currently makes purses, shoes for women and teddy bears. She gets up about 6 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her son, and she then goes from house to house selling her home-made products.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase cotton, shoe soles and insoles and thread.

Lucialan is a fortunate woman since she began working with Manuela Ramos. Her business has taken off! Her clientele is growing each day due to her great customer service and the good quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Licialan pertenece al banco comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en el Jr Tomas Romero 159, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es separada y madre de un hijo que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de confección de ropa interior. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de peluches, carteras, zapatos para damas. Se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y después se dedica a realizar su trabajo ya que a diario entrega los pedidos a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de algodón, suelas y plantillas para zapatos e hilos. Licialan es una mujer muy afortunada, desde que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos todo le va bien, su negocio está yendo por muy buen camino, sus clientes aumentan cada día por el buen trato y la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase cotton in bulk, shoe soles and insoles and thread

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
S. Zarrina is 24 years old. She is married with two children. 

Zarrina is selling towels and tablecloths. The trading place is located in the one of the markets. The husband of Zarrina is currently unemployed, and Zarrina has to work hard as her business is the only source of income for her family. Now Zarrina needs to increase the range of goods and purchase more towels and tablecloths for selling. For this purpose, she requests 600.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Zarrina thanks everyone for support and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing towels and tablecloths for selling

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives on Street A in the Llojeta Bajo zone of the city of La Paz.

She lives with her son, who works as a bus driver. She runs a general store from her home, where she has worked for several years tending to customers in the area.

The loan that Martha now seeks would be invested in purchasing merchandise for her business and, in that way, she would be able to offer a greater variety of products and increase her earnings.

Martha has been an IMPRO client since 2002. The financial evaluation conducted qualifies her to obtain credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha vive en la calle A de la zona de Llojeta Bajo de la cuidad de la Paz. Vive junto a su hijo el cual trabaja como conductor de minibús. Ella posee una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propio domicilio donde trabaja por varios años atendiendo a los clientes de su zona. El crédito que ahora Martha solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Martha es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Hai Arapi 2044-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret P.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children ranging from age 12 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Margret is joined in her small group by Agnes P., Esther G., Margret A. , and Madelina M.. Agnes P. has a bar business and wants to expand her bar. Esther G. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to expand the hotel. Margret A. operates a business of making tea and wants to expand the business. Madelina M. is currently in the business of selling alcohol and is requesting a loan to educate her children.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul R. is 49 years old. Her husband is a driver. Together they are raising four children. Ugul sells clothes and shoes for kids in the central local market. She has been in this business for more then 10 years.

Ugul's business is very stable which allows her to improve the level of living conditions of her family. With the income from her business, Ugul managed to repair her house as she is planning to arrange the marriage of her son. That’s why she needs to expand her business and increase her working capital to purchase new summer clothes and shoes for kids. Ugul requests US$600 for this purpose. She is promising to repay the loan within 12 months. She thanks everybody who is supporting her. She says that your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchase new children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Movimiento De Mujeres Amistad Group

texts.en:
Monise I. Pierre is a young and ambitious Dominican women who came to Esperanza with a dream and a plan to accomplish her vision. A single woman at age 22, Monise finds her inspiration for day-to-day activities fueled by her dream of one day becoming a doctor. Right now, she travels each Thursday to the nearby city of Santiago to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and blouses to sell in the streets of her local community, Amistad, which means friendship. Monise plans to continue selling clothes in the afternoon while she attends school in the mornings.

Monise I. is just one member of the 15-person micro-bank, Movimiento Mujeres de Amistad, which means Women's Movement for Friendship. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. Many of the women in this bank have businesses similar to Monise’s, selling clothing in the streets, while several others sell vegetables in the street, and some even maintain a personal hair salon.

On behalf of Monise, the Movimiento Group Bank, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, shirts, skirts, pants, and undergarments

loans.name: Son

texts.vi:
As Mr. Son’s family doesn’t have enough space for agricultural activities, they make a living by working for people in the area. However, his oldest son is incapable of working due to his mental illness; his wife feels so despaired that she often leaves home. Mr. Son’s mother thus has to take the responsibility to raise his young daughter (her name is Xuan Mai). The family doesn’t have financial resources to send the oldest son to hospital. Since their income is only about 13.000.000 VND (around $800) per year even though all three people are working hard, they don’t have sufficient capital to invest in breeding poultries. Therefore, Mr. Son wishes for a loan of $75 so that they can buy chickens and breed them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình không có đất canh tác ( Chỉ có 700 m2 ) chủ yếu sống vào nghề làm thuê quanh năm. Đứa con trai lớn không thể làm gì vì bị bệnh thần kinh, do con trai bị bệnh nên vợ chán nản thường bỏ nhà đi, nên bà nội phải nuôi thêm đứa cháu ( Xuân Mai ) từ lúc mới sinh đến nay. Hiện tại gia đình cũng không có tiền để lo thuốc thang cho đứa con trai bị thần kinh đi trị bệnh. Nhà có 3 người đi làm thuê nhưng thu nhập cả năm cũng chỉ được gần 13 triệu. Hiện nay gia đình chúng tôi muốn phát triển chăn nuôi nhưng thiếu vốn. Rất mong sự quan tâm của dự án về tài chính để chúng tôi nuôi gà. Gia đình có 4 người con thì 1 cháu lớn bị bệnh thần kinh.

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Clarita

texts.es:
Claria is 20 years old. She lives with her partner and she has a 7 month old daughter. She finished primary school completely, and is from Parcialidad de Huayllaphujo – Mazocruz. She lives in Avenue Tacna s/n.

She has worked with the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez for one year. With her first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she was able to buy 5 cans of gas that she later sold. She was able to increase her capital and changed her business to buying livestock, alpacas, llamas, lambs, and pig fattening.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will by 6 alpacas in order to fatten and later sell them.

Each alpaca costs S/. 130.00 Nuevos Soles. Her goal is to have her own house in Mazocruz and to install a tap in order to sell gas, and that her daughter studies and becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Clarita cumplió 20 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de siete meses, estudió primaria completa, natural de la Parcialidad de Huayllaphujo – Mazocruz, vive en la Av. Tacna s/n. Trabaja con el Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez hace un año, con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 05 latas de petróleo para su posterior venta, conforme fue aumentando su capital cambió de negocio a la compra de ganado, alpacas, llamas, corderos en pie y engorde de porcinos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 06 alpacas cada alpaca cuesta S/. 130.00 Nuevos Soles para engorde y luego vender. Su meta es tener su casa propia en Mazocruz e instalar un grifo para vender combustible, que su hija estudie y sea profesional.

loans.use: To buy alpacas

loans.name: Amina's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old and married with 5 children between 14 and 1 year old. She has been a snacks and clothes seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 6.30AM to 6.30PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Amina is now looking for a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with a salon, soap sales and snacks sales.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch S., age 44, is married and lives with two of her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has been selling Khmer cake to earn a living and is able to make $3 each day. Her husband, Huy Rin, 45, is a construction foreman. On average, he makes $7 per day. This couple also gets support from their children who work, one in garment factory and another as a construction worker building houses.

Touch S. would like to borrow $1100 to purchase a motorbike for her husband and her children to commute to work. This will reduce the daily expenses that her family members spend on motor-taxis. 

Mrs. Touch's husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. C. M. es unpequeño productor socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza, junto a sus 2 hijos mayores se dedica a la produccion de arroz en 12 Mzs por esfuerzo propio, 2 niños estan en 3ero y 4to grado de primaria; durante la cosecha presenta problemas con el trillado de su produccion, lo que le reduce sus ingresos familiares, a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio de un trillo de arroz para lo cual solicita el presente financiamiento; su mayor anhelo es integrar esta sociedad, ya que le permitria vender mejor su cosecha y mantener en mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. C. M. is a small-time farmer and member of the La Esperanza (Hope) village bank cooperative. Together with his two older children, they grow rice on 12 blocks of their own land. Two of his children are in 3rd and 4th grade respectively of elementary school. During harvest times, he has problems with threshing which reduces his family income. Through the cooperative, he has the opportunity as a member to use a rice threshing machine but in order to do so, he needs this loan. His great desire is to become a full-fledged member of this cooperative which will help him to sell more of his harvest and improve the living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% to the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: I Ketut Sada

texts.id: I Ketut Sada memiliki lahan seluas 1 hektar. Seluruh lahan yang dimilikinya ditanami dengan padi, karena pengairan yang cukup memadai sepanjang tahun. Selama 1 tahun, tanaman padi bisa dipanen sebanyak 3 kali. Sebelumnya, I Ketut Sada menanam padi dengan bibit jenis lokal karena harganya yang lebih murah. Namun, keuntungan yang didapatnya tidak maksimal, karena bibit jenis lokal mudah terserang penyakit. Dalam satu kali panen ( 4 bulan ), ia hanya mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000.- setelah dikurangi semua biaya untuk pengolahan tanah dan perawatan tanaman. Hal itu dirasakan belum mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, apalagi dengan kondisi ekonomi saat ini. Karena ingin meningkatkan taraf hidupnya dan keluarganya, I Ketut Sada mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari sebesar Rp. 6.000.000.- Pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit padi kwalitas unggul sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.-, biaya pengolahan tanah dengan menyewa pekerja sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- dan membeli pupuk serta anti hama sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- I Ketut Sada sudah belajar dengan petani yang sudah lebih dulu menggunakan bibit kwalitas unggul sehingga ia tidak ragu untuk mendapat pinjaman, karena sesuai dengan kenyataan, bibit padi kwalitas unggul mampu menghasilkan hingga 3 kali lipat dibanding dengan bibit jenis lokal. Satu kali panen, bibit unggul bisa mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000.- hingga Rp. 2.000.000.- Dengan terus didampingi oleh staf Dinari dan petani padi yang telah sukses dengan bibit padi kwalitas unggul, I Ketut Sada optimis yakin usahanya akan sukses.
texts.en:
I Ketut Sada owns a land of 1 hectare (around 2.5 acres). Due to his land does not have a proper irrigation system, he uses his whole land for paddy farming. He can harvests his paddy farming 3 times a year. He used local paddy seeds in the past because they were cheaper. However he was not able to get a good result out of it. In one harvest season (around 4 month period) he can only get a profit of IDR 500 thousand (around USD 45). That was certainly not enough to make a living especially in this current economic condition.

He applied for a loan from Dinari foundation for an amount of IDR 6 million (around USD 550). He used IDR 3 million (USD 275) to buy high quality paddy seeds, another IDR 1 million (USD 92) was spent for hiring some men to clear and work the land, and IDR 2 million (USD 183) to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

I Ketut Sada has learned from senior farmers in farming with high quality seeds, hence he is confidence he can succeed this time.
