He can triple his revenue using this quality seeds, so instead of having a profit of UD 45 per harvest seasons, he can earn up to USD 135 - USD 180/ harvest season. I Ketut Sada is also going to be guided by Dinari Foundation's field instructor, so he is confident that he will succeed this time around.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: High quality paddy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La joven Karla Vanessa de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, trabaja como profesora de primaria desde hace 7 años en El Ayote, viajando a Santo Domingo los fines de semana para ver a su pequeño, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años estudiando el 4to grado de primaria, su mamá le cuida al niño, está solicitando su 7mo credito el que utilizara para construir una cocina, ademas hacer arranques para un cuarto y levantar las paredes hasta donde pueda.  Karla ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus 6 creditos anteriores, manifiesta que le han servido de mucho y quiere darle mejores condiciones a su hijo, ya que es un varoncito y necesita privacidad.  Karla a pesar de ser una joven soltera con esfuerzo propio y sin ayuda de nadie mas que los creditos otorgados por AFODENIC, se ha planteado siempre mantener su record  crediticio para continuar trabajando de la mano con esta institucion que es la unica que le ayuda a los asalariados.
texts.en:
Karla is 31 years old, single mother and has been working as a teacher in elementary school for the past 7 years. She works in El Ayote, traveling to the Dominican Republic on weekends to see his son who is 8 years old. His son is in 4th year of primary school. Her mother takes care of her son. She is requesting her 7th loan which she will use to build a kitchen and make some space in her room. Karla has been paying off her loans on time and she shares that these loans have been very helpful in the past. She wishes to improve her living and give her son the privacy he deserves. Even though Karla is very young, she is very responsible and has maintained her integrity in paying off these loans on time.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of a kitchen and walls in her home

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
A sus 39 años Edith mantiene su hogar y a sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos todavía menores de edad, a través de varios negocios. Según la temporada se dedica a diversas tareas. En época de clases, ella vende útiles escolares en un quiosco que tiene en el patio de recreo del colegio. Asimismo, alquila un puesto en el mercado de Chosica donde vende también ropa, juguetes y maquillaje.

Además, Edith se beneficia de una chacra gracias a la cual puede dedicarse al comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Lima, teniendo así otra entrada de dinero adicional.

Después de 3 años en el programa de micro créditos de EDAPROSPO, ya puede planear un futuro más seguro. Con su esposo, tiene planificado usar los préstamos para construir tres locales en un terreno cerca de su casa, dos para alquilar, y uno para que ella pueda seguir vendiendo los útiles escolares y demás productos.
texts.en:
At the age of 39, Edith supports her home and her 4 children, 2 of which are young, through various businesses. According to the season, she dedicates herself to different jobs. In this time period of classes, she sells school writing materials in a kiosk that she has in the playground of the school. At the same time, she rents a stand in the Chosica market, where she also sells clothing, toys, and make-up. In addition, Edith benefits from a farm, thanks to which she can dedicate herself to selling fruits and vegetables in the market in Lima, in this way getting another source of additional income. After 3 years in the EDAPROSPO micro-credit program, she can already plan for a more secure future. With her husband, she has planned to use the loans to build 3 stores on the land near her house, 2 of which are to rent, and 1 so that Edith can continue selling school writing materials and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct 3 buildings

loans.name: Mouamar

texts.en:
Mouamar is a 35-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mouamar has been working as a carpenter since 2001. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase wood for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his work.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Холмуминов Баходур житель города Турсун-заде. Женат и имеет троих детей. Возраст 36 лет. Занимается животноводством уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 15 месмяцев. Использовать кредит планирует для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему улучшить положение бизнеса и получить дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Bahodur H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is married and has three children. He is 36 years old. He does animal husbandry for already ten years. He plans to use the loan to increase the headcount of cattle. This will help him improve his business and get additional income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Q. is 46 years old. She is married with three children, all of whom are currently in school. One is in senior high school while others are in the junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast, in the Central Region of Ghana.

She works to support her husband financially. Esther is a trader. She deals in the palm oil production business. She procures palm nuts from nearby communities where palm fruits are readily available and cost effective. She says she supplies the greater percentage of the oil she produces to retailers who come from the big cities. She also sells to food vendors. Esther has been in the palm oil production business for five years. She wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk.

loans.use: Procure palm nuts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
“We must first seek the Lord’s guidance before starting another day of struggle.” This is something that Mercy R. has kept in mind since her childhood. She is now 50 years old, married to her husband Ricardo, and is blessed with one child. The couple lives happily in Barangay Lantap Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya.

Mercy is a vegetable vendor in the public market. Sometimes, when she has excess products, she sells them in their village at retail prices. Her husband works as a farmer and plants rice, sweet potatoes, and vegetables which she also sells. Their income is being used to satisfy their basic needs and sometimes gives financial support to their child who is already married. Thinking about their future, Mercy is planning to increase her merchandise, and for her to do this, she is now requesting to borrow a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP that she can use as additional capital.

loans.use: To build capital for her vegetable farming and selling business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She sells clothing at a department store in Ordzhonikidze city. She has been in this business for one year and her profit is 2,000 UAH per month.

Her goal is to develop her business and make it a stable source of income. Olga would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to buy a greater assortment of clothing. She hopes to increase her sales and develop her business further.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Fareuda Group

texts.en:
Fareuda is the leader of this group of three members. The group would like to take out a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghani, and they have the following business improvement goals:

- Fareuda wants to obtain a loan for her husband's spare-parts car shop.

- Naiada would like to receive a loan on behalf of her brother, who is a taxi driver.

- Zheu Gul is requesting a loan for the business use of her husband, who is also a taxi driver.

All the group members express their grateful admiration for this process.

loans.use: For business improvement and expansion

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Clara M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 4 children, between the ages of 19 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because they are orphans. 

Clara has been running a stationery business since 2008. Stationery sales is a business in which micro-entrepreneurs demonstrate their business savvy, with most sellers placing their shops, stalls, or tables strategically close to post offices, banks, schools and universities. Shops usually sell a variety of items from pens to books to candy (especially if the shop is nearby a school).

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Clara currently earns about 70 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stationery items in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another stationery shop. Clara thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stationery items in bulk.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah K. is 30 years old. She is an unmarried young woman. Hannah has been selling eggs for the past five years. She obtains her supply of eggs from farming communities and supplies them to her customers in Accra. Hannah’s customers are mostly food vendors and people who retail to other customers. She wants to use her loan to buy stocks of eggs to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to add the sale of tomatoes, which she believes, will give her additional income.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos; Kety de 28 y Wilfredo de 19 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, negocio en el cual vierte todo su tiempo, ya que al estar su esposo de viaje por trabajo y sus hijos ya mayores, su mayor distracción es su negocio. Doris recibe pedidos de sus vecinos, colegios, y otros, los cuales recurren a su buen gusto para obtener las prendas deseadas, puesto que ella tiene un gran paciencia para elaborar dichas prendas mucho esmero y cariño, teniendo como resultado buenas ventas. Pero este trabajo requiere de mucha precisión, ya que elabora patrones ya determinados y buena vista para realizar la costura. Para un futuro cercano, Doris quiere tener un taller textil muy grande para contratar a más gente que la ayude. Ella se encuentra en su noveno préstamo grupal y siempre le ha ido muy bien trabajando con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ya que siempre fue muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tela para cumplir con el pedido de buzos que le hicieron de un colegio de un distrito aledaño.
texts.en:
Doris is a very hard working woman who is 50-years old. She lives with her husband and children: Kety (28-years old) and Wilfredo (19-years old) in their own home. For the last (3) three years she has dedicated herself to sewing clothing. The business takes up all her time as her husband travels for work and her children are older, so she is mostly busy with work.

Doris receives orders from her neighbors, colleagues and others who rely on her good taste to obtain the clothes they want. Because she has great patience to work with the garments, taking great care and love for the work it results in strong sales. The work requires much precision to create a certain pattern with a keen eye for sewing.

For the near future, Doris wants to have a large textile workshop to contract large with more people. She is requesting her ninth loan with the group and always has worked well with the microfinance group PRISMA as she is always punctual with her debt. The funds will be invested in the purchase of fabric for a neighboring school in the district.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y., a rice grower and mother of five children, is 44 years old and wishes to have a stable income from her farm that can provide for all of her family's needs including food, clothing, and education.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy one sack of seeds and one quart of herbicides and fertilizers. She thinks that these purchases will eventually result in an abundant harvest and increased family income.

Now, in addition to growing rice, she is starting to raise ducks and is very pleased with the services of CEVI and wishes to avail loans in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of seeds and a quart of herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Victoria Eva

texts.es:
La señora VICTORIA EVA L. V.  V. D. S., tiene 63 años, vive en el distrito D. Larco , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANANTIAL D. VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria , tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depenD. económicamente D. ella ya que se encuentra estudiando  Estomatología en la Universidad.
VICTORIA se dedica a la preparación y venta D. tamales (comida D. la zona).
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos como: harina, mantequilla , aceituna, etc
Este crédito D. 700 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas productos para  preparar sus tamales, como aceitunas, mantequilla, harina.
Pero actualmente se encuentra descansando ya que estuvo internada en el hospital por problemas D. bronquios y asma.
VICTORIA sueña con obtener más capital y asociarse con su sobrino y dedicarse a la confección D. buzos escolares ya que él gano una licitación para la fabricación D. buzos escolares 2010.

loans.use: compra de productos para  preparar sus tamales (comida de la zona)

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Cet homme fait un commerce assez particulier mais qui lui est très rentable ; il rachète des voitures abandonnées auprès des mécaniciens et en profite pour vendre des pièces détachées. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2003 à Lomé dans le quartier d’Akodessewa. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il fait souvent des tours dans plusieurs garages de la capitale pour s’approvisionner en voitures d’occasions. C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un prêt de WAGES  pour acheter 03 voitures d’occasions. Il dispose d’une clientèle qui lui est fidèle.
texts.en:
This is a man who has a fairly unusual business, and it's very profitable for him:  he buys back old abandoned cars from mechanics and makes the best of them by selling the parts.  He started this business in 2003 in Lomé in the Akodessewa district.  It enables him to provide for his family.  He often makes a circuit of several garages in the capital to supply himself with used cars.  For this reason, he' requesting a WAGES loan to buy three use cars.  He has a loyal customer base. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three used cars

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
Facunda tiene 63 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su menor hijo Yhon de 12 años, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios. El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de fibra de ovino, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que sus clientes saben que la calidad de fibra que encontrarán es muy buena y además obtendrán un precio muy cómodo. Lo que más le gusta a Facunda de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarlos en su compra, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su puesto sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y poder tener una tienda más grande, la cual le genere mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el tercer préstamo de Facunda con MFP, se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que pone en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fibra de ovino para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Kouatonou

texts.fr: Née vers 1979 au Bénin, A. Kouatonou est originaire de Ganvié, village lacustre situé au Sud du Bénin. Kouatonou n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle exerce comme activité la vente de poissons congelés. Kouatonou achète les poissons frais qu’elle conserve et les revend aux vendeuses de poissons fumés. Pour accroître le niveau de son activité et satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Kouatonou sollicite un prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kouatonou A., born around 1979 in Benin, is from Ganvié, a lakeside village in southern Benin. She never attended school nor learnt a trade. She is married and the mother of three children. Kouatonou sells frozen fish. She buys fresh fish, deep-freezes them and then sells them to traders of smoked fish. To bolster her business and satisfy the ever increasing demand from her clientele, she applies to Alidé for a loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel V. F. reside en el departamento de La Libertad con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad ambos estudiantes. Maribel se ha ingeniado mucho para emprender su negocio, ella posee una receta familiar de exquisitas quesadillas las cuales realiza de manera artesanal en un horno rustico, son dieciséis años de experiencia los que Maribel ha dedicado a su negocio  y por ello que su negocio es muy conocido en la zona, el deseo de Maribel quien solicita de este crédito es para compra mayor cantidad de materia prima y nuevas mesas en las cuales ella pone su productos para vender.
texts.en:
Maribel V. F. lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband and two children, who are students ages 17 and 11. She managed to establish a business around a family recipe for quesadillas*, which she produces by hand using a rustic oven. Maribel has been dedicated to her business for 16 years and has become well known in the area. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in bulk as well as tables on which she can prepare her products for sale. (*Unlike the Mexican snack of the same name, the Salvadoran quesadilla is a rich, sweet dessert cake often found in local bakeries. The "queso" in quesadilla is traditionally unsalted Salvadoran queso fresco, a fresh farmers-type cheese.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk & tables for her workspace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing manure

loans.name: Suivaaia

texts.en:
Suivaaia Lui is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Asau. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Suivaaia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks in the local community. Suivaaia has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 190 WST a month from these activities. In 2008, Suivaaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Suivaaia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Suivaaia is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Suivaaia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa D. A. es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de tres hijas mayores de edad y se dedica a la venta de comida en el puerto de Yarina Cocha. 
Forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace siete años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò implementos como mesas, sillas, manteles, cocina a carbón, etc. 
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 2500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà bebidas al por mayor para implementar su negocio. 
La meta de Teresa es tener una distribuidora de bebidas y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa D. A., 42, is an enthusiastic, enterprising woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has three adult daughters and she sells prepared meals in the Yarina Cocha port. She has been a member of the "Las Fresitas" communal bank for the last 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she used it to buy such things as tables, chairs, tablecloths, a coal stove, etc. Currently, she needs 2500 new soles with which to buy beverages at wholesale to stock her business. Teresa's goal is to be a beverage distributor and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale beverages.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala N. is a 47 years old school teacher and sheep breeder in the small village of Imishli.  She is married and has one adorable daughter.  Kamala works long hours to help cover her family's needs. 

Once every two week her husband takes her sheep to the central livestock bazaar to sell them.  Kamala needs additional funds to increase her income, to save enough money to send her daughter to college.

loans.use: Purchase 12 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en: Consorcia B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 50 years old. Consorcia is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Consorcia sells lumber in the local community. Consorcia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business. In 2009, Consorcia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consorcia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Consorcia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Consorcia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Tsevelmaa is 46 years old and lives with her two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two children, between the ages of 19 and 23, are students. Tsevelmaa operates a clothing business out of a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 1999 and her business progressed over the years.  She sells a variety of clothes such as pants, jackets, boots, shirts etc.  Now her working capital has reached 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). She is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good business sense and accounting skills. For the future, she is planning to expand her business and widen her product line. She says, “All I want is to be able to afford my children's education and help them to be better citizens.” Tsevelmaa is requesting an 800,000-tugrug loan in order to purchase more apparel from China.

loans.use: To purchase more apparel from China.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Aurelia R. es cliente antigua de nuestra empresa está casado con 
el Sr. Francisco Arriola son padres de cinco hijos, están domiciliados en el 
km 9 lado Acaray de Ciudad del Este.

La Señora se dedica a la compra de ropas y calzados para su posterior venta en la
 Ciudad de Saltos del Guaira, y el Sr Francisco se dedica a  venta de gallinas
 en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, poseen un vehículo en la cual hacen la 
distribución, se trata de personas muy trabajadora, lo reflejan con cada crédito 
cancelado con la Fundación Paraguaya, el crédito es para la compra de 
mercaderías, como uniformes de todo tipo ya que están comenzando las clase y
 quieren aprovechar la ocasión para la venta de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a former client of ours. She is married to Francisco and they are the parents of five children. They live on the “9 kilometer” side of Acaray in the City of Este. She buys and sells shoes and clothing in the City of Saltos del Guaira and Francisco sells chickens in the City of Coronel Oviedo. They have a vehicle which they use to make deliveries. They are hard working people, as evidenced by all of the previous repaid loans through Fundación Paraguaya. They will use the money from this loan to buy additional merchandise for resale, such as school uniforms of all types. They would like to take advantage of the fact that the school year has begun, in order to sell their merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de uniformes escolares como polleras, camisas blancas y celestes, medias,pantalones.

loans.name: Realiza

texts.en:
Realiza G., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Romeo G., a businessman, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own meat shop for quite some time now.

Realiza has been a regular member of Kiva field partner the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends CCT's weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.  Because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her meat shop business, she has consistently been able to pay her dues at CCT.

Now she has applied for a 14,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used to buy pigs to be slaughtered and sold to her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can better provide for her children’s education. She also wants to have a bigger stall from which to sell her products.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buying pigs for slaughter and sale at a butcher shop.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is 37 years old, married, and has three children, the eldest of whom is 12 years old. Her children all attend school and this makes her happy. Victoria's husband is a laundry man and he also supports their home.
Victoria owns a beauty salon where she creates lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair and beauty accessories, shoes and bags. She has a good relationship with Kiva partner, LAPO, and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beauty accessories, bags and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty accessories, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Elpidia

texts.en: “My loans from CEVI helped a lot in sustaining my business”, shares Elpidia, of her hog-raising business. She says that it also helped her sustain her three children’s education. She thanks God that she was able to gain access to the MFI’s program. She hopes for her business to be bigger. She is now requesting for a loan of PHP12,000. She will use it to buy additional piglets and feed. This loan will truly help Elpidia reach her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional piglets.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 27 years old and married with one child. He owns a motorcycle, which he uses for a transportation business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. This is his only source of income and thanks to it, he has been able to meet his family's expenses. 

He saves his income with his group in Faulu Kenya called Nuru Investments, which guarantees loans to its members. Benard is a hardworking man who spends most of his days working. His biggest wish is to get ahead and to have a more stable job so that he can have more income that will allow him a better quality of life.  

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
“El banco comunal Virgen del Rosario del Cusco D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la  Asociación Arariwa está en el ciclo 12 D. funcionamiento”.

Felicia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”  somos 13 integrantes (12 mujeres y 1 varón). Las reuniones  son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa seD. Cusco y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi principal actividad económica.  

Felicia, tiene 47 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos y su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el paradero final D. los expresos “Columbia” en la calle los Incas D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella venD. desayuno D. forma ambulatoria desD. hace 26 años y se levanta  a las 4 D. mañana para preparar el desayuno y sale a vender D. 7 a 10 D. la mañana. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender productos D. belleza.   Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos D. belleza para mujer como por ejemplo aretes, perfumes, colonias, collares, lápiz labial, etc.     

La mayoría D. los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo algunos se dedican a la  venta D. comida, anticuchos, tejidos y bordados, comestibles,  joyería y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo D. chofer D. taxi y empleados. 
	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.
texts.en:
Felicia tells us, “We have 13 members (12 women and 1 man) in our communal bank, Virgen del Rosario del Cusco. Our meetings are every 30 days in the central office of the Asociació Arariwa headquarters in Cusco. They elected me to represent the communal bank in order to tell about my main economic activity.” Felicia, age 47, is a widow with two children. Her main economic activity is selling food at the final stop of the Columbia express train. It is on Los Incas Street in the city of Cusco. She has been selling breakfast as a street vendor for 26 years. She gets up at four in the morning to prepare the breakfast, and she leave to sell from seven to ten in the morning. Her supplemental economic activity is selling beauty products. She needs the loan to buy more women’s beauty products like earrings, perfume, cologne, necklaces, and lipstick, etc. Most of the members are merchants. For example some of them sell food, kebabs, weavings and embroidery, groceries, and jewelry. Other members offer services such as taxi drivers or work as employees. Cusco is a city characterized by its archeological centers, its historical center, its scenery, and its history. It is an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Felicia needs the loan to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita S. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Isabelita is married and has  four school-aged children. To make a living, Isabelita owns and operates a food stall selling specialty food products in the local community. Isabelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Isabelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional raw materials, ingredients and working capital. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Isabelita's second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

NOTE: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro C. de 45 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus dos pequeñas hijas de 4 y 6 años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Pedro es un señor muy trabajador el cual realiza un enorme esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y brindarle a su familia todo lo necesario, él se dedica a la venta de agua embotellada, jugos y bebidas gaseosas, las cuales comercializa en zonas de mucho comercio en el centro de Soyapango. A lo largo del día Pedro se mueve a diferentes lugares como las afueras de centros comerciales, mercados y colegios para poder vender las bebidas que ofrece, todo depende de la hora y el mejor momento para que él decida a donde colocarse con sus ventas. Pedro solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar sodas, agua y jugos, por mayor, así mismo comprar una hielera bastante grande para colocar las bebidas y así mismo comprar hielo para mantener helado sus productos, a pesar que Pedro posee un negocio muy humilde, el logra obtener ganancias bastante aceptables para su familia, razón por la cual se esfuerza tanto moviéndose de un lado a otro, con el fin de poder tener más ganancias y de esta forma sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro C. is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango. He lives with his wife, who works in the home, and his two small daughters, 4 and 6 years old respectively, who are both studying. Pedro is a hard-working man who puts for a great effort to provide for his family and improve his life. He works selling bottled water, juices, and sodas, which he sells in the heavily trafficked areas in the center of Soyapango. During the course of the day Pedro sells in different locations like the areas outside of malls, markets, and high schools depending on the best time to sell his products. Pedro is applying for the loan in order to buy the products he sells wholesale as well as a cooler big enough to put all his drinks inside and ice. Even though Pedro has a very humble job he is able to earn enough to support his family. This is why he works so hard moving from location to location in order to earn more money and provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bottled water and other drinks

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en:
Josepha was born in 1971 and is married with four children.Josepha's husband helps her in order to serve their customers on time. This business is profitable because in her place of residence there are many people who need cakes, especially during the morning. Josepha has an experience of 3 years in this business. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 to 8 in the morning and during the evening from 5 PM to 9 PM every day.

Josepha is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more sacks of flour which will allow her to make more cakes for her customers. When she makes more cakes, Josepha will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings & Credit B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Benard R.'s main source of livelihood for the past 10 years has been selling produce and foodstuffs in Bugongi, Kihihi town. It is with earnings from this business that the hardworking Benard R. has managed to sustain his family of 13 children. The 48-year-old dynamic businessman has reached a point where profits accruing to his business now amount to 300,000 Ugandan shillings in a month. With steadying progress in building his small enterprise, he reckons his future prospects are rising every passing day.

With a loan coming his way, he carries conviction that he will be able to buy more cash-crops produce like maize, cassava, peanuts, beans and rice, so that he does not run short of stock and supplies. This will improve his sales revenue and enable him to live a self-sustaining life as he looks at educating his children and they become important people who can support themselves in future.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of maize, cassava, peanuts, beans and rice for the business

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut P. is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this ten-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Usaha (PK-10239). Ni Ketut is married and has one school-aged child. Ni Ketut owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,300,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Ni Ketut is now requesting a new loan of 1,300,000 IDR which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut P. (0) merupakan 27 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Usaha (PK-10239). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,300,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,300,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy E. is single and has received junior high school education. She sells jewelry and ladies’ wear at Takoradi and uses her income to pay her utility bills.

Lucy will use the loan she hopes to receive to purchase more panties and jeans to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more panties and jeans to sell

loans.name: Vasya

texts.en:
Vasya is married and a small entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, where he owns a business selling fishing supplies in the local wholesale market. He started this business because he loves fishing and is an experienced fisherman. Vasya’s merchandise is unique in the marketplace where he works, which draws many customers to his vending kiosk. Low competition and lending assistance have helped Vasya’s business develop and keep a stable standing. In the last four years his enterprise grew to 70,000 Grivnyas in inventory and 7,000 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Vasya is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital and sales as a result. One of the outstanding characteristics of his venture is its stability and consistent growth. Vasya hopes that this loan will help him to keep his business running and extend it even further. One of Vasya’s future goals is to open one more vending kiosk.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Rose Jepkoech

texts.en:
Rose Jepkoech L. is 37 years old. She is married to Peter Rono, a driver, and they have three children, aged 18 years, 12 years, and 8 years respectively. They live in Mailinne, 6km from Eldoret town. Rose has a general store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past four years with an income of Kshs.30,000 ke per month.

Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for a third loan of Kshs 90,000 with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more bags of sugar, boxes of cooking oil, boxes of bathing soap and a few other items that are missing from her stock of goods. 

She hopes that the monthly income will allow her to operate a wholesale store in the near future. She wants to give her kids the best education available.

loans.use: Purchase more sugar, cooking oil, and bathing soap

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio es una joven muy emprendedor tiene 27 años. El se dedica a la venta de accesorios de celulares, recargas y reparación de celulares. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, el tiene varios clientes que circulan por su negocio el ofrece muy buenos servicios y también le proporciona a sus clientes el mejor precio, por lo que es joven lleno de vida y con muchas esperanzas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito y lo solicita para la compra de accesorios, carcasas, recargas y teléfonos nuevos para ofrecer a la variedad de clientes que posee.
texts.en: Marco Antonio is a very enterprising young man.  He is 27 years old, and makes a living selling cell phone accessories and refill cards and repairing cell phones.  His business is located outside the market.  Marco Antonio’s customers come to him because his business offers them a very good service and a better price, and so he makes a living this way and has high hopes of improving his quality of life.  This is Marco Antonio's first loan, and he is requesting it in order to purchase cell phone accessories, cases, refill cards, and new telephones so that he can offer these to his customers.

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing cell phone accessories, cases, refill cards, and new phones

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Estela F. is 54 years of age, married and blessed with five children who are now adults and have their own families. She is from Bangkal within the barangay of Aguada, a part of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Estela runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been in business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Her husband also contributes support for the family.

In 2009 Estela joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. As an active member of PMPC under the regular loan program, Estela successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 8,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, advancing her children’s education and possibly expanding her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Salomao Jose

texts.pt:
Salomão José Alfredo D. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo sul de Moçambique, é pai de três filhos de 13 aos 21 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ele em sua casa.

Saiu de Namaacha após concluir o ensino médio (12ªclasse) e faz um curso de professorado durante 3 anos (tempo regular) após concluir é afeto primeiramente em Maputo onde trabalhou durante 9 anos. Devido a doença da sua mãe, ele pede uma transferência para o Distrito de Namaacha para dar assistência a sua mãe. E funcionário permanente a mais de 27 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor de 4.300.00m que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).

Ja teve empréstimos (25.000.00mt e 50.000.00mt) no BIM (Banco Internacional de Moçambique) para dar início da sua obra e pagou sem nenhum problema. Mas não conseguiu concluir devido ao elevado custo de material, assim aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando o segundo empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt para comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, tintas e outros) para dar continuidade da obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 12.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade.
Esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer um estaleiro aumentando a sua renda familiar pôs a sua esposa não trabalha.
texts.en:
Salomão José Alfredo D. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  He has three children, ages 13 to 21, and all of them go to school.  He lives in his own house and takes care of his niece, who also lives in his house.

Salomão left Namaacha after finishing high school and took a three-year (full-time) teaching course.  After finishing this, he was employed mainly in Maputo, where he worked for nine years.  Because his mother became ill, he asked for a transfer to Namaacha District to help her.  He has been a permanent employee for more than 27 years, earning 4,300 meticais monthly.  He uses this money for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Salomão had loans (25,000 meticais and 50,000 meticais) at BIM (International Bank of Mozambique) to begin building his house, and he paid them back with no problems.  But he was not able to finish the work because of rising costs for materials, so he approached Hluvuku asking for a second loan of 17,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, stone, paints, etc.) to continue the work.  His first Hluvuku loan was for 12,000 meticais, and was used for the same purpose.

He is confident that he will pay the loan off with no problems, and he will ask for another loan to build a kiosk to increase his family's income since his wife does not work.

loans.use: Construction materials (cement, stone, paints, etc.)

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a married man with three children; two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

He operates a video show in a shop, neighbours being his potential customers. Andrew faces a major challenge of poor ventilation in his video room leading to complaints from customers while watching movies. He hopes to have a projector to use in watching international football to win more customers in the future.

Andrew decided to join Yehu because of its mission of empowering rural, economically marginalized entrepreneurs through enhanced accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to pay for Dstv (digital satellite television) and renovate his video room.

loans.use: To pay for Dstv (digital satellite television) and renovate his video room.
